response: <start> its no problem . i just know what its like . i have been in this rut for a year , and i hate how many people are in the same , if not a worse position . do not kill yourself . all the things that made you happy in the past , that can still happen . it takes time and effort , and a lot of it , but believe me when i say its worth living . its difficult to just get out of bed . but if you start turning depression into like , a source of motivation , it can help . x b for example we are all depressed , that is why we are here , but we do not want to stay here . i remember when i was happy although i do not remember the feeling . i do not care what you do , just do not give up . x b i have split my brain and depression into two separate entities . try doing that . it helps me see and think clearer . <end>

title: <start> chronically depressed years i feel pathetic , but am finding small victories in my daily routine lately . <end>
response: <start> it is nice when people give us compliments . we have to learn to love ourselves . do things we love , meet new people , wake up early get a workout in . do not watch any negative news , get your mind in grateful state and attack the day . something about the first few hours of the day that are the quietest and most rewarding <end>

title: <start> sick of being sad and lonely <end>
response: <start> dude , i am terribly sorry for how things have happened and i can not even fathom how much it must hurt to have had it constantly in your face . but for now , there is the positive that you will no longer have to face it daily . and believe me , as soon as something is out of sight , it slowly but surely gets out of your mind . i can only assume that you are feeling the weight of the expectations you had for your senior year crushing you when you compare it to what actually happened , but still . experiences never quite live up to expectations . as for the decision you made about this girl , you can only take it as experience . i will not say things happen for a reason but i will say that you should not beat yourself up for the decision you made at the time . it was done upon what you thought you knew about her , and in the end you did it to protect yourself , which is not inherently wrong . the way i look at it , is that you would have never known that it was wrong until you did it . and that means you only can do better in the future . and hey , working out and having a business in high school are no small feat , specially taking in account everything that was running through your head at the same time . believe me . for now at least you can say that if another girl like her comes along , you will not let yourself wall up , and actually try , even if it ends up hurting . you are going to do great things kid . and it is more than ok to feel depressed , especially after everything has come and gone and you can actually look back on it , but do not do anything rash . in life there are only two things that are a definite , death and change . so i really hope you await the next wave of change . godspeed , and trust in change . <end>

title: <start> feeling like there is no way out <end>
response: <start> this sounds beyond really tough my father was a psychiatrist who suffered with depression and anxiety his whole life i have lived with depression and anxiety all my life , but probably never to the degree and length that you describe if you have the means , i would look into a deep brain stimulator i know it sounds barbaric , but it has transformed many lives agoraphobics who now have significant others and take hours to get ready and convince themselves to leave the house are cured i know this is a long shot , but i read a little bit about a lady who was cured with this device that had it placed in boston one thing i do know , is you matter and your life is significant , and just being is enough downshifting in to survival mode until you get better is ok and you are admirable for reaching out keep soldiering in the fight i think sometimes words can not help and anything i say does not do justice to what you are having to go through but , i hope you find relief soon i believe it will happen . . . . stay curious about different ways that alleviate mood and maybe something will give you some traction with much admiration for difficult fight , good on ya for battling , cheers , me . <end>

response: <start> the deep brain stimulator is not ect or the sessions where you go for deep brain stimulation now i know this may be a last resort i do not know if your close to the point of trying something like this , but a battery is implanted that is connected to wires that implant into your brain they map your brain and see the area that needs stimulation and connect the wires to deliver the electricity to those areas they turn it on and set it from anywhere between millivolts i think this is correct most people start at a if it works , people get immediate relief it stays on all the time i think some turn it off when they go to sleep do not know if your ready for this drastic of a procedure , but the article i read seemed very promising keep up your good work o . <end>

title: <start> i keep wishing something would happen that would put me in the hospital , which is stupid , but i can not help the thoughts <end>
response: <start> hi first , i am sorry you feel this way . the type of loneliness that comes from feeling unnoticed or not cared for by your friends and family is so painful . it is so important to feel wanted as human beings , that when we do not get that feeling , we can go to some real dark places . i would say that it is not unhealthy to think the way you are describing it is actually probably a sign that you are brain is functioning , socially , at a normal level , because it understands that it is missing something in the relationships you have . it sounds like a pretty reasonable coping mechanism , to me . what is not healthy is that you do not feel validated or cared for in your relationships . that one is harder to address , for you and for someone over the internet . you deserve friends who care about you and listen to you , and you deserve to feel fulfilled by your relationships with others . if the people around you can not do that for you , i would say those are not not healthy friendships , and perhaps taking steps to find better relationships would be a good place to start i know easier said than done . if the fantasies stem from a desire for people to care about you , but you feel unnerved by the content , you could try to imagine scenarios in which you do good things for your friends that make them pay attention , such as saving them from a speeding car or taking care of them while they are sick . i do not know if that would help , but it might be an interesting thing to try . bottom line is that i do not think there is anything wrong with you , besides some friends who seem not to treat you right . i hope you find some genuine friends , the kind you deserve , and in the mean time , i hope you do not beat yourself up too bad about your brain s coping mechanisms . it is allyl good edit if there is any chance of you seeing a professional counselor , therapist , whoever , please take it it can potentially change your life in a really good way . <end>

response: <start> www , thank you . this is a really nice reply . i do have the fantasizing in which i am the good guy helper as well as this stuff , but the thing is my friends already appreciate me in that sense . i just changed schools and this year has been my most successful social year it is more like i feel i can not talk to them , and then that manifests into the other thing . but self awareness is not enough to just make the feeling go away . i went to extensive anxiety therapy that worked like a charm , but when we got onto the topic of depression it did not really work . my mom also decided that i was cured and i agreed to end the therapy , because alongside singing classes it amounted to a lot of muns . my mom is very caring , but she is also a hotheaded know it all that believes she is always right . she is very opinionated , and it is hard to approach her with this stuff because i have no idea how she will react . a few years ago i told her i was depressed , i got yelled at for threatening her with suicide a few years later and alongside the therapist i told her , and she was all oh my bunny why did not you tell me i will always be here for you . sorry for the tangent basically what i am saying is my friends do care , but people my age do not really know what to do with that stuff . i do have one friend who is always the sweetest person in the world and cares when i say hey , i am feeling down . people do care even if they do not know how to reply , or they think it is a joke , but for some reason i can not let go of the thought that everyone hates me . and as an example a very , very close friend blamed it on age when i approached her with it , but we are really good friends and love spending time together . i do not know where i am going with this i am tired but thank you you are very kind <end>

response: <start> the way people treat us often has more to do with how they feel about themselves and not how they feel about you . a decent man will not care about your weight and he will see all the wonderful things your personality has to offer it all sounds cliche but it is so incredibly important that you do not base your worth on how others have treated you . i know that does not really make it better but it is the best advice i can offer . <end>

response: <start> i get it . it is just that we are social beings and i feel like no one really does well in isolation , never having physical touch . i am so starved for it and so lonely . i guess some people can be happy without a partner or sex but i really want those things in my life . i have great friends , a good job , close family , and i was doing really well this spring . it is just that romantic love is this giant hole in my life . i feel like i can connect with people for friendships just fine but no one wants me romantically and it just really sucks . just being rejected by someone i really like has thrown me for a loop . my coworkers have been telling me i look sad . i feel cheated out of a normal life because of depression . i have missed out in normal things that everyone enjoys from prom date pictures , bringing someone home to meet the family , someone to come home to at night , to going to couples parties and not being the only single person out of ppl , and instead met with judgement from people in my life and society . its really hard not to assume the worse about myself bec of the way i have been treated . i was harassed really bad growing up and senior year of hs i had to eat lunch in the bathroom clot bc all my friends rejected me . in college i watched my new friends go on dates and get boyfriends . now i am watching as they plan their future kids names and i am still sitting by the sidelines . <end>

title: <start> year old male , why am i depressed . . . . <end>
response: <start> depression has a range of causes and a range of effects , the most prominent being the chemical side . it is likely due to some unforeseen because that you are experiencing a severe lack of serotonin . video games are not a drug like the media claims but the feeling of success just by doing something you can believe is productive or healthy like running will have a placebo effect on your body . if this still persists i would recommend taking a light antidepressant . you are in the early stages , and the fact you have highlighted it means you can stop it in the early stages . <end>

response: <start> yeah i know video games are not actually a drug , but the way i describe me playing video games to my therapist i basically tell him it is the only escape that i have from my constant headaches , my fatigue , and a majority of my other symptoms . when i play my games , i am my normal self . and when i quit i want to figure out when the next time i can play again . and my friends are always testing me , telling me to get on and play with them . so to me , playing video games is my drug , just like how some people turn to alcohol when they are feeling upset . except my drug is not as dangerous then real drugs . i am on lexapro mg , emerson mg , and those seem to help with my anxiety and sleep issues , but not my overall depression . i still wake up sad , and a constant headaches . it is just lexapro tends to ease my anxiety over my depression , and then emerson helps me sleep at night . <end>

title: <start> i want to die is the only thought my brain has <end>
response: <start> first of all thank you for sharing because it takes a lot of bravery if you start shutting down with depression your mind and your body start going toward death and all your actions do reflect that in one way or another . isolation , digging yourself in deeper because that hole will be your grave . you know that hole and its boundaries so it gives safety but its still dark and shitty . you see this if you find yourself outside of it one day it does not mather if other people would make it better or worse in your life and its so common in depressive people to feel guilt over good resources and people helping generally anything good in their life . if you want it or not good things happen to you in all the shit so why not take a time off feeling guilty and try to at least not hate yourself for it . one day you might use these things as tools once you see them as such . fear makes you go back in the hole and the hole makes you afraid of the world around it . get help dear stranger to overcome the paralysing effect of fear . its choking the best side of you i can really recommend jordan petersen canadian professor of psychology he breaks stuff down to understandable levels where i am sometimes wondering why i did not see it all these years . talk to us , we care not only are you anonymous but also a person . <end>

title: <start> panic attack questions <end>
response: <start> panic attacks vary for everyone some people think they are dying or having a heart attack . i have never had that , but i did feel extremely intense anxiety that i was unable to control . i think for anyone , you will be unable to think clearly , your veratrate and breathing will increase , and you will feel out of control . sometimes , a panic attack will hit suddenly , and other times your anxiety will slowly get worse and worse . what helps this is also highly individual . focus on things that make you feel safe or calm . for me , i like to be alone and in the dark lights off at night under covers . i like to sit in corners and feel the solid walls against me . i listen to music that is soothing not necessarily calm music , but something that soothes you for me , it is my favorite songs , mostly classic rock . i think what is important is that it is familiar and or helps express or validate the emotions you are feeling . after i had my first panic attack , i made a playlist and a short list of things to do . it can be really hard to think or focus during a panic attack , so make it very simple . for example . stop . take a deep breath in your mouth and out your nose . . go to a bathroom or an empty room . shut the door . sit down on the toilet , on the floor , whatever . take deep , slow breaths in your nose and out your mouth . . listen to your music . take as much time as you need . obviously , customize this to you . while i like to be alone , other people feel better getting a hug or feel safer being with others . another thing , and this is hard to explain , but it helps to ride it out . remind yourself that your body is having an extreme stress reaction , often with no clearly identifiable reason trigger . close your eyes . focus on your breathing . it will be over soon . one last thing it does not really matter if you are having a full panic attack or just intense anxiety . they are both horrible , and the self care for it can be the same . i am sorry you are going through this , and i hope you feel better . <end>

title: <start> thinking i might kill myself . <end>
response: <start> i am sorry that really sucks , if people treat you that way find new people . maybe join a support group to help with how you are feeling . but do not take your own life . even if it feels like hell now , you have a profound impact on people around you . doing something like that would tear apart the people who truly care about you . i am not normally much help , i am here for my own problems , but life is about working through the things that make life hell . sometimes there may not be hope in sight but people understand what you are going through , and what it means to end it all . i believe that you will pull through . i hope this helps . please just talk to people , work through it . i believe in you . <end>

title: <start> does talk therapy actually help <end>
response: <start> absolutely . i first went to therapy as a teen under . i was not there by choice and did not want to participate . i felt like it was pointless , i did not matter , i was never going to get better anyway , etc . for the first few sessions i answered with single words , i am fine , etc or just laid with my head in my arms on the table . it took me a long time , but i got to a point where i was participating in therapy and it definitely helped . therapy is a long , slow process , but it has made a huge difference in my life . while talk therapy in general is good for getting things off your chest , cut cognitive behavioral therapy is what will help you the most . it is not so much a therapist just saying something that helps , but helping you restructure your thinking patterns and how you view yourself . i will also say this you are worth it . it is always worth bringing up with your doctor . this is a chance to feel better . and sometimes it takes a few tries to find a good therapist , but it is never a waste of time , because it is a step towards finding the right therapist and starting to feel better . also , most therapists will chat with you on the phone briefly to help you get a feel and see if they could be a match . feel free to pm me or comment if you want any advice for finding a therapist or anything else . i have an unfortunate amount of experience with finding therapists and psychiatrists . <end>

title: <start> i am tired . <end>
response: <start> hi friend . college is a huge change and it introduces a lot of stress . being homesick and overwhelmed for a little while until you get your footing is normal . but if it is lasted this long and you feel this exhausted , it is time to get help . there is likely a free counseling service at your university . start there . you do not need anybody s permission for it and you do not have to commit to anything if you are uncomfortable . but talking to someone really helps you get a new perspective on how you are feeling . i have been using this app called moonpath . it asks you how you are feeling three times a day and you can use it to track how you are feeling and see trends . it has helped me identify some of the causes of my episodes . and at the very least , a robot checks up on me every day . good luck . you have got this . <end>

title: <start> has anyone benefited from good books that help manage depression <end>
response: <start> i picked up a copy of dr . daniel amen s change your brain and saw the concept of automatic negative thoughts . that was a key element in figuring it all out and developing a way out of my depression . he has since become very commercial with his spect therapy . i also just read listened to running is my therapy by scott douglas . the science in that book is nicely packaged and palatable . i am a runner , and now understand how engaging in a physical activity helped me put my depression in the past . <end>

title: <start> f struggling with depression and feeling hopeless . i feel like i have no one to talk to . any advice <end>
response: <start> not all counsellors are good or are a good fit with a client . perhaps you would consider giving another therapist a try . do not worry about wasting your parents money , if they are good parents their daughter s happiness will be a priority . <end>

title: <start> not all counsellors are good or are a good fit with a client . perhaps you would consider giving another therapist a try . do not worry about wasting your parents money , if they are good parents their daughter s happiness will be a priority . <end>
response: <start> i had the opposite problem at your age , just did not know it yet . i had a shrink that did not have my best interests in mind but a therapist that i actually went back to some years after ceasing seeing him after i was off my parents insurance . x b i had anxiety so bad when i was ish that my throat muscles were too tight for me to eat , i would try and eat and just gag . i was skin and bone . now i am old and married and have a dad bod . i guess i am telling you this to tell you you can and will get better . hell i even had a long distance of too , but back then it was more frowned on . anyway , i got to the point with my counselor that i would have trouble staying awake because i would get so relaxed , you deserve that . if you were diabetic would you feel guilty about needing insulin x b one thing you do have going for you , is that you appear to want to get better . i was in a support group in high school for depression anxiety a lot of the other kids in it refused to take their meds , would bail on their appointments etc . that is wasting resources , that is not what you are doing . x b yes i am sure your friends are family are busy , and the social anxiety makes it harder to ask but you have to tell people what you need . communicate , maybe write it out if you have to like you did here . x b edit sorry , thought of another thing you could do . why exactly did your previous counselor not help what would have made the experience more helpful were you not comfortable with them <end>

response: <start> thank you so much i am sorry you had to go through that , the fact that you live a happy and healthy life now is very inspiring . props to you i think the main issue with my counselor was that i was uncomfortable talking to her , then again it was my first time opening up about my problems . when we did end up discussing things , all she said was that i have a mental illness , and we can work on it , but never how to work on it . acknowledging the issue has made my anxiety and depression more bearable , but it feels like i am putting a band aid on a broken bone , if that makes sense . x b thank you for your advice i will try to discuss this with my mom and see if i can see a new counselor . along with that , my boyfriend has asked me if i am interested in taking medication for depression or cod oil for my anxiety . my fear with both of those is that they will make my symptoms worse . i have heard of the bad side effects that can come with medication , and about a year ago i went to get a tooth pulled and was given some sort of drug , probably laughing gas , and my body felt so over relaxed that it gave me a panic attack . i also worry that i will have the same experience with a new counselor . i guess my question is , is seeing a counselor the best thing i can do or is there another way i appreciate your insight <end>

title: <start> boyfriend m has depression and i f do not know if cheering him up through chat works . <end>
response: <start> there is two things in what you are saying i think . the first part is , should you tell him he matters to you etc . so yes , in answer to that . yep , it is really important for people to know they are loved , and even though he may not feel it sometimes , you making the effort , repeatedly , over time , is likely to be having a positive effect . the second part about cheering him up on not so sure about . yes , it certainly is great to have the intent to help alleviate someone s pain , but with depression , when it is bad , you can cheer squad as much as you can manage , but you have to be also ready for the very real possibility it will not have any positive effect on his mood whatsoever . that is no reflection on you , or the quality of your efforts , but depression can stand squarely in the way of all that stuff and neutralise it with monotonous regularity . do not be disappointed if you do not see a result . i think i am saying you keep doing you you seem like a lovely supportive caring person . keep doing that , but do not have any expectation that the mood will shift when it is bad . if it does , that is great . if it does not , that is just how it is and best just to hang in there , take care of yourself it is not easy being in a relationship with someone who is feeling very depressed particularly if it goes on for a long time so do your own self care , and hope for the best , but do not expect anything to shift because that may lead to disappointment . hope it helps . hope things get better for you both soon . good luck . <end>

title: <start> life crises <end>
response: <start> there is no hard and fast rule because there are no best antidepressants since they do not work the same on every person . most people i know who have taken them went through different ones before they found one that actually worked for them . x b bear in mind that antidepressants are neither a cure all nor do they fix some of the root causes of depression . a lot of them have significant side effects , including but not limited to weight gain and or loss of libido . x b speaking only for myself here , what has helped me way , way more is reaching out to people who care about me , making new friends , getting fresh air , journaling , and self help books . it is not a perfect solution , it takes time , patience and effort but popping pills for the rest of my life is not my idea of a solution th unless it is absolutely necessary , you have tried everything else and or it is lifesaving . <end>

title: <start> i want to be heard <end>
response: <start> i am so sorry you feel that way . you will be out of there eventually and you will not have to deal with the toxicity , but in the meantime you can still look into getting help . you are an adult , you need neither their permission nor their approval to do so . there are services , often free , available to help you feel better . if nothing else , please know that the suicide hotline has a wetchet so you do not even have to worry about being overheard on the phone . depression has nothing to do with being you being grateful , they just do not want to accept that the things you have experienced have had such an impact . it is scary to think about so it gets swept under the rug like oh stop with the hormones you are fine . sometimes it is not hormones and your not fine . it is okay to feel that way and it is never an insult to your family if you need help , it is insensitive of them to suggest that . maybe they are just not great at empathy and do not know what to say . i am sorry you feel alone and like no one is taking you seriously right now , if you want to talk privately we can . i hope things sort themselves out before too much longer . <end>

title: <start> have i reached rock bottom <end>
response: <start> hey , a little advice about the drug use . do not attempt to quit when you are this fragile . i am an addict months clean today whoop whoop and spent years thinking if i just got clean , my mental health would improve . i had it the wrong way around , the addiction was just a symptom of my mental health being out of whack . the addiction was not the actual problem , so me trying to attack it was futile . the problem was that i was so desperate to escape my mentally unwell mind , that i would happily ruin my life for a temporary escape . be kind to yourself with your drug use , for now at least . recognize that you are trying to hide from pain and that there is nothing wrong with wanting to hide from pain . just start looking at healthier ways to address it , without beating yourself up when you get high . most of what kept me in the addiction loop was the shame guilt worthlessness that i would get when i failed yet again . do not get stuck in that loop , you are allowed to have weaknesses have you been tested for bipolar i only ask as hypersexuality and drug use are massive red flags . i was misdiagnosed with depression until very recently . the diagnosis never felt fully correct to me . not saying you have hypersexuality , but you seem to have done things that do not line up with your moral code character and that is a big indicator . you also talk about rock bottom , which can be easily obsessed over if you have had manic highs the contrast seems more in your face . also , sorry to say but you probably have not hit rock bottom . i would say i have not either , we are just too young . the thing is , your life might be going brilliant then bam depression comes and sucks the life from you . rock bottom could be when you should be the happiest . my worst depression so far came at a time when every aspect of my life was exactly how i would always dreamed . but every part of my being wanted to die . fucked up right . then i have had times where i should be in my darkest hour , but had some weird strength and resilience keeps me going . do not worry about whether this is rock bottom , worry about what you can learn to use for the next onslaught . knowledge is power after all <end>

response: <start> thanks for your input , it is greatly appreciated . i have too questioned whether it is just mad or bipolar disorder . i always rule out being bipolar because i take so many uppers coke and add pretty regularly , and usually when i display signs if mania . i have not been sober for so long that i honestly can not decipher the difference . i have been to multiple psychiatrist and therapist , i figured they would have diagnosed me properly . but maybe not . i have done a lot of research on both disorders . because google and self diagnosis are the way to go obviously . low i never considered that maybe i am experiencing episodes of mania , which then lead to me being hypersexual and doing drugs . thanks for putting that into perspective . since being in ok i have checked myself into a psych hospital once and attempted to start back on ability and veleta . but unfortunately since doing coke i stopped taking my meds . i completely agree that deciding to coke is a direct result of my mental health being out of whack . i realize that i enjoy the temporary feelings of euphoria and happiness . i know that i will not stop doing it until i get on some sort of meds to even out this chemical imbalance and remove myself from having access to it until i safely go through withdrawal . which is why i considered checking back into a hospital for a couple of weeks . thank you for the reminder to go easy on myself when it comes to doing it . but as you know it is a never ending cycle of beating myself up for doing it and rationalizing that it is okay it is just the depression causing it low . i hate that the only time i feel okay is while in high on uppers . i almost went to the point of trying to get prescribed add . thank god i did not . as far as rock bottom , i agree to a point . i say i hit rock bottom because i reached the point of getting addicted to meth . that for me i probably the worst thing i have ever done . i was on it for about three weeks . it was the best high i have ever experienced next to dot i only stopped because i started experiencing psychosis with body tremors . which lead my dumb ass to go to the dr only to be completely embarrassed and judged and told that it is normal just wait it out . i was treated like any other junky which was a really shitty feeling . i see why people do not reach out for help . anyways , since response: <start> do you get on couture much there is a guy there named cg kid and he helped me so much in putting my drug use into perspective . his personality and non judge vibe is a fucking breath of fresh air too i am not sure if he still does it , but he used to offer text counselling coaching to people . may help i missed the part about you doing meth initially . be careful with that drug , it is the devil in disguise as your best friend . you will eventually get used to being so high , that real life will bore the fuck out of you . your brain chemistry will take a massive beating too . i am not judging you though , i think anyone in the right circumstances would get hooked on it . since you are in the early phase , watch cg kids take on meth , he will change your mind as he will tell you where it leads . not just how good it feels at the beginning i think i initially came off as dismissive about you hitting rock bottom , sorry . i more meant that you have only lived like of your life , so statistically it could still happen . i got caught up in the idea of rock bottom . when i thought i had reached it , i took it as comfort that it would never get that bad again . but then it fucking did . so the disappointment from that made me spiral even more . my intent was the steer your focus away from that , so you do not have expectations that can be broken in the future . do you have a safety plan like , let us say right now you lost your home and your job . what would you do who can you call . write that shit down , call up friends family and explain how things are and if you can rely on them in case of emergency . then include them in the plan . being vulnerable and asking for help is a sign of strength of character . if someone judges you for it , then they were not really looking out for your best interests were they if you come up with a plan now , it will help you take a logical and safe course of action if things go south . depression has a way of taking away logic and rational behavior . write down phone numbers of local charities and shelters , so you can have a backup backup plan . if you have pets , do you have anyone who could take care of them etc . get this stuff out of the way now , so your mental resources can be dedicated to fixing a problem should it arise i gather you are in america do you have some kind of unemployment scheme for sick people if so , look into the requirements for that . in my country i am lucky enough to have had that safety net when i had a breakdown , resulting in me quitting my job and becoming housebound for a while . i really do hope your country has something similar . having time to heal is so important and it pains me to hear you have to put rent above your mental health . i guess people do it clot in society anyway , but when you have a mental illness that could result in your death the stakes get raised a bit . if you do not have a social security system that allows for sickness payments , are there charities that do perhaps you could volunteer there or something . surely a first world country can look after its sick people right as for the bipolar thing , do not let me put ideas into your head . it is just something to file away and keep in mind . i actually was in denial at first , when i got diagnosed . depression seemed like a simpler label , so i was reluctant to let go . i did not even look at bipolar symptoms , as i was scared if it confirmed my diagnosis . boy did it smack me in the face when i did read them , i ticked every box . what i am trying to say is , we are biased as fuck and should never be trusted to put weight into a diagnosis . let the psych do that . but , if you have suspicions and the psych dismisses them you should possibly try someone else . <end>

title: <start> finally admitting it and calling out for help <end>
response: <start> hey brother , i m felt like i just read my own experience of life for the past few years . i have a highly addictive personality so i tend to use substances to cope with my negative emotions , often alone . my relationships with others , people i really care about , have dissolved into them just tolerating my presence it seems . i have developed severe anxiety from all of this , and its making me even more lonely than i need to be . it starts with reaching out for professional help , it will give you the tools and knowledge you need to rework your thinking and approach life a little more consciously . but beyond even that , you have to have hope and compassion for yourself . imagine that you are taking of a child , and that child is hurting deeply . take care yourself , man . you deserve to be free of pain , you deserve happiness again . <end>

title: <start> i do not feel anything <end>
response: <start> i am very sorry that you are experiencing this . it is a rough place to be . are you able to get in to see a doctor meds do not help everyone but they can be a good place to start if the chemicals in your brain are not functioning the best so you can do the things you need to do to get better . i still fall into my pit . i get suicidal and i get numb like you are describing . i am not sure if i am the best person to answer this but i will list some things that have helped decrease the amount of time i spend in my pit . for reference , i dropped out of college because i did not know who to turn to for help and i would spend weeks lying on the floor of my apartment before my mind would let me leave . this was around . now days , i spend about to days in my pit before i am able to crawl out and try to live life again . . reading . mainly about stoicism , buddhism , meditation , cognitive behavioral therapy , and borderline personality disorder . . exercise . i prefer weights to cardo but try and do both . i am not that consistent and can go weeks without working out . . eating less sugar . when i get in my whole i do not want to cook so i will go buy frozen meals and convenience shit like instant oatmeal and yogurt . not the best but better than my preferred meals of droits and sugar cookies . . this one is big and this one is tough . finding someone who will remind me of all these things when i am in my pit and start lying to myself that i am not making progress and i am worthless . it is hard to do on your own but it can be done . more in . . journal . good and bad . when you feel up go back and challenge the down thoughts . prove to yourself that that the depression is a lying sack of shit in any way you can . for me , this helps subconsciously i think . when i drop , i will swear up and down that none of the above is true or worth it . i will find any and every thought the proves what i fuck up i am , but i have noticed that there is a small voice that is fighting back . . practice patience and kindness with yourself . super hard as well but worth it . i am still learning this . i do not have tips for this one . . podcast have helped me when no one is around . i know i have one person . one friend . i have pushed everyone else away . i tried to push him away yesterday but he fights for me . however he can not be there all the time . right now i am binging new mindset , who dis by case kenny . love it . . cannabis . it gives me panic attacks if i smoke too much . but the pros out weigh the cons for me . out of all the anti depression and anti psychotics i have taken , it works the best for me . i want to try micro dosing lsd or rooms in the future . or to go on a therapeutic trip with a seasoned guide . these are in no particular order . i am by no means an authority or cured in any way . i could drop into my pit tomorrow and swear to you that a car crash off the bridge is the way to go , but today , right now , my mind is settled and i realize that the slow and snail like progress i have made is working . i wish you the best and i hope you find some coping strategies that will work for you and your future self . much love and sending hugs from the midwest . edit also wanted to say even a baby step is still a step . just try and focus on one baby step at time . try , hard for me , to focus on doing that one baby step until it is done . <end>

title: <start> am i a failure <end>
response: <start> you are not a failure . i am about your age and in a pretty similar situation living with my parents . sometimes life throws us into scenarios that do not match where we think we should be . there are a lot of other young people also still living with family out there . it is really really expensive to live independently these days , way worse than when our parents were our age . i have a reasonably good paying job for someone who never went to college but i live in a pretty expensive metropolitan area so when i move out i will still have to have roommates . my girlfriend makes two dollars more an hour than i do and has her own studio but she can not afford furniture for now . you are not a failure , things are just crazy broken economically right now . you are not in this situation because you did the wrong thing . <end>

title: <start> i feel so useless and just want to hurt myself <end>
response: <start> i know you are not asking for advice , but i thought i might throw some out there in case you are interested in stopping . i have also struggled with this a lot in the past and have finally been self harm free for months self harm is extremely addictive and it is very difficult to stop cold turkey . however , there are things you can do to help ween yourself off of it . first , throw your sharp object away . sure you can find something else to cut with , but it will create a barrier so that you can not do it as instantly . second , set an alarm for minutes when you have the urge . you could journal , listen to more uplifting music , or get some fresh air during that time . notice if your urge decreases or stays the same . after that minutes passes , you can then make your decision of what you want to do . lastly , use alternative less harmful ways to act on the urge . holding ice or snapping a rubber band on your skin can induce that same pain without bleeding or scarring . i hope this helps <end>

response: <start> i did sessions of tm prior to the ect and saw no improvement . personally , i am not sure how much the ect helped me , but my husband says he has seen a huge difference in me . i think it is a combination of my art and my faith that has pulled me out of my depression . it was severe . i had lost lbs in a short period of time and was even wanting to end my life . i also came to the realization that there were very few treatment options left for my mad so i was determined that the ect was going to work . i did not experience any side effects from the procedure itself , except i am a hard stick so getting an iv for the anesthesia each time was horrific . the doctor would alternate between my hands and they would bruise . that and getting there at am were the worst parts . <end>

response: <start> people are not the products of their actions solely , just as you wanted to win her heart , she turned her back on you in her time of need . neither of you did this purely because you wanted to . you could not handle the rejection , and it was a hard time during your life . crushes are usually positive regardless of the outcome they strive for us to be a better version of ourselves . it was great that you were able to confess , and great of her to turn you down kindly . but just like how you struggled with rejection , she struggled with the thought of you attempting suicide . it is clear she is a great person , and she was upset by the fact you nearly died . she could of felt like she failed and had to externalise that failure by blaming you . she would care if you died , and it is likely that caring for you is what made her say such things . suicide is never the committers fault with depression , but it can seem selfish to friends and family even when it is not . <end>

title: <start> on my own now <end>
response: <start> depression and suicidal ideation is like a deep hole that feels impossible to climb out , especially if it is part of your identity . something that helped me a lot was thinking about qualities that i valued . think about the kind of life you want to live . what kind of person do you want to be it might be that depression has been attached to you for a long time , so thinking about yourself in a different way can feel very odd . practice envisioning a life worth living as they call it in therapy . create a list of values you see yourself having in the future if you were able to overcome your depression . for example , mine are honesty , connection , authenticity , generosity , kindness , and open mindedness . hopefully this can help you see a different point of view on life and who you are . after that , you can start finding activities that align with your values which will help lift your mood and sense of purpose . it is wunna be a long journey , but i can promise you that things will get better . <end>

title: <start> i do not feel like myself anymore <end>
response: <start> hey there , it seems like you have the early to mid symptoms , and it seems as though you suffer from a lack of serotonin combined with social anxiety and a deep fear of possible further mental issues . the fact that you are well aware of the dangers of depression is a good sign however . aggression from such a high dosage of aloft is natural , and as you appear to need the dosage , and i do not have a medical degree , i would not advise going off it . i am sorry to hear about the assault , and some events will always be difficult regardless of how you handle them . the fact you reported your step brother and protected yourself is great , and while it will be a hard thing for your father to realise , he can not deny it . it was your step brother s fault , not yours . your boyfriend sounds like a great guy and i am sure he will stay with you regardless , so even if you feel like your family may alienate you , he will be there to protect you . other than just comforting , your mental state is probably the biggest concern . focus on the things you love , such as your boyfriend and kids , and you will likely find yourself more preoccupied . try to distract yourself any times you feel empty , and remember that depression works by distancing you from many emotions . find a hobby or try to relax , and find something you find a real sense of accomplishment in . for me it was looking after my baby niece as if she was my own , actually going outside , chatting to friends , and listening to overly dramatic music that drowned out any emptiness . you ever want to talk , just message me <end>

title: <start> what are things an so can do to help alleviate your depression <end>
response: <start> i think the best thing you can offer him is patience . i have been the depressed partner in the past , and i think it might benefit you to ask him a few questions on a good day for him , like what makes you feel supported can you tell me about some things people have done in the past that have made you feel worse i also sincerely recommend that you seek out a therapist for yourself if you see this relationship as something that could potentially be long term , or , if you so is currently in therapy which i hope he is , you might ask if he would like you to join him for a few sessions so you can discuss this together in a mediated environment . i did this with a partner and it was very , very helpful . good luck . you seem very thoughtful , but please do not forget that ultimately you are not culpable for his feelings , his illness , or his wellness . <end>

title: <start> what to do if you think someone might be depressed <end>
response: <start> always be more upfront and honest . it may end up being uncomfortable for everyone involved , but it will always get you moving in right direction , the fastest . avoid being overly pushy , but i have dark moments very often and if a friend were to ask me if something was wrong or if i was feeling bad , i would either be dismissive or honest . an are you sure might break through to me , but anything more and i would get tense and more distant . you definitely want to discuss the context of the depression before trying to work on it . my advice otherwise is just be patient , be honest and be there for your cousin as much as you can . <end>

title: <start> my story <end>
response: <start> hi there , it is likely you are suffering from severe high functioning mental depression , and the fact that you have requested help even anonymously is a huge step . we all have a story that we likely feel is unimportant and would be selfish to share , but the fact that you have gone to such great lengths to hide the truth from your friends and classmates is proof that this is not for attention you care about others . as you likely do not want to open up about this publicly , i will offer some tips to help deal with both the physical and social side of your depression . your depression meds will help with the lack of serotonin but your surroundings and physical state can boost both your social and mental health , as it did for me . constantly try to distract yourself if you are numb with anything emotional , such as music or films . try to ensure your surroundings are pleasant for you try to keep a somewhat tidy room and keep warm and if you feel like you are wasting your time , try to wake up earlier if you can . that feeling of success can propel you further . as for the social side , you have a choice hide it or open up . as the latter is a harder path , hiding it will be the easier choice . i have a stepped too , one who is treated me like an enemy and a threat and tried to alienate me from my family . luckily for me , that family is both large and trusts me more , and while i can not be sure if you have the same situation , distancing yourself from your abusers is a good option . try to find close friends who can truly trust to keep your secret , and they can defend you during a panic attack . try to not adopt your weaknesses socially , but defend and downplay them . good luck , talk to me some more of you need more help <end>

title: <start> how can i get diagnosed with depression <end>
response: <start> i was your age when i was diagnosed . i was embarrassed to tell my parents so i wrote a letter about it instead and handed it to my mom . after she read it , she scheduled an appointment with a doctor , who then referred me to a psychiatrist . i was put on anti depressants after meeting with the psychiatrist who confirmed my feelings and diagnosed me . you should tell your parents as they have the resources to help you since you are a minor . also , it is nothing to be ashamed about many people have depression or feel down and your parents want what is best for you and for you to be happy . i suggest if you are worried about the family friend gp to ask your parents to schedule an appointment with a different gp . <end>

title: <start> i am drowning and it is getting harder to come up for air . <end>
response: <start> i want to start by saying sorry that you feel this way . i have been struggling with depression over years now . it started very similar for me as well . i have changed my university subject times and they were all private universities . i was still living with my mother . she never complained about anything but i felt like the same . especially because my sister went to one of the best public university , she always found scholarship for her further education . i could not stop feeling like a failure and i was making it worse for my family . x b at first , i was just thinking and feeling these but still had a happy face . after a while i started drinking alcohol a lot . at time i was just thinking as having fun but it was a call for help . i started arguing with my friends . after a while they stopped calling or testing me because i was a mood killer . one night when i was out with my best friend i got really drunk and we start arguing . she said you only have friends because i am your friend but i can not stand you anymore . that was it . being drunk and what has said i think without considering too much i took painkillers to get rid of my headache . it was more than i should take . a part of me had it enough i guess . i woke my mother up telling her i am not feeling very well . we went to er . x b after that night i realised that i needed to get help . i could not cope with this anymore . so i went to see a doctor . i am still on medication because she said i have repetitive depression and it is hard to know when i can have another depression attack . i feel so much better though . i stop talking to everyone who left me alone when i was vulnerable . i talked to my family and i was very upfront about it . they are really supportive . i was also scared that everyone will treat me differently and no one will want anything to do with me . but it was not like that . at first they were more understanding if i had problems but now everything is how it used to be but i have better friends , a partner that really supports me and a family that knows i am trying my best . x b i know that everyone s experience is different but i think you should get help . your family will understand and support you . it is better to get that support than feeling that way . with friends and relationships you will find people who do not treat you like a sick child and who understands your problems . if people can not handle you at your worst they do not deserve to be with you at your best . <end>

title: <start> waiting for bad things <end>
response: <start> depression can often distort our logical senses , making us panic and feel depressed out of habit , when in reality there is nothing wrong . i remember that in psychology , they explained that the brain activates a sense of pleasure , like having an addiction , out of being sad . i have as well dealt with depression my whole life and this can often impact how we deal with our sadness , where at some degree we become addicted without noticing unconsciously . after a long time we build a predisposition to see everything go wrong or bad , but to this you must rationalize and see the logistics of the situation . i can understand that this may not be a quick process but try breathing exercises and think positively . because at the end of the day you can go two ways , you can think negatively or positively and the path that can lead us to be more productive is staying in a positive note . now l understand that is a lot different when people do not answer your calls , the world may start to take a negative aspect . making us feel even worse from the current situation that we are already confronting . but don try to jump to conclusions the mind can be very deceiving as i said before , trying to be positive can be productive along the way . i also understand your frustration when it come to other folks not helping . but unfortunately many folks do no go out of their way to help bystanders . again in psychology is call the bystander effect . but try to not center your attention on others , since these are factors that are out of control . i can understand that it may be discouraging to be alone . now , you are not the only one that struggles with these thoughts . many of us here do but its up to to us to to work towards our fears to enjoy our life once again . i had heard this quote from a game and its pretty inspirational struggle is an illusion . the only chains that bind you are the ones you accept . it maybe be a long a painful journey but soon enough you will get there , small baby steps are better than none . we believe in you and do not lose hope . <end>

title: <start> sudden feelings of emptiness , what do i do rant kinda <end>
response: <start> hello friend . so let me give you my opinion on some things . my mood constantly changes . i have been thinking about this for myself and friends and i think it is rather normal if you feel depressed but are constantly trying to get better and function properly and push forward , it is normal to experience these ups and downs . now that i write this i realise i also have to mention be careful if you are taking any medication that they are taken properly , otherwise they might because these mood swings , obviously that is a different matter i do not know how to control it . i do not think it can be controlled , you can control your actions for the most part though . no need to panic , find some things that calm you , maybe eat something do not overeat , or maybe lie down for a little while and take some time to get back into the game . this is just me talking , and i am not an expert . i think you might find other techniques , maybe it is worth looking online for some stuff . whenever i start feeling bad , whenever my mood goes down , i feel nothing . imo it is a coping mechanism sometimes better to feel nothing than feel bad . it is a nice chance to think calmly . is there any way to battle this feeling again i am not an expert but as far as i know we can not pinpoint a solution to one specific thing , even if it is different for every person . but i think you will find things cover a lot of stuff the everyday habits , especially work study and exercise . exercise will make you feel better and while it may seem only treating a symptom do not underestimate it . in the case of the depression , the symptom can also be a because , it would not be a vicious cycle otherwise . with work study there is no negotiation , you need a reason to get out of bed no matter what , and hold yourself accountable . talking therapy either to help put some of your thoughts in order or even discuss philosophically about things that might be getting you down . it does not have to be a therapist , it can be friends and family , but if you feel a therapist might help do not hesitate in any way . medication i guess it is just true our feelings depend on chemistry so it is not so bad to get a boost if needed . always on advice of a medical professional of course . recently , my desire to selfward has been on the rise , too . i started selfharming more than a year ago and currently i was almost three weeks clean . was . i was beating my legs for a while . again i will say it is to be expected wanting to self harm on some really bad days . but if you ask me , it is simply , wrong . it does not help anything , it only adds more problems . i will not even try to argue about this . like , if i try i guess i can imagine some very few people with an extreme and rare mental condition may resort to this and may need serious help to stop . but i would assume this is not the case with you . just do not do it . i do not know how else to say it . hit a pillow or something . not yourself . i do my hobbies almost everyday , i try my hardest to go outside and communicate with people that is good . it might not be enough , actually it obviously is not . but that does not mean you are wrong by doing these things . you managed to not abandon your hobbies and not isolate yourself , that is actually really really important . keep it up . this feeling keeps coming back again and again . it might disappear immediately . or it might take some time . do not give up . x b i hope some stuff i wrote were helpful . if not i am sorry but feel free to reply to this if you want . <end>

title: <start> sudden , crippling depression amp what to do <end>
response: <start> so , behavioral conditioning is what i have been really trying . it is kind of literally changing the way i react to things naturally . at first , it sucks real bad . after awhile it is starts to feel like a chore , then , it becomes habit . for example , i used to get really sad when i would see some couple out in public holding hands or having a good time . so i would change my behavior , instead of embracing how sad i was , i asked myself questions about , why are you sad well i wish i had that in my life . why can not you i do not know . sounds like you are the only one in your way then after a while the narrative changes , like i am going to go talk to that human , they seem to be into the same music as i am be sure to keep it casual people can have just as much anxiety socially as you thanks reconditioned brain i dunno if this helps , and i am pretty sure i just ousted myself as a weirdo who has voices . haha i promise i do not . but really what it comes down to is sticking with a plan . what ever you and your therapist comes up with , and keeping yourself accountable . therapy and meds are a help to return to a healthy life , but it is up to you to get back to living . if i can elaborate on my incoherent thoughts , let me know . <end>

title: <start> so , behavioral conditioning is what i have been really trying . it is kind of literally changing the way i react to things naturally . at first , it sucks real bad . after awhile it is starts to feel like a chore , then , it becomes habit . for example , i used to get really sad when i would see some couple out in public holding hands or having a good time . so i would change my behavior , instead of embracing how sad i was , i asked myself questions about , why are you sad well i wish i had that in my life . why can not you i do not know . sounds like you are the only one in your way then after a while the narrative changes , like i am going to go talk to that human , they seem to be into the same music as i am be sure to keep it casual people can have just as much anxiety socially as you thanks reconditioned brain i dunno if this helps , and i am pretty sure i just ousted myself as a weirdo who has voices . haha i promise i do not . but really what it comes down to is sticking with a plan . what ever you and your therapist comes up with , and keeping yourself accountable . therapy and meds are a help to return to a healthy life , but it is up to you to get back to living . if i can elaborate on my incoherent thoughts , let me know . <end>
response: <start> i really resonate with so much that you wrote here . especially that therapy and or meds can help you return to a healthy lifestyle but it is up to you to get back to really living . i feel like that is something i tend to lose sight of when i fall into a deeper depressive episode . last week , when i saw my doctor when things were getting worse , she asked what do you like to do for fun and it broke my heart that i legitimately could not come up with a genuine answer . that spark of really living is so hard to tend to with depression sometimes . that was a little aside . but i do agree that the little voice in your head that questions things like what is holding you back from xyz is so important . it empowers me to get out of bed some days realizing that i have more power over this than depression makes me feel like i do . or what is keeping you from running xyz errand oh , anxiety about other people and what they might think well they can and will have their opinion about me , but that should not stop me from living my life and getting out . does that even make sense i was just spiralling off of what you said and what it brought to mind for me . thanks for listening to my also incoherent thoughts . <end>

title: <start> i have reached my lowest point to date and have no clue how to cope . <end>
response: <start> wow , i went through an incredibly similar situation last year . after getting help support of the subedit i am doing much better . i would thought i would visit the subedit today to try and repay the debt i feel i owe . honestly shocked to how similar my situation was to yours . i had small barely noticeable tremors my whole life which progressed to essential tremors . i was a wreck , it felt as if someone pulled a rug from under my life . my identity was gone , i could not write any more , could not play guitar , i had to quit my job , dumped from a long term relationship , i had to leave school due to depression and , had to move back with my emotionally abuse mother . it fucking sucked . i was absolutely miserable , angry and , stuck . i can not begin to imagine how debilitating myotonia is . and i hate to compare something benign like tremors to it . but they grinded my life to a halt , just like yours , had to live in less than preferred conditions with less than ideal means . you have to give yourself a chance to breathe . you have not failed life , not even close . imagine going through such terrible tribulations and coming out of it that is not a story of failure that is one of success , great success . you will come out of this so incredibly strong that every difficult situation following this will be a walk in the park . when home gets unbearable , take a step outside and go for a walk to get privacy and the time to collect your thoughts . now , if it is too painful to walk around for too long try to find a nearby spot to get away from it all . bring a book along or something of the sort to lose yourself in another world to distract from it all . do not fret about losing your identity , you really did not lose it . you only lost some part of it the way you expressed it . find the core of what that was and discover new ways to express yourself . but that is easier said than done as it probably was the hardest pill for me swallow . i loved playing guitar but could not anymore the core of that was the love of music . so , i took up a few other music related hobbies to fill that void . you said you felt defined by your academic standing , physical capabilities , family bond , and your unique job . what is at the center of each of those things now , not having income and means of transportation sucks no two ways about it . i am not sure where you live but i was able to get social assistance which was a huge help . it is temporary help you get your feet back on the ground . after i was able to receive social assistance i got a cheap place renting with two other roommates . it was more comfortable than living back home with my mother and two months after moving out i got a do able job considering my condition . and public transportation , although it is not as nice as using your own car , gets you where you need to go . oh boy i wrote a lot i do have more to say but it is getting late and i am a slow typer title: <start> i might have depression , but i do not know if this is actually true or not . <end>
response: <start> i have had depression since i was in my teens and that is what i feel like when i am down . if you cannot find an easy explanation of your blues , and the usual things that would cheer you up do not work , that sounds a lot like depression . the other symptoms you mentioned make sense too , if it is depression . see if your parents can help you get to a psychiatrist for a diagnosis . whether you need talk therapy and or medication , it is very important to commit to managing your condition . this means being faithful about keeping appointments and taking medications , but also to establish good health habits that will help you feel well sleep , exercise , healthy diet , personal growth , and learning to be a good communicator and listener so you can have good relationships . these last are worth doing for their own sake , regardless of whether you have depression or not . i hope this helps . the good news is , by managing depression , you learn to be strong , resourceful , and compassionate for others . i am now and feel very happy with how my life has been turning out please do not worry about what depression says you are a lovable , strong and capable human being <end>

title: <start> how do you deal with being broke and depressed <end>
response: <start> yep i went through this same thing for years all of my s which is why i was never able to defeat depression . i had to drop out of school could never hold a job the same old story we hear all the time on here . now that i am , i am back in school and doing an online program . i am financing my therapy out of pocket with student loans as part of my living expenses and making progress for the first time . insurance would never pay and this is the only way i could make it work . i honestly do not know how people do it but like i said it took me years of severe suffering to finally get it set up for i could get the help i needed and in the meantime i lost everything including my family , my friends , my boyfriend . . . i wasted time on medications that made me gain hundreds of pounds and did not work at all . . . i hope you can find a way soon . . . think about going back to school possibly online so that you can be available during the day when therapists have their therapy sessions . that is the only thing that worked for me and then you can finance it with some of your student loans as your living expenses . if you find another way to make it work please let us know so that others can be helped and our community of support can continue to foster know that we are here for you and all care and believe very much in what you are going through currently . good luck <end>

title: <start> i called in sick for work because of my mental health for the first time and it felt really good . <end>
response: <start> a heightened fight flight response from anxiety can because some difficult physical symptoms . what you describe reminds me of derealisation depersonalisation . pretty normal . good news is it cannot harm you . bad news is that it might hang around until you can crack the code as to what is causing it . in the meantime , to manage the symptoms , i use running , by , hot yoga and playing with my dog to chill me out . i think far more rationally afterwards . slowly sorting out areas of my life that are causing stress gives me the biggest boosts however . it is taken me a long time to get to that though . my issues started at and i am now . set some goals relating to education job , social circle , and health and well being etc . take small steps to begin with , baby steps if you like . build up some momentum . think of where your at now if life was a movie , and you were in the lead role as the hero , what would you do next <end>

title: <start> i lost my will to live a long time ago , i have done my best to get through it does not get better . <end>
response: <start> relationships are like that . we stake so much on someone else , and their willingness to love us forever . we allow ourselves to be consumed by another person , to melt into them , so that even breathing seems impossible without them . but it is not . time and distance . time and distance . they do not really make it better . they simply allow you to put it in perspective . we never really forget . we just get used to the scars . if we are lucky , we learn lessons from them , and acquire a certain fondness for our scars . in the end , the truth is seeking happiness in someone else will always lead to catastrophe . we must , each of us , find a way to be happy with who we are , and make peace with the world around us . then , and only then , can we form the kind of enduring love with another person that makes us wish we would live forever . everyone you meet is fighting their own battle . all we can hope for , is temporary comrades in arms , fellow travelers on intertwined paths . i am sorry you are going through a tough time , and i will not say it will get better , but , you will get better at dealing with it . like burning yourself on an open flame , what is sharp and painful now , will dull and fade . sending warmth . <end>

title: <start> i got really drunk and told everyone how suicidal i am . how can i fix my relationships f <end>
response: <start> you seems a reasonable person , i am pretty sure you will find your way of neutralizing depressed moods and behaviour , keep in mind that things can go two ways in some time days or weeks you will start to feel better and think hey i was very sad for x reason but now i am sorta ok or it could go worse in wich you will think everything is shitty , i hate the decision i have take and the things i have gone through happened to me . either way you will get better with time , you will understand more of your personality and you will do things that make you feel good about yourself . i do not know the reasons of your depression , could just be your brain trying to find a balance in serotonins or maybe something bad happened and you did not face it fully , you just tossed that in a corner of your mind . either way , if these bad and awful feelings continue to arise , please seek help by talking with your parents or and your school teachers . it is positive that you opened up to your bf . do not be afraid to seek professional help , they are here fot that exact reason differentiate a unbalance in hormones from mental scars . the sooner you fight , earlier the healing . please take my words as an advice , not as absolute truth . i do not know future better than anyone else on earth . take care of yourself <end>

title: <start> i feel so helpless <end>
response: <start> you are right antidepressants are not a miracle cure for what ails us . as you are already seen , what they actually do is help clear our heads so we can face down the real problems . however , getting the right antidepressant can be a tedious , uphill climb . i often say that we are our own guinea pigs . when it comes to any kind of medication designed for psychiatric use , it is not unusual to have to keep trying different types and dosages . you should not have to feel that way and the meds are designed to help . but , if you are on the wrong type and or dosage , they do not . i strongly recommend that you go back to your provider . the only way the provider can know if a med works or not is if you tell them they will recommend something else , based on your feedback . <end>

title: <start> how am i supposed to feel after going to the psychologist <end>
response: <start> cards on the table , i am a social worker who worked as a therapist . i have a different perspective to offer on this i think . i believe a more productive way to think about therapy than no pain no gain might be more like a lock and key situation . there are a bunch of variables on the side of the client what is happened , what is happening , etc , and there are a bunch of variables on the side of the therapist how they work , what they believe , what their training is , what their individual skillet is . there are lots of different models of therapy . these models sit on philosophical frameworks which are also quite diverse . each therapist has their own thinking about therapy , or philosophy and frameworks they are skilled in . getting back to the lock and key , the matter of whether therapy is likely to work for a client is to some extent a feature of what models the therapist is using . its also well known that there are factors that can negate the extent to which models affect quality of therapy and these are relationship based . in other words , if the therapist and client personally click this may be a significant driving factor in how well therapy works . its relational to some extent . getting back to the models , one way of thinking of them is two schools of thought . depth psychology , which is about what happened , what meaning was made of what happened , and how the person responded or reacted to what happened . it may also consider a lot of the persons experience to be the result of subconscious or deep thinking . forward facing models , which are concerned with what is happening now , what meanings people are making of things in the present , how well that current stuff is working , and what can be done to improve it . you may be able to see from this that is more likely to require clients and therapists to engage in no pain no gain thinking , and may not require it . that is not to say that might not involve some discomfort by challenging current conceptions of how to manage things but the way the two approaches that we are using for the sake of argument is probably distinguishable this way . and that is kind of important for clients to know . unfortunately , going into therapy , most do not , and they get stuck with whatever therapist and whatever model is their particular preference . this can be unhelpful for some clients . i believe practiced unskillfully , it can certainly be harmful . i do not want to get into that too much here because this post is getting pretty long . i think the best thing to do is figure out whether you want to be talking a lot about your past and if you feel that would work for you based on what you know from your experience so far or if you would find it more useful to be talking about wheats happening now , and where things are heading from here . if unsure , it might be worth trying a different therapist and model to learn more about what fits best for you . <end>

title: <start> just got done with over questions . . . <end>
response: <start> once you go in and get admitted , you may or may not be evaluated by police , a social worker , or a certified therapist . they may ask a lot of questions , or just a few , it depends on what you may need for treatment . as most hospitals , you will have your own room , most likely in the mental health clinic . you may or may not have restrictions to keep the other patients safe , if they feel as if you are a danger to the other patients . it takes time away from your daily routine and it typically is just trying to help you feel better in a safer and more stable environment . hopefully , this answered your question <end>

response: <start> i am sorry you are going through this . it is definitely not selfish to want to see your own kids grow up and i would bet that your kids want to be with you as well . do not take away their parent unless that is the absolute last resort . one key thing i focused on in what you wrote is your medication . i have had to switch meds at least twice and a variety of doses to get to the one where the side effects were tolerable and it worked . when it comes to meds for mental issues , we are all our own guinea pigs . have you talked to your prescriber recently if your meds are not working , they are not worth taking . talk to your prescriber . getting to the right med dosage can be a tedious , but important , process . meds are not the end all be all of depression treatment , but it can be an important step and you will want to make sure that step is doing all it can . <end>

response: <start> agreed . this can be made extremely simpler and concise . the inconsistences between scaling are off putting and confusing . the redition of essentially the same questions make it long winded . this feels like a rough draft . go through and eliminate the questions that are essentially the same as one another some questions have several minor alterations throughout the survey . i see no benefit in having those small nuances as you sonny jim mentioned . change the scaling to be consistent and easily understandable . lastly , make the thing shorter . you will get a lot more participants and data if there were , say , questions . many mental health testing sheets have approximately questions regarding sleep , frequency of depression , etc . all these questions are based on a scale , low to high . take inspiration from there to hone in on suicidal behavior . i wish you the best , but please fix your survey . <end>
