title: <start> i am a neuroscientist need your help with a science video on depression <end>
response: <start> definitely the most misunderstood thing is the concept that it is just a feeling of sadness . it is more so the loss of joy , emptiness , and a lack of motivation . people also do not know other symptoms , such as irritability , change in sleep schedule , change in diet weight , and self hatred . in general the average person would likely have a hard time knowing if they were depressed based on what most people think it is . best of luck on the video <end>

response: <start> things are good at home , and i actually do tend to enjoy school a lot . the thing i think is holding me back the most is just the pure energy and motivation it takes to finish an assignment . school takes a lot out of me so i do not really have much when i get home . makes all homework pretty hard to be honest . i am so tired when i get home i basically sleep the day away , or just waste time . i have tried restricting social media and everything but i found that i can literally lay on my floor and stare at the ceiling for hours . i have talked to my parents about the issue a bit , but the general consensus tends to be like i just have to do it , because it is school . <end>

title: <start> things are good at home , and i actually do tend to enjoy school a lot . the thing i think is holding me back the most is just the pure energy and motivation it takes to finish an assignment . school takes a lot out of me so i do not really have much when i get home . makes all homework pretty hard to be honest . i am so tired when i get home i basically sleep the day away , or just waste time . i have tried restricting social media and everything but i found that i can literally lay on my floor and stare at the ceiling for hours . i have talked to my parents about the issue a bit , but the general consensus tends to be like i just have to do it , because it is school . <end>
response: <start> you are certainly not alone . when i was in school i have had a similar experience to what you are going through now . for me , i had no direction nor desire to put effort into my assignments . i just wanted to go outside and play a sport . now that i am done with school , i wish i had focused more on my assignments because getting the best grades could have given me a better chance to getting into a good college . this idea may be silly but you can read your assignment and speak your answer into a recording device like a phone , and write what you said on paper later . try completing a little at a time . take a brake and finish and go back to finish your work . if you ever need help with your assignments , ask your someone at your school , or your parents . <end>

title: <start> i am drowning and i do not know what to do <end>
response: <start> i am sorry for what you are going through . i can relate . i find relief in pretending that i am the only person on earth . if i was , of my problems would be solved . for myself , an introvert from childhood , i find that the more things you can do for yourself , and the less you need other people , the happier you can be . cut away any addictions you may have . caffeine , alcohol , smoking , gaping , etc . . . spend time on your own . . go places on your own . . go camping alone . . it is all going to reinforce the fact that you can be okay on your own . <end>

response: <start> getting ghosted by friends always hurts , no matter the circumstances . but if you really want to know what happened , you are going to have to take the initiative and ask . if they took a vacation without you , that you normally are a part of , you are not overreacting . the fact that you have been able to talk with them before is promising , but if they will not talk to you or make excuses , it is time to walk away . friends are honest people you just hang out with may not be , and there can be a fine line . <end>

response: <start> well , . all feelings are important to validate . . if you are going to therapy , its their job to do this , you can not be wasting their time for that . . your therapist took the time to get a degree and a job in a field that is specifically meant for helping people . they want to help you , they know how , but they can not force you . a lot of the times , i try to not tell people about my problems because i know if i were to tell them everything , i would be kinda of a downer . as i have gotten older , i have come to terms with the fact that other people will think whatever they want , but that does not stop me from deserving the validation and support i need . if someone thinks i am a downer even if i love them i just will not bring it up with them . i will find someone else who is more sympathetic to my problems . its not that the other person does not love me or care about me , its that they too are human and probably do not know how to handle situations like this . do you mind if i ask what the problems are you are having that you feel you can not speak up about <end>

title: <start> happiness is a lie <end>
response: <start> it sucks to feel like this . you are right happiness is a lie . but . . . even not depressed people are not happy all the time , if even all that much . i think the whole concept of happiness is seriously overrated . expecting my life to be full of joy all the time , or even most of the time , is complete bs . we are all trying to make it , day by day , and some of us have a chemical imbalance on top of all the other craziness we have to contend with . i know lots of not depressed people , and i still do not see them skipping through the streets . you are right happiness gets idolized , much to the detriment of people who can not seem to claim any of it . all of this is to say , happiness is a damned elusive goal . i do not tell people i want to be happy , because i think that is become a meaningless term . i want to be ok . i want to manage my life . so far , that is mostly worked , and i have had moments where i am less empty than others . i am not sure that is a bad way to go . i feel like expecting outright joy is something few people ever achieve . <end>

title: <start> help for my girlfriend <end>
response: <start> hello f here with severe anxiety and depression . i have a boyfriend of age and he is a huge support . all we ask is that you listen to us when we need it and give us the space when also needed . my bf knows right away when i am having either an anxiety attack panic attack and knows to leave me alone until i ask for something . we just need patience and listening you will get through it do not worry if you are a good listener supporter that is all she needs you are an amazing boyfriend , keep it up <end>

title: <start> help <end>
response: <start> i get feeling empty . i think i have been empty for a long , long time , even when i am not technically depressed . i think that part of the problem , for me at least , is that i am not really sure what filled looks like . i feel like every day is just a matter of getting stuff done and carrying on and , if i do all the things , i have had a successful day . . . because i have no other benchmark . and , i am beginning to suspect that nobody has the definitive benchmark for being happy and fulfilled . absolutely nobody . i think filled has to be defined by the individual , just like being empty does . you sound rather young , because of the statement about staying with your family on vacation . nothing wrong with that , bow . when i was in my teens early s , i was a mess , and i was not even depressed most of that time . honestly , those age ranges just suck , period , and having any kind of issue like anxiety , depression , etc . would make it a lot tougher . if i could talk to my much younger self , i would tell her that it does get better . and , i say the same thing to you . what you are going through right now is really tough . but , the good thing is , it is not forever . that may not be especially helpful in the short term , particularly when you are immersed in your situation . but it is important for that little part of your brain that still tunes in to know one thing that keeps me going , day after day , is my absolutely favorite quote it will all be ok in the end . if it is not ok , it is not the end . living as a human being is really , really hard . hang in there . <end>

title: <start> why <end>
response: <start> if you have anything that you love doing , then trying doing that more often . sometimes when i have no motivation as well , i just take time for myself and decide to spoil myself by buying something i know i would enjoy , even if it is just a small thing . sometimes taking care of yourself before checking up on anyone else helps with confidence and motivation . being quiet is definitely something i struggle with as well , as i want to talk to people , but i am too afraid because of the fear of getting judged or laughed at . if you have people to talk to at school , work , or anywhere else , decide to join them and just get yourself out there , to get yourself to laugh . always feel free to pm me if you are ever feeling like you are out of place or need some kind of reassurance , because i will try my hardest to make sure you are going to be okay . i may be a stranger but i am here for you . stay strong , you are amazing and you are going to get through it . <end>

title: <start> was literally just looking at this . . have one you would recommend <end>
response: <start> i am not you , so i do not know your preferences , but the one that jumped out at me and i am going to get it from my local library as soon as possible is the happiness trap . the description of act therapy sounds really good , and i like the approach harris is probably the most visible proponent of something called act or acceptance and commitment therapy . . . whereas cut is focused on channeling pain and suffering into more productive interpretations and actions , act just says fuck it , bad feelings are bad feelings and they do not necessarily have to mean anything at all if we do not let them . i often describe my feelings as just a temporary state , because i know they are . this , too , shall pass . pass like a kidney stone , but it will pass . i am an old lady compared to most of the folks here , so i know that things go in cycles . learning to live with feelings as just feelings seems right up my alley . <end>

title: <start> getting worse before you get better <end>
response: <start> if your therapy is making you feel worse , its time to change therapists . good therapy should help you to feel stronger and more capable of dealing with your illness and the issues in your life that it rests on . therapists use models there are lots of them . different therapists use different models , and different combination of models . some models are more prone than others to make people feel shitty about themselves . conversely , some models are better than others at building strength and capacity . you may benefit a lot more from the latter , as the former seems to be running you down . maybe consider switching gears to see what happens . look for someone using a strengths perspective or solution focused or positive psychology or narrative as examples . there are lots of them . good luck . <end>

title: <start> i need to change but i do not know how <end>
response: <start> i am sorry you are going through this . i am not sure where you are at , but in the you . s . it is not always the case that telling a therapist will get you committed , that is usually only if you have an imminent plan and intent . passive ideation is common , but still very real and needs to be taken seriously . if you do not want to tell a therapist that you are struggling with suicidal thoughts , then consider telling a therapist that your struggling with feeling down all the time and pushing friends aways . it is hard to seek out therapy when you are feeling bad , but it can be helpful in resolving the things that are causing you pain . i have been going to therapy on and off for the past years and it has carried me through some real rough patches . my partner of years has been struggling with depression his whole life and only just met with a therapist for the first time months ago . he was isolating and feeling a lot of what you are describing and started feeling better after two sessions with a therapist . it sounds like you have people who do care about you . depression hurts and changes how we experience the world . you deserve to feel your own value . please consider talking with a professional . <end>

title: <start> not quite sure if i belong here <end>
response: <start> lack of motivation is also a symptom of depression . one doctor i worked with told me , over and over pills do not teach skills . in other words , pills do not fix all of life s problems and you probably were not expecting them to , i am sure . what they can do is help clear your head to figure out what is going on in the moment and react appropriately . typically , it takes a combination of both meds and therapy to resolve a lot of depression related issues . it would be easier if just taking the pills took care of the problem . sigh . . . nope . have you checked with your prescriber to see if you are on the right dosage of flexor i know that , when i was on it , i had to get bumped up at least a couple of times to get to a place where it felt right . as for what else to do now it would not hurt to check in with a counselor or therapist . i would not make any life changing decision in haste . however , the mere fact that you want to make a change is a good sign , because it means that you are caring about what happens to you . <end>

title: <start> what to do and how to talk to depressed spouse <end>
response: <start> i am assuming you have asked him this question and he has drawn a blank the most helpful stuff my wife does is not judging . we have been living with this thing for years now and she knows how it operates . sometimes i have better days and we make the most of them . other days i am not really up to much . she never complains . she never blames me . she never gets angry or pissed off on days when i just can not get things done . i feel accepted and loved by her . even when my mind is tearing itself to bits , i can still reach out to grasp that she loves me . i am not a big fan of therapy either . it can make things worse , and it can be just plain ineffective . i can relate to where hes coming from . some of the other stuff she does is keep tabs on my appointments and stuff since this thing i am not good with any of that , and forget even when reminded in the morning , sometimes by afternoon i have forgotten . she is always there to remind me . i guess there is a lot of stuff i no longer do that she has picked up over time . i used to be the head of the household breadwinner etc . now i am on a disability pension . i accept that there is a lot of stuff now i used to be able to handle easily that is just beyond my reach now . that means she has had to step up now she is in charge of pretty much everything . if there is a decision to be made , she will often ask me , but i usually stay out of it because my thinking has become so impaired to what it was before this . the whole time i recognise that there is nothing she can do about my mood there is nothing i can either we both are just stuck with this bloody thing . but i am not asking or expecting her to . i am thankful for what she does do , and my illness is what it is . i would hate to be doing this alone though . your husband is lucky to have you by his side , and i am sure there is a lot you are doing every single day that he is grateful for . every time you allow him to do what he needs to do to manage it , if you pick up whatever slack needs to be picked up , and just watch out for him , that stuff is really , really helpful . not to mention the emotional support you are no doubt providing . hell you even made this post , what a thoughtful thing to do <end>

title: <start> depressed child that needs help . <end>
response: <start> it is ok to be sad , and i bet you already know , at least intellectually , that not everything is your fault . and congrats on your graduation i am glad you already understand that your parents would fight regardless of whether or not you exist . parental arguments , at their foundation , rarely have anything to with kids . believe me , i am a mom , i fight with my husband , and the arguments almost always have to do with our relationship , not with our son . important family events can bring out the worst in people , so the fact that your parents had a fight the day of your graduation is not terribly surprising . also , there is no such thing as normal . that is a standard that absolutely no one meets . there is just variations of not normal . if you think someone is normal , bet your bottom dollar it is all for show . nobody has their shit together , no matter how old they are . having said all of that , depression , whether or not you have been officially diagnosed , is something you should seek help for . a therapist can help you to work through what is going on in your head and give you strategies for dealing with whatever concerns you most . do not wait . <end>

response: <start> that is wierd because over the years of me dealing with depression i have often wished i were mentally handicapped to the point of being completely oblivious to any thoughts or pain or sadness but who is to say that those people do not suffer silently in their own way . . i just wished i could be like others i obs that seemed to have no emotion at all or just to be so cold hearted that i just did not give a shit about anything . i am now and have been battling this demon since the age of and still battle it on a daily basis . medication only masks it and i do not want to go to an appointment where i talk to someone who only knows me by reading about me in books or a course in school . i want to relate to someone who is been there or is dealing with what i am dealing with . it helps to get on these forums and talk to my peers , real people with real problems just like me . i do not have an answer for you i just wanted to let you know that i can truly relate . i am not sure if it will ever get better or eventually become normal whatever that is just want you to know i am right here with you . . good luck . . i will be thinking about you <end>

title: <start> i am back again today <end>
response: <start> yes , continue your walks . i am not telling you what to do here , but this is what i did to claim a few minutes of peace go out for a walk or light jog , like you have been . say out loud i am in control of . . . . say a small action and immediately execute it . for example i am in control of stepping over little this rock with my left foot . and immediately do it . i am in control of touching that leaf on the bush as i pass . and immediately do it . i am in control of taking extra short steps in a row and immediately do it . you have to say it out loud in order to have the full immersion , otherwise your brain habits will have the anxiety flood back in at any chance it gets . be creative and come up with a bunch of different little actions to do . being creative helps keep your mind busy so as to not leave room in your head for anxiety for a few minutes . being creative keeps you from repeating tasks . if you start repeating the same action , your brain will get bored and the anxiety will flood back in . i would be able to get a good minutes of relief doing this . good luck . <end>

title: <start> help for a significant other who is struggling <end>
response: <start> if you feel he is considering suicide then you contact a suicide hotline right away . taking the threat of suicide off the table you say you are not doing a good job of helping , has he asked for your help have you considered the fact that he may not want to talk about his issues what to do when someone close to you is struggling sometimes i think you have to accept that you are powerless . maybe you just have to sit still and accept feeling scared . since you know he has an appointment next week , and you have determined he is not a threat to himself , what about just being his friend keeping him company at whatever level he is capable of . maybe you get takeout and watch a movie , take a short walk , go for a drive and sit in the car at a pretty overlook so he gets some sunshine on his face . and when the day comes for his appointment , how about going with him , just to the waiting room , not the session . you can be scaffolding , you can not be his solution . <end>

response: <start> i am extremely sorry about your friend . that has to be very hard , after growing up with her . dealing with the guilt is probably even harder . i know this feels like it is your fault but , honestly , you can not keep up like this . you can not take on this burden all by yourself . and you are not a pussy for not knowing what to do , especially at your young age . i am a lot older than you , with a lot more experience , and even now i would be hard put to know exactly how to handle such a situation . please get some help . the people directly around you may not get it , but there are definitely people who do and will . you are coping the best you can under the circumstances , but this would be a very difficult thing to handle for anyone . <end>

title: <start> how to talk to a parent with suspected depression <end>
response: <start> i am a yr old mother of an yr old daughter and to tell you from experience i always kept my depression from my ill girl because i felt vulnerable talking to her about it because in my mind i am supposed to be the strong one in terms of a parent and child relationship . i know how your mom feels , its awkward talking to your kids about your weaknesses , as a mom you are not supposed to have any but my daughter would take me out one on one clot and break the ice a ill at a time until finally i was comfortable enough to let her in . i am not going to lie it took a while but she finally broke me , probably because i was tired of her aggravating me low but it worked . i tried therapy but i am not comfortable talking to someone who has not been where i am so she suggested that i get on certain help for depression forums where i am completely anonymous and express myself to my peers and it helps . i am not sure if this is the advice you were looking for but i hope in some way it helps you understand her side of things . i am sure it is not that she does not desperately want to talk to you about things it is just that moms are not supposed to show weakness . . she will come around just be there for her as much as possible and tread lightly because if you press too much she may close up and never talk about it . . . a mother and daughter have a bond like no other so she is very lucky to have one that cares so much . . . good luck to you and your mom . . . <end>

title: <start> what if i do not want help <end>
response: <start> being stuck and being tired are the hallmarks of depression . i am constantly tired and i do not feel like i can get through the day . remember , though . . . depression is a liar . it lies to you about how you should be feeling , about your self worth , and often makes you want to pull away from everything and everyone . depression lies and manipulates you into not wanting the help that will make you feel better . every time i help myself , every day i make it to the end of , i win . you are not acting up or being lazy . depression is a neurochemical state , not a choice . remember , depression gaslights you into believing all sorts of crap choosing to do something that helps yourself , even if you do not feel like it will , is a step towards winning the war . <end>

title: <start> i want a social life , but it is difficult when i do not care about people or what they have to say <end>
response: <start> yeah , i have the same problem . i get along with everyone , but i just can not seem to make myself give a shit without extreme effort . i get bored of people so quick , i can rarely be on the phone for minutes . testing is easier because i can respond whenever . it is sorta like training for marathon , you can not just start a k , you got build the skills and muscles first same goes for social interactions . what i do , is make it a point to talk to someone everyday . i usually talk my mom on the phone and roommate in person . you do not have to worry about small talk , and do not stress about forcing yourself to be interested . just let conversations flow and little by little you will learn how to talk to people and stay interested with only some effort . <end>

title: <start> school s out for good . . . <end>
response: <start> hey . first , i am sorry you have been going through this . this is how i felt after i left college . came home a completely different individual , but things at home were different too . first thing i did was shut everyone out and cried a ton . but after i did that for about a month or two , i talked to my mom and dad about it . my mom at the time had the shake it off attitude , but i looked her in the eye and straight up said no , i need help . even though you do not have family nearby , maybe pick one you trust or a friend you trust and ask for help . are you going to college or university most colleges and university should have mental health or even support groups . can you also reach back out to your camps support group facilitator and ask for their advice or support that could be a start . i hope things get better and if i think of anything else , i will message back . <end>

title: <start> helping a younger brother <end>
response: <start> ignore your parents . during my dark times , my little brother and my mom were my saving grace . but in regards to my brother , i have two very distinct memories . . i was laying in bed depressed out of my mind . all i wanted was to die , but my brother kept coming singing dual of fates from star wars episode and was hitting me with a pillow . it always makes me laugh . he never treated me like i was broken , but always showed me he cared and that i had a friend . . i was at university several years later , it was around spring break in my junior year , when i hit a bad episode . my brother a freshman in a university on the opposite side of the state turned down a trip to the beach with his friends , because he knew i needed him . during that week he did the thing from the first memory whenever i got depressed . i have done similar things for like that for him , we have always just had each others back . i could on forever about the times he is helped me out of the dark . parents are great , but there is something different about having your brother sister be there for you . my brother never treated me different . i knew he was there for me not because he felt sorry for me , but because he loved me and we were brothers , and that had not and would not change . honestly , whenever i hit a depressive episode , there is not anyone i would rather have in my corner . <end>

title: <start> has anyone under seemed help about depression <end>
response: <start> i went to a high school in new zealand , and saw a counsellor about my potential because i was not sure about it yet depression . i am not sure if the counselor or i informed my family . but , my parents were convinced that i was just claiming depression because i did not want to study , and lazy etc . the whole nine yards . they still took me to a psychologist in new zealand and my home country which was nice of them . they all ruled out depression , at that point all before i reached . maybe i did not have a serious clinical depression at that point . or maybe i did , but being able to talk about it provided such relief that i was not in my downtime when next session rolled around . whatever , the reason , they just blamed me directly for my behavior instead of trying to find out what was wrong with me even though i insisted this was not normal and i wanted someone to help me with this situation . they would get so mad when i told them i felt depressed , and told me i must not talk about it to anyone . the worst case for me came when i finally caved in and stopped reading about how to prevent falling in further into depression . basically , i stopped reading all self help guides and stopped visiting forums and websites that was intended to help with depression . that must have been my final straw inside . because , i basically shut down at that point , and depression started autopiloting my life . so , by , while i was studying well , staying is more like it since , depression and whatever else did not let me do anything like going outside my room or to class in us went to an american psychologist , who sent me to a american psychiatrist . who finally gave me anti depressant which is helpful in returning some life to me . <end>

response: <start> do you mind sharing what happened in those years going through something similar atm <end>

title: <start> do you mind sharing what happened in those years going through something similar atm <end>
response: <start> well , i did not have enough grades to make it to uni right after high school . even tho , my parents wanted me to be a medical doctor , since they were both medical doctors . i did not really have a dream job of my own , although i did say i want to be a psychiatrist since i hated needles , and that seemed like the only job in medicine that would not need needles . i also did not live with my parents since elementary they were back in my home country . which did not help relationship with my parents either . since , we had so much differences from being separated . so , surprise surprise , when their child at the end of high school , did not even have enough grades to go to college , let alone intention to pursue medicine . i have been constantly thinking about suicide during high school , and it seemed like worrying about my future at all is a pointless endeavor . although , i never self harmed or attempted suicide . so , i literally lived the moment , except instead of a party and all that jazz , it was just sleep and food that attended my life . in order to avoid being a high school graduated and to avoid my conscription biggest reason why hikkikomori is not as big problem in my country as japan back in my home country . i started attending an animation school , for a diploma . it was occupying few floors on a small building in the middle of auckland city . my parents thought this was the worst school they ever seen . my mother literally cried at how shit it was . but , as asian parents they gave me funds to study animation anyway . while studying computer animation so like d animation , like ds max , and watching japanese animation i played a lot of morphs , one of them gave me a chance to be a game master at a private server with about concurrent users at any given time . between that and watching how avatar was made in short documentary couture videos , which predicted animator as a job is a dying field since it will be replaced by computer programs who can make computer animation for them . anyway , the game master thing was an eye opener for me , since i never knew how much i would enjoy other people enjoying what i think would enjoy . so , after finishing barely because my first year instructor hated my guts , second year instructor was a grumpy old man , and maybe a little bit racist , while my third year instructor was a dick and i hope he dies in a slow and painful manner . so , i would just stay in my room , and not go to class , and attendance rate was a thing animation , i went back to my home country for conscription . my time in the army was not that bad . the month long rootcap was fun enough , altho i would not do it ever again . instead of going in to army directly , i went to civil service , so i was working along with government officials in a local community center . if the pay was not shit which is below minimum wage since it is conscription , i would have loved to work like that for the rest of my life because i nearly did not need to do anything . once in a while , i would help other government officials move some boxes , send posts , and deliver confidential documents . but , mostly i played flash games on the work computers . when they later blocked it . i just started using proxy web services or http . the most serious thing i was most called for was it or translation , which was not a lot . since , one of my government official did not even know what windows was , i was the only guy with computer related knowledge . anyway , during the two years , my parents wanted me to at least have a college degree . so they tried to put me up to get in to a college . which required my high school records , except new zealand high school i attended told me they do not have a record of me . so , basically i did not even graduate high school . so , i had to take a ged . eventually i managed to enter an university in us . which was okay at first . since , everything was metaphorically new and shiny to me . i went to a school psychologist my first year there . who i convinced to see the school psychiatrist . who told me he thought i am having depressive episodes but he did not think i had depression yet on first few diagnosis . eventually , i lost interest in education , so my grades slipped . went from . on my first semester to failing academic standard by third semester . so , eventually school said come back when you feel like studying and academically dismissed me . i went to a community school after that , but for me , this was worse than my animation school in new zealand . there were metal detectors , and clogged toilets everywhere . literal shit school if you ask me . anyway , i stopped attending there altogether too . i think i went to the community school a dozen times during that semester , and half of that was to hand in applications , before finally deciding education is not right for me , at the end of that semester . unfortunately , my parents did not agree that i wanted to drop out . they would constantly berate about how technically , i did not even graduate from high school since my new zealand high school did not recognize me as a graduate , and that ged does not count . it was not like i could live separately from them with no income . especially as an asian , where independence from family does not come automatically when you are like in america . so , after about month , i sent in a request for readmission at my first university , whom they accepted . soon enough depression came down hard again so i would just stay in my room , and not do anything . so , i went to the psychiatrist in us again . despite my parents telling me not to go seek a psychiatrist since according to them they will use me for their experiments . i kept getting told by a whole lot of people that maybe i did not make the cut to be studying the major i chose , so i finally caved in and i tried changing that too . but , nope . i guess that was not it either . because i lost interest in everything all over again . so , i am a college drop out right now . with no job , no employment history , no training whatsoever . the school psychiatrist in us would give me medication , but i could not book them before the meds ran out . once it ran out , for me , i fell harder because i was higher up . it was like having an allergy your whole life , then took the cure for it , but then when your allergy returns , you suddenly can not breathe . since , you are not used to having clogged breadthways any longer . well , that is how i would describe my experience with the medication . also , it taking a few weeks to see any serious effect and is not a immediate happy pill did not help return immediately to a more normal life . few weeks to see the psychiatrist few weeks to start the med effect back up months of depression autopiloting my life , where i just get back to my oneself . at least when i went to see a psychiatrist back in my home country last year , they took my experience in us for it , and i did not have to make lengthy series of appointment to convince them i had depression . <end>

title: <start> help . <end>
response: <start> you can not control anyone else s behavior but your own . but you can tell her how you feel . and you do not have to go into major detail , either just tell her that her statements make you feel uncomfortable . but . . . here s the thing i am not sure it is typical to talk about ending one s life , in any context , without there being something behind that statement . everyone views their life subjectively just read posts on this sub a good number of statements along the line of i should be happy , but i am not . in short , what i am concerned about is that your friend may have a great life , but that does not guarantee that she is not suicidal or hurting . if she is also in pain , like you , she may just be expressing it differently . not all depression looks the same . if you are friends , you should be able to talk about these things with her . getting that conversation may be difficult . the next time she says something like wondering what it would be like to end her life , it might be a good idea to hand her the phone number for the suicide help hotline . <end>

response: <start> my old therapist used to call my anxious thought loops excessive ruminations but no matter what you call it , it sucks to have a brain that is always telling you terrible things . i still suffer the same kind of anxiety you describe fairly often but it has been helpful sometimes nothing works all the time to remind myself that thinking things is not the same as those things being true brains generate thoughts , that what they do , but thoughts are not true just bc they pop into our heads . especially true when it comes to negative self talk i would say keep looking for the right fit with a therapist because it is worth the effort and yes , meds can help in some circumstances but so can simply learning to observe your thoughts rather than attaching weight or importance to them . keep posting and reaching out you are not alone . <end>

title: <start> do i really have depression <end>
response: <start> these are the official dam v criteria x b note the section i have highlighted in bold type . x b the dam outlines the following criterion to make a diagnosis of depression . the individual must be experiencing five or more symptoms during the same week period and at least one of the symptoms should be either depressed mood or loss of interest or pleasure . . depressed mood most of the day , nearly every day . . markedly diminished interest or pleasure in all , or almost all , activities most of the day , nearly every day . . significant weight loss when not dieting or weight gain , or decrease or increase in appetite nearly every day . . a slowing down of thought and a reduction of physical movement observable by others , not merely subjective feelings of restlessness or being slowed down . . fatigue or loss of energy nearly every day . . feelings of worthlessness or excessive or inappropriate guilt nearly every day . . diminished ability to think or concentrate , or indecisiveness , nearly every day . . recurrent thoughts of death , recurrent suicidal ideation without a specific plan , or a suicide attempt or a specific plan for committing suicide . to receive a diagnosis of depression , these symptoms must because the individual clinically significant distress or impairment in social , occupational , or other important areas of functioning . the symptoms must also not be a result of substance abuse or another medical condition . <end>

title: <start> what depression has made me see <end>
response: <start> i used to spend day to night consuming media and music alone in my room like you did , and it was a wonderful time as well but not really . i had really bad social anxiety and depression , and not many friends because of it . i hated the world and people especially and i still kind of do . i know a lot about movies , music , tv shows , books , etc and that knowledge is apart of my personality and i treasure my memories and experiences with media and art greatly just like you do . it was my world . i am not sure if those things can be a substitute for living in the end though . they are not accurate depictions of life , there are elements of reality , but mostly rose colored works of fiction . i feel a different way now , at a point you become disillusioned to the real world that it does not measure up to the unreal world even though it is better . i feel like my life was put on hold and an emptiness that i never actually did the things i loved , or created anything for myself . i would just say as having gone through it the past years and having come out of it for ish , do the things that you enjoy in the real world and build something for yourself . <end>

title: <start> advice for self aware depression <end>
response: <start> i read something the other day that explained this . bessel van der folk s the body keeps the score is a really helpful book for anyone experiencing depression or ptsd . basically , my layman s understanding was that the right brain , being the alarm system , will always activate ahead of the left brain , which is logical and counsels you to question your emotional reaction . i have the same struggle , knowing that yes , i am meant to excercise and think positively and all that shit , but just not able to do it . wellbutrin helped immensely . and now that i have breathing space i can actually see why i could not do it i just had absolutely no executive function spare to make myself wash dishes or brush my teeth . it was all being used up on surviving not crying while doing something mildly unpleasant scolding myself to smile and react normally in social situations trying to feel positive emotions while talking to my husband instead of just sleepwalking through my days in a vacillating haze of anhedonia or emotional collapse . in short , sometimes medications are useful emergency intervention and a welcome respite . <end>

title: <start> relationships <end>
response: <start> hey i am sorry you are feeling this way . you are i felt pretty lonely at that age too . i know it is not what you want to hear but you are so young you still have a lot of time . i would not worry about a relationship right now , try and focus on yourself . it may be hard but a relationship will not save you . working on making friends again first , that is a lot less pressure . you are probably going through so much right now just find some people who accept you and who you can have fun with . a relationship could come through after meeting friends . i would not waste your time with that year old guy , and make sure you tell people your age . never settle for less just because of loneliness . make sure you really like someone before you start a relationship . i am an yr old guy and i still feel like i have a lot of time before i would worry about being in a relationship . right now i am trying to work on myself , because i need to be a better person before i get with someone else . it is something i have learned over time , that cliche phrase of having to love yourself first seems real to me . work on yourself , find friends who care and make you feel not so lonely , and one day you will find someone who will treat you right . i wish i had better advice for you , i remember worrying and being lonely at that age too , now when i look back it seems so silly . i was so young , in still young . we have time , to do whatever we want . i am still lonely but recognized i need to make time for myself first , you are the most important person in your life . you are the only you , you are the only one that knows what is best for you . take care of yourself and life will follow <end>

title: <start> should i admit myself into a psych hospital <end>
response: <start> first , thank you for being strong enough to come forward and ask for help i am not your mom , but i am more than old enough to be her . i have dealt with depression and ptsd myself for a while now . none of these things are for wimps . if i were your mother , i would want you to get the best help you could get . whether that is therapy and or meds and or something else . your mom will be far , far more heartbroken if you hurt or kill yourself and will blame herself . the problem here is potentially that your mother may feel like a failure if you get help . but the thing is that is her problem , not your problem . your job is to get help for yourself . being strong enough to ask for help is wonderful . her job is to support you in what you need . her emotional state is not what is really at stake here . it is yours . <end>

title: <start> please , i need some help and someone to listen . <end>
response: <start> hollywood is not a kind place . i hear the pain in your words and i feel for you but la is a heartless , superficial city with no soul . i live here and have for most of my life and my dad used to work in the industry . this town judges , degrades , chews up and spits out hundreds of aspiring actors on a daily basis . you have to be insanely resilient to endure the ordeal of trying to break into show business . i hope that does not sound too harsh but if you have depressive tendencies , then i fear you may be triggering those feelings in perpetuity just by pursuing an acting career in la . if you hate not having been born here because it means you have an accent then you are already telling yourself there is something wrong with you on the basis of something you have no control over that is not right . ultimately , if your emotional well being is threatened by your chosen profession , you may need to look at changing course . i know that is easier said than done after you have invested so much into your career but la will not change , so please find a good therapist hard to do if funds are low , i know all about that or consider what other options you have to find a way to fulfill yourself other than subjecting yourself to the judgements and abuses of hollywood . <end>

title: <start> how do i build up a sense of self worth <end>
response: <start> stop listening to your parents . parental approval can surely give you that boost of self confidence to move forward but sometimes that desire is misplaced . unrealistic expectations can poison the well which is of no use to anyone . take an honest assessment of where you were , are and where you want to be . do things look reasonable are you on a realistic path are you a drug kingpin pimp coyote if not then what where are you love what you do and who you are or else life will be dreary at best . your age is important as well . the younger you are the more parental approval matters , on balance . my dad has been gone years and for good or i will i would love to know what he would think of my life . ink but that is an opinion from the peanut gallery <end>

title: <start> doing everything right and still overwhelmingly depressed <end>
response: <start> a right sweetheart , i got you . x b you are doing so well . like seriously , you are doing amazingly . i know it is so fucking hard especially without a functioning family unit to support you . worse , they are dragging you down and making everything harder . your hard work does not mean nothing it is for you and that is important . it is for your future , so someday when you have pieced together a support group and a family of friends you can look back and laugh wryly saying well that was a bit rough . x b you are alone in so far as everyone is alone . you are just learning this lesson a bit sooner than most people do due to your family circumstances . it is painful , it is sad . at the end of the day the only person who will always be with you and have your back is yourself but that can be a wonderful thing as well . you can learn to be your own best friend which is pretty nice , having someone always with you that has your own back y know x b you are going to get through this , and be amazed at how strong you are . at how you can push through all this bullshit and come out the other side . you will grow stronger , and you will get through this . i do not know what you fought about with your step dad but do not let his mental illness infringe on your mental health . shore up your boundaries cut yourself off if you need to . is he a valuable addition to your life do you really need him in it x b i promise you , eventually you will find people who will be more family to you than the one you have experienced so far . just keep putting one foot in front of another and work towards what you want from this life . you may have to go through life alone , but you are not alone in your experiences . there will be people who act as stars in the night sky to help you navigate along your way . you will find moments of bonding with people that take your breath away in a non romantic sense and find bonds that are stronger than the ones of family could ever be . x b one breath at a time , one foot at a time you got this . you are working towards a brighter and happier future for yourself , and there will be people there to help you along the way . you just got to keep reaching out like you did here . x b once again , you are doing so well . i am really proud of you stranger . <end>

title: <start> i want out of my spiral <end>
response: <start> i do not have any advice but i am in a deeper depression than i normally am too and did not even notice for a long time . i usually need an outside obligation to remind me of things that bring me a little happiness and motivation . for me , that is sometimes an outdoor activity with a friend , or having someone come over for a casual dinner . i know i will begrudgingly have fun once it is actually happening , and if someone comes over , i have to tidy up somewhat . it just reminds me that i am capable of getting small things together even if it is hard and the improvement in the space is temporarily uplifting . i am trying to avoid drinking activities because i notice that afterwards , it can turn my numb depression into sadder and deeper depression . <end>

title: <start> not even good enough to be a dishwasher <end>
response: <start> being overlooked is one of the worst issues you can have . especially when you struggle with depression . i have had clot of shitty rejections over the years job wise . i can not get a job at palmar because of the assessment but clot of idiots pass somehow . but i can help people through trauma and help them make psychological shifts that change their lives . that is just one example . i was shit at school and ended up dropping out of college despite an ability to learn subjects at an accelerated pace . i spent the first years of my life try to figure out why the fuck nothing worked . i had social anxiety that crippled me up until i was about . my relationship were terrible as well . all of these issues stemed from seemingly unrelated issues . i am going to say right now that there is no product you can really buy to fix your problems , but i will give you some places to start . i started my real self improvement journey using things like state control , meditation and hypnosis . of which is a part of my practice and another coming soon . check out david snider on couture . for the instruction on state control and maybe try some hypnosis audio . back to the story . i found some lectures on nap a long time ago and ended up doing the state control exercises . mainly because i would keep putting myself out there and just could not feel it and really put my best foot forward . i started tricking my mind and putting myself in a good mood for no reason . as i started doing this on a regular basis these feelings became my dominant emotions . i noticed as i was able to feel it i was able to live it . people saw me differently as i became more outgoing . i did not get the best jobs immediately but my employers saw me differently and my success rate in interviews went up . and i am not making any promises but i was getting more dates and getting more friends . in conclusion i would study nap , state control , and do some meditating or hypnosis . i do not benefits from this guy s success but i will recommend him to you go to couture and search david snider nap . if you have any questions pm and i will clarify things for you and help you on your journey . i would love to chat and help you anyway that i can . there is just too much damn pain in the world . <end>

response: <start> most of my life has been in and out of therapy . and every time i get a new councillor they all find ways to betray my trust . with therapists i do not know how to open up and i just sit in awkward silence the whole time until i am asked a direct question . i mean , how do you answer how are you good . no i am not . otherwise i would not need to be here . but i just do it out of habit . what i want to say is i want to die . but that is a tad bit too forward . i can not make eye contact and i close up . when i am not feeling a connection , how do i tell them that i am not happy here how do i tell them i do not like talking to them i know the words to say , i just can not say them . they give me exercises to distract me , but i just want to be fixed . i do not want to feel like the worst thing to happen to the people around me . <end>

response: <start> aah , i feel like i may be able to help you with this one . i am not anymore but i went through a pretty similar problem at your age . i would always want to smoke or drink because it was the only way i could hold a conversation with people without feeling so awkward and full of anxiety . it was a really tough part of my life looking back high school is a bitch i think the turning point for me was one time when i just went all out and did way too much weed . i do not think one can actually overdose , but i genuinely think that that one time i did . it really messed me up , permanently . after that i was scared for weeks about what had happened and what i was supposed to do . looking back now i basically accidentally scared myself out of it . i was only awake for about hours after the high kicked in and it was easily the longest hours of my life . i could not walk , i could barely speak , i really just wanted to cry , honestly it was super shitty after that i concluded that it really was not for me . while most of my friends smoked , none of them did it habitually , and the ones that did not smoke really shamed me when i brought up that i had done it before . so i would say what got me off of it personally was that one time that was very traumatic , my friends not approving of it , my sister quitting it , and a lot of self evaluation . i am not saying you should go and smoke a fuck ton and mess yourself up , please do not do that . i would say just talk to your friends about it , and try to bring about the topic lightly . if they are not part of your stoner group , ask them what their opinion is on weed and drinking . maybe reach out to siblings you have as well and ask them what they think about it . i know it is hard to be direct about these sorts of topics of people as it is not something that can just pop up out of the blue usually . you will not quit immediately though . i first told myself oh only with friends and then it escalated from there . maybe start with i will only do it at parties or things like that . do not just try to cut yourself off , but rather limit yourself just a bit to start with . that one traumatic time i did it happened almost years before i quit for good , but after that i did it at max once every other month . i do not think it would take everyone that long , everyone is different , but that is okay . and one more thing , i know a lot of this is based on social stigma for me personally . when i would have friends over and chose to stay sober , they got really upset with me . they would constantly try to pressure me into smoking , and i just was not comfortable doing that in my own home . after that night where i basically hosted like high and drunk friends while sober , and still had a fun time , i think that is when one of the things clicked that i was genuinely happier without it . please do not let others pressure you into it though . i know it is very difficult , i was in your position and i could not do it , but try your best give excuses , lie , avoid them , do whatever you think it takes to avoid doing that shit man . this is all assuming that a part of you wanting to do this comes from social stigma . if it does not then feel free to ignore . if you want to talk more and clarify or have anything to say i would be happy to hear it . <end>

title: <start> on two different antidepressants still feeling shitty <end>
response: <start> do therapy . meds are only tools to relief pain . one year ago i was like you . . . tons of meds , nothing changed , until i started to see a psychiatrist therapist . of the meds were almost the same but before giving any meds we have to talk about hour per session . each session are different topics and depending how i feel or if the psychiatrist see any improvements or not he chooses the dosis based on that . also he gives personal tasks to do to improve your lifestyle . of the tasks depending on how you feel are sometimes demanding , but is something that is going to be useful on the longtime , not instantly . i always had depression but my depression explode with anxiety , agoraphobia and fainting years ago and he said that basically will take me like years because my body is used to feeling bad . <end>

title: <start> help . girlfriend has depression and wants to kill herself , now she wants to break up with me so i can move on when she kills herself . <end>
response: <start> can you get some family and friends together to talk to her about her proposal x b what you need to do involves a number of steps . x b first thing though is to include some people and you really need to arrange it so she has no option but to sit with them and they can express what it would be like for them if she did this . x b the thing about suicide is it involves having to negate the inevitable devastation the act would because everyone close to her . putting this up front and centre in real terms is a starting point . x b after that , if you can get her to a point where she is feeling a bit less committed to the idea in the short term at least make a plan that involves going back to some form of treatment , and also looking at addressing whatever it is in her life that is perpetuating the depression a lot of the time depression does have active triggers in the real world , for example , poverty , or stress , or health issues , or toxic relationships , etc etc there are many possibilities and they are all unique to the individual . do not try and force her to take meds if she does not want to . emphasise that it can take a number of therapists and therapies to get to one that is effective . ie if it has not worked in the past , it may be worth having a crack again just to see what happens . x b the other thing that you must do once she is in a better place is get her to commit to a plan of action if she plans to kill herself . this would involve a number of steps . there is plenty of information on google about individual suicide prevention plans . this is important because it puts some skills and practices into place to distract , defer , and connect . this is how people who are dangerously suicidal can delay the act and reach for support . it can be life saving if implemented properly and if you can get her to commit to doing it . she has to be ni a place where she can see the benefits . x b do not try and do this alone if you can possibly avoid it . she has made it clear right now she considers you an obstacle . you need to get her to see she is wanted and needed by some number of people who care about her and who she cares about . then you need her to see that you are an asset to helping her stay alive . x b good luck . <end>

title: <start> i am not sure what is happening to me . <end>
response: <start> it is likely that you , like pretty much all of us depressed and suicidal folks , have formed the habit of self sabotage . it is very common for us to become overly suspicious of any feelings of happiness or contentment we receive , because we think that it is too good to be true and that surely something must will go wrong because that is how it is always been for me . and then we let things like anxiety hold us back from experiencing more positive emotions in fear of the downfall . it is a vicious cycle and very hard to break . the first step is to be aware of it and if when you are doing it . i am not a doctor or an expert , just another depressed potato who is slowly working their way , so i will not say this will work for you or anybody else for that matter , but positive affirmations plays a big role in combatting it for me . i listen to them on couture , i say them to myself , and i have even asked other people to say them to me . it is hard , and sometimes impossible to believe them as your own thoughts and to not combat them bitterly in your mind , but it has helped me regardless of my skepticism . you have made an amazing friend . you deserve that . you deserve contentment and peace of mind . <end>

title: <start> i pushed my friends away <end>
response: <start> i have been in similar situations before as well , and it is a tough and lucky situation to be in . it personally took me years and years to be receptive to support from my friends , and it is something i still struggle with . do not beat yourself up too much depression can really mess with your mind and distort your perceptions . it makes sense that at one point you felt you were past the point of no return . but now you seem to know that you can be helped . tell them that you have heard them , and that you deeply appreciate their support . tell them that you appreciate them checking in on you , and that it truly does help , but you were not in the right state of mind to fully understand their intentions . tell them to not give up on you , and of course , apologize for coming across as cold . and if they are good friends , tell them that , and that you are grateful that they are in your life . as long as you are genuine and also generally a good friend , good friends will be incredibly receptive to this . think of it from their perspective if you have a friend that is feeling down and you reach out to help them , you want your efforts to actually work or at the very least be heard , right if you can express to your friends that their actions are working and they are beginning to get through to you , i am sure that will be more than enough . in other words , tell them that they are actually helping you . be sincere , and you will be heard . best of luck <end>

title: <start> i want to tell her she is the because of my depression <end>
response: <start> your depression is because of the way your brain processes situations , not what it is presented to process . it is the path the info takes within your brain , not the info itself . we are taught to look at external sources of the problem in our society , and so many of us grow up believing in the habit of blaming , and that blaming will fix it . no . it does not . it may bring a flash of pleasure , but it does not end the depression . <end>

title: <start> been in a state of self hatred self blame lately . <end>
response: <start> this is my first time replying to a reedit post so i will try my best . to start off , it is not your fault that you had have social anxiety , you did not ask for it just like thousands if not millions of others around the world , and having social anxiety will prevent you from speaking out in situations such as the one you mentioned , it would be too much to handle . you have got to realise that having social anxiety prevents you from doing things , it does not make them physically impossible , but to overcome the anxiety in a situation like that would take a lot of sacrifice and could have severe effects on your anxiety after that , so not being able to overcome your anxiety is not your fault , it was built into you and nothing could be done about it . if you had a broken legs and were asked to run m , technically you could do it but realistically , you can not . you should see that a mental illness , such as social anxiety , is no different than a physical illness or injury , and you would not blame yourself for not being able to run m with broken legs would you so why should you for this situation . also its not about the action that matters , its the thought , and you wanted to help , even though you may not have spoken out , which you could not of due to your situation , you wanted to and that is the best anyone could have done in your situation . i know you may feel like you watched these acts happen and did nothing about it to help , therefore it is your fault , but that is realistically not true . you were not the root of the problem , therefore even if somehow you overcame your social anxiety which is very very rare and not many people can do , it would not of changed much as you were not the root of the problem , you can not change the way your father acted , that is down to him . also try and put anyone else in that situation , with the levels of social anxiety you had and also your verbal levels , no one could have done better than you did . people blame themselves for things happening all the time as they did not interfere , yet they fail to realise that interfering does not change the root of the problem and can actually make it worse sometimes , so do not blame yourself for not being able to speak , you yourself know there is nothing you could do about it , and that speaking would not of changed your fathers acts . sometimes there are things in life that we can simply not help , feeling helpless is common , however you should never feel like you are the blame , and deep down you know that your e not . <end>

response: <start> those are definitely always good rules to live by , i am with you there . i have been eating overall healthier food within the past few months due to some digestive issues awhile back . although i have slip ups occasionally , but i have been pretty consistent . it is a slow process . my newest endeavor has been eliminating enriched flour from my diet and substituting whole grain . in my opinion , it is been one of the easiest dietary habits to build . sugar though oh man , that would be a tough one sugar is in evvvvverything and the substitutes do not always turn out to be healthier after studies over time . not to mention my insane sweet tooth . i have made an effort on several occasions within the last month to make sweet treats at home since almost anything homemade is healthier and you can see what is going into it . i still slip up sometimes , but i am getting there can i ask you for any tips or tricks that make a lasting impression fiber yogurt i have been slacking on getting back to exercising coming out of this winter , but , oddly enough , i have been getting more rigorous exercise the past few weeks . thank gob for the sunshine . i really like that you suggested some things outside of the medical realm . it is always a good idea to check those basics diet and exercise before getting too caught up . thank you for the reminder . i have been reading more and more that the bacteria in your digestive tract can because depression which is huge i feel like i should start taking probiotics again , i stopped bc i was too broke to afford them a couple years ago and kinda just let it slipped under my radar . <end>

response: <start> hi , sorry it took me a while to get back at you , i missed the reply notification . regarding sugar and flour , in my case i just simply reduced the amount of intake . like you i also have a sweet tooth and i love pizza , bread , pasta etc so i just buy or consume sweets when i have not had for a few days . in the end for me , diet is all about balance . if i have a slip up day , i make sure to have a few good ones following it . making your own sweets is a great way to know what you are consuming , but unfortunately i can not advise you on how to stop completely , i am myself not able to hah . what triggered me in trying to find new ways was the fact my medicine was not effective anymore and i did not like the prospect of trying a new one and only knowing after a few months if it worked . i have had intestinal problems getting used to the dutch culture short lunches and lots of bread and realized it was the same feeling as back then . when taking an anti inflammatory for other issues physical i have noticed i had a few good days afterwards . as you mentioned , after reading about gut flora and all , it was a quick and easy decision to try to help it . my breakfast is a bowl of a fiber source , yoghurt or milk and a fruit honey or jam to change it up a bit . like you , i also have my slip up days weeks and fail to follow my rules , but the trick i use is just accept the slip up and get back at it again . also , having a heavier lunch and earlier lighter dinner helped a lot too . back to the physical part , i would been using ill fitted shoes for a season , making my right foot cramp up . resulting in imbalanced walking . other sport related injuries added to the imbalance of my hips and neck . i had pains and issues literally from my head to toes . physiotherapy and yoga helped me target those areas and although i am not completely fit or in shape , i do not longer feel years older my age . it is also a long and slow process , as you have to bring everything back to and start building it up again but i can now fall asleep in under mins and stay asleep for hours without any extra meds those were nasty . therapy sessions are not a huge mind tangle anymore and i feel as i have only one thing left to work out why it is keeping me from growing out of this hole . i have now been a week without taking my meds own decision , i do not advise on stopping them yourself , it was a move made out of anger and not well thought out , without my therapist doc knowing , in short a dumb move but it felt as the right one i think i am quite alright at listening to my body . it payed off greatly for me as most outcomes so far are positives , the positive effects of the medicine were no longer there but the negative ones were . i am keeping track of my thoughts and feelings and will discuss it with my therapist next session , to make sure it is not just a periodic thing . this is all simplified but in general what happened in my situation many issues snowballed into a huge hole i am now slowly crawling out of . tlr what i am trying to say is pace and patience are key , slow and steady wins the race even though i lack those in my bad days . fix the little things you can , so you can free up resources to help with the bigger ones . i am always up for a chat or discussion if you or anyone else is willing to , hit me up <end>

title: <start> i do not know what to do anymore . i am barely years old <end>
response: <start> i am so sorry you are going through this . depression does not have to be caused by circumstances . sometimes it is negative thought patterns . sometimes it is a chemical imbalance in the brain . for me it was both of those things . but there are many other reasons as well . i suggest finding a therapist if you can . visit different therapists until you find one that you like and trust . they can help you learn coping skills and new though processes as well as figure out what the root of the depression is . if it is a chemical imbalance , finding a psychiatrist to talk about medication with might also be helpful . also , having friends or family members who are willing to be with you and help you figure out what is going on is helpful . i hope you find someone who can help you . depression is a liar . it loves to tell you lies about yourself . as real as they may seem , try your best not to believe them . they are lies , not the truth . you are worthy and you are loved . i am praying for you <end>

title: <start> i can not make friends . <end>
response: <start> mind a little advice it may or may not work for you , but it did for me . i am was painfully shy . i would walk around a store for an hour for fear of looking stupid to a clerk if i asked for help finding something . try this just for one week . smile at one complete stranger you pass on the street in a store . just one stranger , one time per day . maybe they will smile back . maybe they will give you a weird look . maybe they will say hi or just ignore you . no judgement for any of it . just smile an acknowledgement type smile like i notice you are human and alive and take note of the reactions . i was positively surprised . mm , of course . <end>

title: <start> so , do i have depression or not <end>
response: <start> from a clinical perspective , you are clearly exhibiting depressive symptoms . generally speaking , if you experience these symptoms for more than two weeks , you likely have some form of depression . repression is also a bit of an outdated explanation at least in the us for depression as well i am surprised your psychologist brought that up . where are you located and what medication are you taking if you are comfortable sharing , of course i know you are not in the us , but it is still likely you are taking a commonly known antidepressant . anyway , regardless if you are diagnosed with depression or not , your feelings are incredibly valid . if these symptoms are inhibiting your ability to function regardless if they are due to some chemical imbalance , your experiences , or both then they are absolutely worth looking into treating . please do not let anyone undermine how you are feeling . <end>

response: <start> yes , i think your psychologist might be sticking to outdated freudian usque ideas with zero scientific basis which is unfortunately quite common in anecdotal experience even in the us . looking into it , alloxan seems quite interesting . it is somewhat similar to antidepressants popular in the us sris such as fluoxetine prozac and servaline aloft , as it appears to work with serotonin neurotransmitter responsible for mood in case you are unfamiliar receptors , but in a different way . nonetheless , i am very glad it appears to be helping with self harm . that is good you are also taking something for your concentration as well . you are welcome depression is tough and i sincerely hope you get the help that you need . you seem to be quite proactive about getting help , which is an amazing and brave step towards recovery . i wish you the very best <end>

title: <start> please tell me what i can do . i have never felt so lost as this . <end>
response: <start> hi op , i am really sorry to hear you are going through all that . something that has really helped me and my anxious paranoid thoughts is the calm app . it is free and it has lots of coping tools that you can access right away when you are having trouble regulating . if possible , try to make an appointment with your dr . as soon as possible because they can recommend you to therapy or meds if that is helpful . i take meds daily and go to therapy in dark times to get me through but i also have health insurance , you might still qualify under your parents plan if they have any . i also really like to read feeling good by dr . burns and the untethered soul by michael singer when i can not stop ruminating . talk with your boyfriend about how you feel about his testing , maybe mention you feel insecure about it . it does not mean he will stop , but if he cares then he will try to reassure you about the relationship , if not then you have your answer . lastly , i have trouble not seeing my life through a dark lens , one thing that has helped is i keep a gratitude journal where i write three good things that happened each day and i write down three things i have accomplished each day , even if they are small , or if i do not believe them . good luck , i know you can do it , do not give up , we are here for you <end>

title: <start> to see a psychologist or not <end>
response: <start> as someone who has both depression and ptsd i can say that counselling was really helpful for me . i do not go all the time , but over the past ten years when i have hit rough spots i have gone to see someone . i can only speak to my own experience but for me when my head gets messy and i can not sort everything out for myself , sometimes saying these things out loud and getting an outsider to hear what i am saying can be really useful . they notice the patterns that are developing that i can not see , or they know techniques of coping that are more effective than the methods that i have been using . you have to find someone who you feel comfortable with and that is a personality thing , i have had psychologists that i have clicked with instantly and ones who i saw once and walked out knowing that i would never see that person again . one tip that worked for me , may work for you , i found psychologists who worked with cut cognitive behavioural therapy work best for me when it comes to building new mental pathways to deal with everything . it works best if you fully commit to really trying both in sessions and following through with the techniques afterwards on your own . it is a personal choice of figuring out what works for you , do some research , look at therapists who are local to you , if it feels right or it is something that you genuinely want to explore that option i would try it . <end>

title: <start> hey , i have some questions <end>
response: <start> having depressive episodes where your depression is worse is absolutely normal your feelings are valid and your symptoms are real . i also experience a lot of physical symptoms as a result of my depression and anxiety , as well as memory loss and disorganization . th if you do not feel comfortable with your therapist , you may want to talk to your parents about potentially looking for a new one . obviously that will not help if it is not specific to this therapist , but it might be worth a try . as for talking to your friends , you should absolutely reach out to people you feel comfortable with for support my go to in order to make sure i am not burdening my friends is to ask do you have the emotional stamina to listen to me right now that gives them the opportunity to say no if they are too stressed or sad because of their own problems , and also reassures you that they are actively listening . i really hope this helps i have been and depressed before and it is far from fun . <end>
