title: <start> i have stopped talking about it <end>
response: <start> i am sorry you feel you can not turn to them for help . to be fair , we are all raised like cavemen when it comes to dealing with mental issues . they are at a loss to help you , and sometimes people who can not understand depression are afraid to say the wrong thing and make it worse . i am not letting them off the hook they should try to at least meet you on some level if they care about you . but they do not know where to start , and frankly , they are not qualified to do much more than just be there for you , anyway . what you need is a neutral third party . it is time to seek some professional help , and i say from experience that even if that idea terrifies you , keeping quiet about what you are going through is the very worst thing you can do . and a neutral party , like a therapist , can help you at least make sense of what you are going through . talking helps . it is like letting the air out of balloon , and it sounds like your balloon is pretty full . do not let it pop . because even if the do not know how to help you , the people in your life do not want to lose you . you can absolutely do this , though . i promise . <end>

title: <start> no job , no money , no friends , no family , no pets , no future . <end>
response: <start> i have never been married . i have never had much family . never had many friends . i have a cat but honestly that does not stop me from wanting to end it all sometimes . i just got my bachelors degree and the only jobs willing to interview me are a sales position with horizon and a janitorial job . these are also the first two interviews i have gotten in the six months since graduating . all of my life plans have shot out the fucking windows and i feel like i am losing my mind . what i am trying to say is take my advice with a grain of salt because obviously i know even less about what i am doing than most . i hope things level out for you . get a job , even if it is a shitty one , save some money , get a therapist if that is your thing . handling things is hard , believe me i know . i have been handling things since i was fifteen . and dealing with mental illness fucking sucks , but the fact that you are still trying means you are handling it . it might not be the prettiest way , or the most effective way , but you are fucking handling your shit . and that is something to be proud of . do not give up because things are bumpy . get a pet fish . they are inexpensive and a good starter pet . it is something to take care of . buy a plant that makes you happy . i recommend a marigold . find somewhere to volunteer . donate some plasma . donate some sperm if i am correct in thinking you are a cis man . learn how to crochet . do not stop just because it is easier . keep . fucking . going . edit spelling error . <end>

title: <start> need some support . <end>
response: <start> rough brother , i am here to talk if you want . i spent time with my grandfather in hospice and that was only a few days , it gets tough to say the least sometimes and i had to almost force my family to help out . what is the family business like , would it make you happy to grow that or maybe sell it you can only take what you can take . do not run yourself into the ground . i would just say every morning remind yourself why you do it . do this because i love her , remember comments like what she makes are just words . i have my goals that help me on days like that , long run and i go further . write some chapters in a book . something that makes me feel accomplished every day so that if someone attacks my character i have a foundation of goals i have already done that morning to fall back on . your soul has no financial value so let us not measure it by our current bank balance . do not let financial get you down if they are is what i am trying to say . <end>

title: <start> can visiting the past too often worsen your depression <end>
response: <start> it depends . i totally live in the past and i know it is hurting me . that is one of the things that is making me depressed . listening to music i listened to years ago makes me sad , because life back then was great and now i feel like shit . the same goes for when i am playing old games i played back then . it also makes me more depressed , because i realize how time flies and that is really killing me . right now i am trying to force myself to listen to music i do not know yet , because over the years i never had time to do it , so there is a lot of stuff i have to work through . one of my triggers for depression is the feeling that i am not moving forward , nothing s changing , that is why i try to listen to new stuff i do not know yet . to feel like something has changed and to create new memories i can look back upon . now , listening to music you enjoyed in the s can also be a good thing , if it improves your mood . but if it drags you down and stirs up negative thoughts , you should obviously stop . same goes for video games . but if you have not played these games already , and you just enjoy them now , then there is nothing wrong with that . i mainly play old games , because i am not interested in the newer ones and do not want to spend that much money . basically if something might trigger your depression , stay away from it . but still , the best way to live life is to be in the present moment . have a look at r mindfulness and r meditation . helps greatly with my depression . and you should go see a therapist before wasting another year of your life . i wish i had not waited that long . <end>

response: <start> makes a lot of sense , sounds like we might be twins . x b luckily i listen to electronic music the most which has not really changed that much over the years . though i have noticed that out of all of them modern techno sounds very vamped out compare to the jams i listened to in the s . nevertheless dusted and drum bass have progressed very well over the year and they are more than enough to keep me in the present . x b one of the video games i own for the switch is the mega man x collection . i know it could not be a coincidence that i enjoy beaten mega man x , and which were for super intend from beginning to end . as soon as i got to the . and the plantation and sea saturn ones i started losing interest in this game and just wanted to beat them and get them over with . this apathy , of course , got worst when i got to and which are a little more recent both on the plantation , box and gamecube . x b is like its become a habit for me to be stuck in the past that the more i try to progress and stay in the present the more apathy i feel . it kinda helps out my mood in a way until i realize that the things i once enjoy are pretty much obsolete . till then i am already subscribed to r meditation http www . reedit . com r meditation and it has help me see life from a positive point of view . i guess i am going to check out r mindfulness http www . reedit . com r mindfulness in bit before i hit the sack <end>

title: <start> psychiatrist or therapist counselor <end>
response: <start> psychiatrist will prescribe more drugs . drugs are simply not a solution for a lot of people with mental illness . in this regard you have the option to keep rolling the dice and hoping to hit the secret combination of meds if such a combination exists that will diminish your symptoms . you also have the option not to do that . its a very personal decision whether or not to persevere with meds . it almost always entails withdraws and risks of side effects . you have to make that call . shrink or therapist will do talk therapy with you . i hold the secret bias that i think talk therapy can have benefits for most people note i said benefit not solution . there are more variables here though . its important to have the right fit with your therapist . therapy is like any relationship , some people naturally connect , others are like oil and water . therapy is no different . you phrase your question as an either or . are both not a possibility also , i think a lot of people feel i do not know if this is your situation or not that meds and therapy are the only ways to treat mental illness . its certainly a common misconception . there are many other things to try that could be helpful . <end>

title: <start> feel pretty lost , some help would be appreciated <end>
response: <start> firstly , i would like to start by saying you are not alone , i am actually also pretty lost in what i want to do due to lack of activities earlier in life , personally i want to do acting but that was not exactly going to suit well with my family so i ended up in business , which i like and am almost done but now i have decided i want to act professionally but i am going to be a senior so starting over now would just put me into more loans and i already have enough as is , as a kid i was not very social and was deemed the literal definition of a loser for a major part of my life , i had a . gap throughout high school , no significant other , no real friends , no award or recognition to my name , no nothing . but despite all this , my objective is to prove all those that called me loser wrong , and that is the reason that despite all the depressive and anxious states i go into , i still live on and continue , if someone like me got this far , you can go way further , and based on your story you sound like a true fighter , you have been through way more than i have and if you made it through all that you can make it through this stage of life too <end>

title: <start> no clue what to do <end>
response: <start> i feel the same way . i am , come from a conservative , mormon family . i graduated with a bunch of college credit and have won state and national championships with my rugby team . despite all this i feel lost . i have no idea who i am and what i need to be doing . my depression and anxiety have never been worse . to top it all off my parents think impure and crude for the shit i have done sexually . i feel worthless and unmotivated , which translates to being lazy but in my parents eyes . ink how to help you man but know that you are not alone . i have thought about suicide and made plans so many times and come so damn close to following through . i want it so bad , i want the release from the pain and the cycle of misery . again i have no idea if it gets better but just stick around to see if it does . <end>

title: <start> can i keep lying to my family <end>
response: <start> lying to your family is hurting not only you , but them . if god forbid something were to happen to you because of these feelings , your family might hold themselves accountable because they might see you lying as you not trusting them enough to tell them the truth they will sit with that guilt forever . they love you , my dear . you being honest with them is not a nuisance , it is not a bother . i used to lie to my family about how i was feeling , saying i was okay when i absolutely was not . and when i started to open up , mainly to my mother , i not only felt so free from no longer holding it in i also instantly felt closer to my family because they finally knew what i was struggling with . they want to help you , no matter what . do not feel guilty for grieving feeling bad . if anything , i am sure they are surprised that you claim to be doing so well after such a tough experience . i hope you feel comfortable enough to share how you are feeling with them , and i especially hope you start to feel better soon . stay strong , but also remember it is okay to not feel all the time . remember your family loves you , no matter what you may be dealing with . you can and will get through this <end>

title: <start> not sure how to continue <end>
response: <start> heezy soon you just described how i have been feeling for the past couple years of my life . over the course of the last few weeks i have posted similar forums to myriad websites trying to get an elucidation to how i am feeling , shopping for diagnoses basically and let me tell you it did not help . ink where i went wrong in my life and this oblivion state is frustrating . feeling stuck is fucking terrible . but not knowing the culprit is even more terrible . ink what you want to hear but it is best you seek professional help if accessible . i personally do not have access to that bc well i am a minor and i do not feel comfortable asking my guardians to connect me to help providers but if you can do it . it will leave you feeling much better . goeduck oxo <end>

title: <start> my whole day is ruined by small , irrelevant things <end>
response: <start> i struggle with letting small things ruin my day too . something that helped me in the past was to end every day by writing down things i was thankful for in a journal . sometimes it was as simple as i am thankful for peanut butter . but it really helped me to notice the good things about my day even if i felt like they were terrible days . it also allowed me to look back at all the things i was thankful for when i was feeling really down . you are so much more than your grades i know it is hard to believe , i still struggle to believe that . but it is so true . i try to think about myself years from now . am i really going to remember or care if i got the best grades probably not . i think back to when i was in high school and i do not care about my grades . i wish i would have been more involved in fun things but i do not even remember times when i did not do well . they are not important to me anymore . do the best you can . my friend s mom is a kindergarten teacher and she tells her students , it does not have to be perfect , just ish . this is something that is stuck with me as i try to recover from academic perfectionism . <end>

title: <start> i get really morose when i am tired <end>
response: <start> i feel you . . sadness is sneaky . . when you are experiencing the loss of a loved one they often tell you to keep busy to keep dark thoughts out . and for the most part it works but the moment you stop it all comes like a giant wave . being tired is bringing everything out like a tide . first , stop trying to snap out of this . forcing it to go is not the way . you need to acknowledge your feelings , whatever they are and be kind to them and mostly yourself . pain , anger , sorrow , it is all part of the journey there is no easy way out , i wish there was . talk it out as it happens , process it . suppressing it will only make you feel worse along the way trust me . however , as difficult as it may be , part of the kindness should be taking care of yourself . you are tired and you probably need it . if there is someone in your life that could help you actively relax , that would be great . remember you are strong , becoming even stronger and as quaint as it all may sound this too shall pass . <end>

title: <start> requesting advice using cut <end>
response: <start> cut is not a cure all . think of your response to depression as a bunch of different strategies , each one playing its own part . for example , meds , good relationships meaningful work exercise sunshine meditation quality sleep whatever else you do . cut is one thing , or one tool in your toolkit . it may not fix everything , but it can be very helpful for some things . cut , for example is very good at helping people to be aware of negative thoughts and to address them with logical reasoning , and evidence that contradicts them . x b tlr yes , its normal . sometimes you may have all the thoughts addressed and still feel bad . when that happens , apply one of your other strategies . <end>

title: <start> seeking advice for working with depressed partner <end>
response: <start> as someone who was in the same situation but on the depressed side of the relationship . overtime i felt bad i pushed my so away when i actually needed a hug and so is time the most . i felt frustrated all the time and alone and angry and since so was the only one there to care so sometimes got the load from me venting my depression . now i can not get into your so is mind but being straight with so really helped me to confide and feel safe with . i mostly had a hard to communicate what i was feeling . so pushing so away and being mean was my way to communicate with him , that what i actually wanted was a listening ear and someone to hold me tight . ink if this works for you but this really helped me . it made me realise so really cared for me . and wanted to be there for me . sometimes we just do not think we are worth someones care and time . <end>

title: <start> depression , need help <end>
response: <start> i am sorry , i am so so so sorry that life has treated you so badly that you feel the need to do this . i do not know if i can help by leaving a comment but i will try . i am sorry that you feel like you have disappointed everyone , i am sorry that people tell you such horrible things , and i am sorry that i cannot do more for you . you have not disappointed anyone , or at least you have not disappointed this stranger on the internet . you deserve better . depression is a long process , and i am sorry that you have been in it for so long . people will tell you that it will eventually go away but it does not . and that is ok , well it is not but , being depressed is not a bad thing , it just means that you are not feeling well . i hope you have not committed suicide by the time that i left this message , but please do not . you do not have to have been magically cured if you do not . you do not have to be something you are not . please , call the suicide hotline . try to pull through a little bit more . i know that you are tired of feeling sad , i know that you are tired of feeling like your worthless , but please just pull through a little more . i hope i helped , even if it was just a little bit . i hope that you do not or have not committed suicide . i hope i helped . <end>

title: <start> anyone here have reverse seasonal affective disorder i . e . summer depression if so , could use some advice <end>
response: <start> hey there , just want to chime in that you are not alone . myself and a lot of folks i know in life have a hard time with summer since it boosts their depression anxiety due to heat and so many others appearing energized and happier . for me , depression is chronic , so summer and winter are tougher than the more temperate seasons . water , shade , cool air a fan or ac , even if you got to go somewhere else like a cafe for it and taking it slow really help during hotter days . winter is just hard all around . i say this in support and if you need some ideas of how to manage . no rush in finding what helps you <end>

title: <start> i lost myself to depression <end>
response: <start> first of all , this was so beautifully written even though the content breaks my heart . secondly , a monster would not care to worry if he she is a monster , right i think you are good on that one . it almost seems archaic at this day and age , but i constantly have to remind myself of the simplicity of matlow s hierarchy of needs . physiologically , are you caring for yourself that hours of sleep is no joke it is a healer . hydration insanely important . i firmly believe it helps cognition as well as fighting fatigue . i can only speak on what has helped me with the hope of helping you . you have heard it all before . i know you have . pick one positive , healthy thing you can do for yourself and work on that . once you got that one down , pick another . but never cease reaching out for help when you need it . you have no idea how many people you are positively effecting by showing how brave someone can be by asking for help . and please reach out if you are suicidal <end>

title: <start> basic coping advice <end>
response: <start> i am sorry about your friend , i can only imagine how hard it was to lose him . well first of all if there are times at which there is absolutely no one you can talk to about depression , i would advise you to not take it very seriously . you were strong enough to be there for your friend and you will be strong enough to be there for yourself . i am not saying anything like talk to no one because you do not need to it is just that a lot of things are circumstantial so the way i see it they should not overly affect us . second , are you sure there is no one to talk about one or two things about depression obviously they can not replace your friend but maybe they could potentially offer a tiny amount of relief regarding your status currently are you working studying are you required to get out of bed in the morning if not , are you taking steps to change that finally , regardless of whether there are people to talk to about depression , have you made sure to not completely isolate yourself all in all i am sure me or some other editor would listen if you wanted to talk more . <end>

title: <start> i am sorry about your friend , i can only imagine how hard it was to lose him . well first of all if there are times at which there is absolutely no one you can talk to about depression , i would advise you to not take it very seriously . you were strong enough to be there for your friend and you will be strong enough to be there for yourself . i am not saying anything like talk to no one because you do not need to it is just that a lot of things are circumstantial so the way i see it they should not overly affect us . second , are you sure there is no one to talk about one or two things about depression obviously they can not replace your friend but maybe they could potentially offer a tiny amount of relief regarding your status currently are you working studying are you required to get out of bed in the morning if not , are you taking steps to change that finally , regardless of whether there are people to talk to about depression , have you made sure to not completely isolate yourself all in all i am sure me or some other editor would listen if you wanted to talk more . <end>
response: <start> i can say a few things here or there to relatives , but my family situation is difficult and no one is going to pay much attention unless i set my hair on fire , and i am not going to do that , i am just very low . i am self employed and set my own schedule . i have set it up right now to isolate myself as much as possible . i can see that is a bad idea . i could push myself to work more , i do not bother because my earnings are not much these days and that is one of the reasons i am depressed , but i guess that would be a motivator anyway . i did feel better when i worked over the weekend . i like what you said about being strong enough . it is what i always tried to make my friend believe he was , and what i tried to be for him . i need to do it now to prove that i was not kidding . i really appreciate your remarks . they are practical and helpful , and i will pay attention . thank you . <end>

response: <start> yeah i get what you are saying about the family . but that is what family is for , maybe you could say a thing or two if they get it fine , if not , fine again . you know best . indeed you will inevitably have to pressure yourself , unfortunately that is normal for all of us struggling since you make your own schedule maybe get an extra day off just to cheat the system p yeah like working is not guaranteed to solve everything but it provides a nice pillow to fall back to . and you do not have to be super social or extra happy around others but complete isolation will only make things worse , there is no denying that . i am very glad i could say something useful . take care friend . <end>

title: <start> support advice relating just reading and passing through , everything is appreciated <end>
response: <start> oooo i have got so many questions . . what do you mean without any introduction there are no ways how it should work , i have not seen a manual anywhere . most importantly , why would you hate yourself for any of that . why do you think the hospitalization would help you . why do you say try to function why do you think you are not functioning properly . are you going to lie to the doctors i do not think so . why would you worry about taking someone s place then tell them i feel i may be taking someone else s place , so if someone suicidal needs help and you do not have room i would be happy to go . how do you know you did not slow down you mother s cancer how do you know she was able to get good but it was not because you are a good child how do you know the cancer would not appear anyway and that you helped her defeat it . are you saying the psychotherapy used to help what do you think was it that helped x b i think you are catching my drift here some questions were not rhetorical though . you seem like an extremely thoughtful mindful person . sometimes it can be a burden to be honest . . . but you should be proud of it . use it as a tool , do not let it overwhelm you . and do not use it to find excuses to feel sad i do not know if this applies to you but if it does know that it is normal , i am not accusing you and i say it with a tremendous amount of love . i understand feeling anxious may not be all that is contributing to being depressed , but anxiety was what i could comment on from what you posted . i would be happy to give some more feedback if you have more to say , it is a debate after all imo . <end>

response: <start> i know exactly how you feel . i had to spend an entire semester trying to work through that fog . x b the best way to get through this is to start early and to start scaffolding your work into pieces . do not do everything at once , because you do not have to do that . x b for an example , i have an assignment due next monday . i spend days searching for journal articles and taking notes on them . the third day i will start writing page . i then dedicate a day per page until i reach the minimum or maximum amount . so that way i am producing quality work without feeling overworked . the key though is to start early . i would start weeks in advance before my midterms and assignments . i was able to maintain a . ish gap that way . <end>

title: <start> i have not been taking my antidepressants , and now my mom hates me . seeking advice <end>
response: <start> there is really nothing wrong with taking medication for mental health problems and is no different to taking medication for other health reasons . i think you should try and give them a second chance and if servaline in particular does not suit you then there are others you can try . could you also get a different counsellor if you feel that your current one is not really making a difference for you i understand how overwhelming it all is , especially for your age , but i think that your moms anger shows how much she cares about you and wants you to get better but also wants you to try and make an effort to get better too . maybe try and talk to her about how you feel about taking the medication and also how you feel about the counselling . i think in this situation its important that you are honest with her . also you are not a failure or a bad person you are just struggling with your mental health and that is ok . you are also quite young so its understandable that you would find all of this overwhelming as i can imagine its a lot of pressure for you . good luck with it all and i hope things get better for you <end>

title: <start> can you just define me so i can understand if i have <end>
response: <start> basically you are scared af of abandonment you are always having paranoid thoughts about people you love leaving you or losing them in any way . you also exaggerate the consequences of their abandonment on your life . that leads to you seeking reassurance all the time and doing desperate gestures in order to keep them in your life , like going out of your way to please them or threating them with self harm in case they want to leave you . sometimes , you may also push their boundaries by being extremely mean rude to them , just to prove yourself they are not going to abandon you , not even at your worst behavior . <end>

title: <start> stuck in a rut . how do i get out <end>
response: <start> you are not lazy , depression kills motivation and energy . you are working really hard and you have a lot of things going on . if you can try making your to do lists smaller , setting yourself up for failure every single day is just being cruel to yourself . you need to give yourself a little breathing room . try putting your self care on your to do list , then you are looking after yourself and checking things off . i also put something really easy on there , a thing i have to do and i know i am kind of kidding myself but its another thing i would probably put off forget . if you have the ability try and rearrange a few things so you have a day to try and unwind with the basics to do , go for a coffee , clean your living space , go see a friend . personal time is so important for me otherwise i crash and burn after a while . maybe talk to a friend or family member and see if they can help with anything you are struggling with in my experience you are working harder than you think and you are likely doing better than you think you are . stress about organisation of events and things like that is completely normal but depression , anxiety and stress all lie to you , they make you doubt yourself , they make you feel like you are not doing enough . you are . no one will be as critical as you are , no one will notice the things you do . you have done what you can , that is all you could have done . it will be fine and now what is done is done and stressing can not change it . get through it best you can , try and except the fact you worked really hard and should give yourself a break . in my experience there is an awful lot of people out there , myself included that a lot of time they do not know what is going on , they do not quite get it , like they are a fraud , a failure and that life is overwhelming . all of that is a valid way to feel some times , life s hard , works confusing , people are difficult and a million other things make things tough and make you feel like you are drowning . all you can do when it gets really bad is make sure they cover the basics , self care is so important , talking really helps , eat well and try and realise before it gets to much that you are burning out so you can ease up on yourself . you are doing better than you think you are and people will appreciate all of your efforts . <end>

title: <start> depressed vs just not wanting to do something <end>
response: <start> one point of distinction is that when you are depressed looking at a thing you once cared about or derived value from is not the same experience . specifically , the thing which you enjoyed doing or pursued with determination in the past appears pointless . the pointlessness of the thing makes it hard to do , rather than it being hard to do because it is simply not a personal priority at that time . i think there is nothing wrong with simply deciding that something is no longer a priority ie housework , using a running machine , sketching . this is a normal thing people do when they are not depressed . they stop doing things , and start others as a normal matter of course . there is a problem when many or all of the things you once enjoyed look like crap , and you stop doing all the stuff that once made you happy because it is all become blew . <end>

title: <start> my boyfriend needs me to be happier <end>
response: <start> i am really sorry that you guys are going through this and feel for both of you as it seems you are both facing complicated challenges right now and its affecting each of you personally , and also your relationship together . it seems like there is a lot more you guys need to unpack there , and it looks like the conversation stopped at the point the be happier bomb was dropped . i guess that is understandable , because it sounds like that hurt a lot . this is not the time to draw any conclusions though , because there is probably a bunch of stuff yet to discuss about how the two of you can do better . be happier obviously is not the solution because its so tricky for any human to attain with consistency , let alone someone who is depressed unhappiness being the nature of the beast . but that does not mean the two of you can not do better together and that means going back and figuring out how to do the hard stuff together as a team . <end>

title: <start> situational depression <end>
response: <start> when i was in my first long term relationship i experienced those bursts in the sense that i was only okay when i was near my girlfriend . and before that was constant . most people feel like that when something or someone is not present at the moment and they are not doing anything productive . for me music and art was something to keep me occupied and happy with being by myself without anyone else . i suggest any kind of hobby that distracts you while keeping you engaged in self expression would help very much . <end>

title: <start> brain games exercises to help brain recover from depression . <end>
response: <start> it is going to sound cliche but personally i have found meditation and journaling to be helpful . for meditation , i really like the app oak , it only has a few guided meditations but you can also set an unguided one and it is completely free . i am trying out headspace now and it is not bad but kind of obnoxious how it wants you to upgrade to a paid account all the time . with journaling , i will try to do it right after meditating , and i just write about whatever comes to mind . occasionally i will pull up a list of questions to ask yourself in interest and pick one to write about , but i find just getting my thoughts out of my head is the most helpful . if you write anything negative about yourself , scratch it out and write something positive to help shift your mindset . i also always mark the next blank page so i do not go back and reread my previous entries , not sure why but it helps me to just leave those old thoughts in the past . i hope you get better soon <end>

title: <start> moderate depression question about medicine and validity of mental well fare as something real <end>
response: <start> i am not a medical professional but i have taken every medicine you mentioned . quetiapine is used for sleep but is also anti anxiety . it was very effective for me for anxiety and is used in the states for anxiety according to my doc . this may account for your increase in benzo use when you stopped taking it . lately benzol have fallen under scrutiny for causing short term memory loss but i know when i had paralyzing anxiety i did not care about short term memory , i could barely breathe . it looks like your old medicines were trying to reach the same result in a different way less benzo . i have tried so many medicines over the years it kills me . the way i see it that is if you have a medicine combo that works for you then great i am happy for you . the quick action of benzol can be quite a relief but , in my experience , for my condition , i need something more . i recently had aripiprazole added to my regimen and i am slowing and hopefully stopping benzol but this is just because my anxiety is greatly reduced and i want to take the least medication possible , not because i have had any ill effects from benzol . i have taken them daily for almost years and i have not noticed any bad effects , addiction , or increase in dosage . if you are thinking of stopping any of your meds please talk to your doctor first . i have had some serious withdrawal issues with antidepressants . i wish you well <end>

title: <start> i cried at work because my boss put in notice . why does every reaction i have in my life stem back to being groomed as a child <end>
response: <start> how touching and genuinely heart felt your tears must have appeared to anyone who understood how you felt about your boss . its lovely having colleagues that garner our genuine respect and affection , and you are so fortunate to have been in a workplace where you could experience such a meaningful relationship . of course you felt sad about him leaving . i am really moved by your experience here you are clearly a very sensitive and caring human being . shame on you for caring about another person like that g x b none of us know what tomorrow holds in store for us , so no point fretting about boss . you could spend all that time wearing yourself down to find out they are a total teddy bear . or you could have someone less than ideal , but the fact is that all that worry suffering beforehand will do nothing to prevent or change that fact . one day at a time . make the most of each day . stop . breathe . be kind to yourself . repeat . you have got this . <end>

title: <start> how to accept that you have no friends <end>
response: <start> instead of accepting this , it sounds like you need to start cutting these friends out of your life . if they only hit you up to rant , just do not plan stuff with them . stop responding to them , just like they do not respond to you . in the meantime , search for new friends , new people you can hang out with and feel appreciated . build new relationships that will actually help you , instead of accepting that the current ones are not working . i know this all sounds tough , and it will probably take time do not rush yourself with it . talk it over with your psychiatrist as well , so as to get through the idea of cutting those people out of your life and putting yourself out there to meet new people . talk to your boyfriend about it if you want to as well . <end>

title: <start> i feel hopeless <end>
response: <start> you are perfectly normal for what you have been through . . . but apparently you are ready for change . when my meds stopped working i took up exercise . that was the only thing i did . crawl out of bed once a day to go for a half hour walk . then i started adding exercises that i thought good for my ideas . not a lot . only goal was to do it every day . then add a little something . and do that every day . the abyss of the hole in me did not go away , first i stopped drowning in it and learned how to hold still and float . the i learned to doggy paddle , then swim out of it , etc , til i got to a place where i stopped tripping and falling in it all the time . but just a little bit each day . get you some sleep , there ll be plenty of gwown up times when you wish you could sleep more <end>

title: <start> at risk of losing the only thing i have left . . . please help sorry it is a long one <end>
response: <start> i am not a parent , i am a teenager . as a child i moved around a lot . we never really stayed in one place for very long . the longest was china for . years . over the time my family and i adopted the view that our home was not in canada where we were born but rather wherever the rest of us were . moving can be a little difficult on a child . for me leaving china was the hardest move . but i can also say with certainty that it was a lot easier than loosing my mother would have been . many schools have foreign language programs , and experience in other countries can be very beneficial in life . in my opinion i would highly advise going to norway . splitting a family up is more difficult on a child than a move , and it sounds like it would also be the right decision for you . whatever you decide , i wish you the best . <end>

title: <start> what are some safe and efficient antidepressants <end>
response: <start> antidepressants are not meant to treat laziness or provide you with discipline that is not how human behaviour works , and certainly is not reflective of what depression actually is . i would first go to see a gp primary care doctor and find out whether you do indeed have any symptoms that would benefit from an antidepressant . if you do end up taking one , i am afraid there does not exist a medication with no side effects whatsoever . the common antidepressant classes are not addictive i . e . typically do not tend to because withdrawal symptoms but all require slow weaning to prevent relapse of symptoms . the most commonly prescribed first line antidepressants sris such as fluoxetine , servaline , citalopram have few serious side effects compared with other classes that were more popular first line treatments in the past , but again no such thing as a drug without side effects . <end>

title: <start> i hear voices and i need someone in my life who can help me <end>
response: <start> sorry you are feeling like this . lots of people have a sort of internal monologue , and plenty even say those internal thoughts to themselves this is quite normal , as long as you are able to recognise that the voice originates from you i . e . those are your own thoughts , and do not feel like thoughts that have been planted there by originate from someone else . if you are experiencing the latter , e . g . feeling you are overhearing other people s voices when you are alone , or feeling like someone is actually putting thoughts into your head , and you are convinced that this is really happening , these are symptoms of psychosis , which can be seen in schizophrenia , bipolar disorder and extreme depression . if that is the case , you need to seek medical help . in terms of the loneliness i understand , but even though it seems endless , high school will pass . i connected with very few people at high school or secondary school where i am from , and part of the problem is that you are lumped together in classes with people with whom you may have nothing in common you do not get to choose the people you are stuck with most of the time . this changes somewhat after high school it is easier to choose your companions at , say , university , and on top of that the majority of people are less mean you obviously still get some cruel people , but the outside world is not the same as the vipers nest that is high school . in the meantime while you might be struggling to make friends at school , how about outside school what do you enjoy sport film photography walking outdoors board games reading art cycling there may well be societies for some all of these things near where you live , and the internet will be able to tell you for certain . even if you can not think of anything you are into that would have a society , you could always consider taking up one of those things as a new hobby and meeting people that way . you may even find a girlfriend this way , if that is what you would like . good luck with it i was also bullied quite badly for a period in secondary school , and i can not tell you how much easier life can become in terms of making friends and enjoying life , once you are able to choose your own . keep pushing through you have got this <end>

title: <start> my soul has been burnt almost completely <end>
response: <start> i am so sorry that you are feeling this way . i know how you feel , though . i am going through , feeling and thinking some of the same things . i do not want to make this about me , though . i definitely think you need to find a counselor that specializes in grief and trauma . maybe someone whose skilled in cognitive behavioral therapy . you have gone through some great loss , and the loneliness , emptiness and depression you are experiencing is normal and expected . your desire to be with your loved ones is only natural , but they would never want you to hurt yourself . they love you and would want you to try to go on living until it is your time , naturally , to go home . you have got to make that first step and reach out to a counselor that can help you deal with your feelings . there are people that care about you on this earth that would be so very sad if you were not here anymore . i care , and i only know you from what you have written . i am also here if you want to talk . if the feelings and thoughts you are having become overwhelming , please go to your nearest emergency room , or contact a suicide prevention center . just remember , there are people who do care about you and will be there for you in your time of suffering . <end>

title: <start> am i depressed or deeply insecure <end>
response: <start> i cannot diagnose you , but i will say that you clearly are not happy , and in a bad place . whether you are clinically depressed , or deeply insecure either sound very painful to be going through . whatever the because i think you could benefit from seeing a psychologist or psychiatrist . in the past i would always write my pain off as not bad enough to justify wasting a professional s time , maybe if i could just pull myself together a bit , but honestly they are there to help with these things . also a big benefit i found was that they are removed from your social circle , so if you talk about things that you would be uncomfortable telling your friends , you do not have to worry about people treating you differently or whatever . not that you have to hide these feelings , but for me i definitely felt more comfortable knowing i could control when i felt like sharing something to friends . while you would not to tell them what you are experiencing if you do not want , do you think your parents or maybe an aunt or uncle , would help you see a psychologist or something i am not saying that like it is easy to reach out , i definitely struggled with it , but if you trust someone enough to help you see a professional i think that would be very helpful . <end>

title: <start> i am depressed and do not know what to do . <end>
response: <start> these things can be very difficult to talk about , especially because most people think since they are a good person they would recognize depression in someone . it is hard to explain that nothing is wrong , and you still feel horrible which is why you are saying it is a problem . i would suggest looking into how to see a psychologist or psychiatrist in your area to get checked out , i would also suggest trying to gather some couture videos or reedit posts that seem to resonate with you . it can be hard to explain on your own , so i found finding other sources that helped put things into words was very helpful for me for explaining to others . what i liked about seeing a professional was that they were removed from my social circle , so when i was being honest about some of the fucked up thoughts i was having , it stayed between them and me if that is what i wanted . i was miserable most of my life even though technically things around me were good , and even today it is hard to explain to some people that i was still depressed because none of that stuff matters for my clinical depression . it was not about how great people were to me , or the opportunities i had . i am on medication now and i finally do not feel miserable all the time for no reason . i am not saying that ll be the route you take , but i am definitely glad i got seen because all the well meaning people in my life could not help me , and they and also myself actually could not understand how something external was not the problem . i am not saying your family will not be supportive , but there can be a big communication gap with this stuff . <end>

title: <start> looking for support advice generally something like a mentor <end>
response: <start> in a bad way myself so can not really be a mentor . but have had health problems where i have been unable to move for hours in bed and the only thing that got me through is learning more about my illness i have a form of early onset arthritis and i used to read study in bed so my days were useful i divided the day into parts . from morning till about pm study college project work with small breaks . two pm to pm rest i used to go to my balcony or try a short walk around my building and do easy assignments . just read or work on a hobby with my hands and make my study timetable for tomorrow i found that i just paused thinking about the future too much as it just caused anxiety so i would concentrate on each chunk of the day and get through it . . . i hope it helps but also maybe you should see a therapist for your depression . if you are nervous to physically go maybe a helpline . <end>

title: <start> i do not have hobbies anymore <end>
response: <start> i have just mentioned on another thread . . but when i was stuck with suicidal ideation for a few months earlier this year , i learned how to bake bread . sounds silly , but because i could not concentrate on any of my normal pastimes reading , films , tv , i tried to find something that needed a different sort of concentration physical rather than mental i guess . it was easy to get absorbed in , it was rewarding to see at the end of the day that i would achieved something especially helpful on days when it was even a struggle to get dressed , i got chance to see myself improving getting the skills to be more creative and , you know . . i got nice bread out of it . it was also cheap got a couple of loaf tins off amazon for about , and the ingredients are all pretty inexpensive . just a thought <end>

title: <start> dating but still depressed <end>
response: <start> there is one thing that took me from to to realize . no one , not one solid fucking human will ever make it better . not by themselves . they can help . they can be the light on a dark day , make you laugh even as you cry , but in the end , they will never fill that void . i know it sounds cheery , but it really really comes from within . and i know , it sounds easier and harder than ever , but it is true and different for each person . the only way i explain , is for me , i had everything . i had an apartment , i was working on a social media startup as head of marketing , dating the ceo , at after dropping out of college mind you , everything i always thought i wanted . and every day , every second , the feeling of panic , empty , aching , panic , grew . i just knew i had to run . and after four years , i did . i moved cities , was crashing in a friends spare room , fixing phones and striping on the side just to pay for my meds . it was hard , i missed him , i missed the people , but i never missed the life . in fact , i was happy ish . i used my phone repair job to talk my way into consulting on an episode of mr . precedes and worked with brandon lesson . i realized through my striping job that i was a goth badass who is scars from picking did not matter . i found my confidence . in life and body . it took going from the best to the worst to realize that is all personal . the only happiness comes from satisfaction of self . i tried to make myself happy through doing what should be . it was not until i stopped trying to fill the hole with the perfect guy , the perfect life , the perfect job , and just was , for a while . on my own , with no expectations beyond feeding myself and my dog , just existing , that i found myself . that was when i realized i am most content with malcontent . i love living life on my toes , reacting , bantering , getting that sale , landing that dance . everything i was told would be wrong , was right . and yes , i realize i kinda branched from dating , but the concept still applies . i would bet money i do not have that many ppl have tried to fill that hole with many different things i mean , addiction and depression are a problem for a reason but , as hard as it is , you have to reach around that hole , and find yourself . i was taught to list my interests , from most important to least , by a doc , you read the list and use it to remind yourself there is different ways to define yourself beyond has guy or is depressed or cries and move to can recite the entire year plot of one piece by heart or can dismantle an phone blindfolded in minutes . remind you what makes you . i have dragged on way too much . anywhy , friend , feel free to pm me , i will talk , shoot the shit , listen to rants , lend a shoulder to cry , anything . i am pretty lonely right now , myself , so i am reachable any time . just ask i hope this is not too much of a novel d <end>

response: <start> hey i read your entire thing . you are in a tough time . can i suggest a few things it seems that your fam is in a situation they are confined together whether they like it or not and that is causing stress . . . it seems you need some space . . . if you need to speak to someone , call a helpline , i am sure there are free counselling helplines in your country . second , how about joining a local library or study centre . it may give you space for a few hours a day , you can use to catch up on studies , and i do not think your parents will mind if you tell them you want to get out for a few hours to study . for your studies , you can also go online for videos lessons on topics . . these are free oh and as for being a light sleeper , so am i , what works for me is exhausting myself physically and mentally in the day for a good deep sleep . <end>

title: <start> i need someone to talk to <end>
response: <start> i am here for you <end>

title: <start> any advice appreciated <end>
response: <start> you are very thoughtful about trying to do what is best for your friend . in this case , from being in a similar position to your friend , the best way you can be supportive is continue with your normal friendship . the thing we hate most is being labelled a survivor because what we want most is to be normal like everyone else . traumatic events from childhood do not put your friend in any immediate danger , so not speaking out is not personally harmful . last year i found out i have ptsd from my childhood . i started seeing a therapist and during my intake appointment , my childhood came up . having to retell some of the stories was really , really hard . for a few days after that intake appointment , the memories would surface uncontrollably and i once cried publicly . the therapist also confirmed it was not necessary to talk about that trauma to help me with the behaviors i originally came to solve . sometimes there is no meaning to be found in reliving life experiences that only bring pain . a lot of times , the most helpful thing you can do in a friendship , or any relationship , is just listen . you have acknowledged to your friend that you are there for them . but there is nothing more you can or should do . listening and not losing your calmness and giving a sense of normalcy is what support is . you are a good friend for being supportive . the only other thing i can tell you is you might want to see a therapist yourself to get a medical professional s advice about how you can best help your friend . i hope this helps <end>

title: <start> i really need help coping with numbness <end>
response: <start> hi . . . i know i might not be much help but i just wanted to show some support . i am going through the same exact thing , more or less on some days . essentially , you have to force yourself to feel something . but then you do not believe that feeling is real because you are faking it and it could just be a terrible rabbit hole from there . if you want to talk , you can pm me for one thing , i suggest doing one thing that you remember gives you at least some sort of temporary excitement or happiness . of course , i would not suggest anything unhealthy , like drugs etc . and i am sure you have heard this a thousand times but exercise helps . talking to someone who would listen understand helps too . anyway , sorry for the rambling , i just spewed a bunch of possibly useless stuff from the top of my head , but i hope you reach out to someone and can get help and start getting better and obviously get completely better and find true happiness and contentment , as well as be able to feel true emotions again . peace <end>

title: <start> worthless <end>
response: <start> for starters i understand how you feel , i was in a similar position not that long ago . throughout high school i did have depression and anxiety but i did not know i had it , therefore throughout high school i had poor grades , poor enough that i actually ended up graduating with a . gap and no awards , no recognitions , no nothing , and then i failed my first year of college . throughout this entire time my family as well was disappointed in me , i was quite literally a loser , bad grades , no friends , no so , nothing . it was not until i was that i met people i could really call friends , which is honestly all i had for a while . i had a so during my first year of college , and because she made me happy , i feared my depression would return so i fear her leaving every day , then i find out i am moving to another state , which them meant id either have to make long distance work or end the relationship , then came the news that i was failing my classes , and soon after my of and i broke up for other reasons , ironically that day i was going to tell her i was moving , but i was shook by the breakup that nothing else came to mind , my final grades came in and i failed three of five classes , so here i am hanging on by a strand , with nothing left . i decided that now that i had nothing , i was going to use this move to make something out of myself , so i picked up new habits , got rid of old habits , and those friends i met at years old , we are all still really close even after i moved , they still talk to me and some have even come visit me , them my grades made a huge improvement when i started at the new school , and now i am a year away from graduating college with a . gap . i understand that things are hard for you right now , but if i , some kid from nowhere who was the definition of a loser , could turn his life around , i believe anyone can , after all , we are still alive so there is still time to turn things around <end>

title: <start> not having a set schedule makes me lazy . i work s a week and do fine when i am working , but when i am home and done have anything scheduled i can not convince myself to wake up before or get anything done anyone else does anyone else have suggestions <end>
response: <start> this is me . my therapist calls this high functioning coping skills . my depression is nearly debilitating . i can not make myself do anything i do not absolutely have to do and that includes school and work for me . those are my baseline . so i always show up . but anything else i can barely get up to eat when i am not working or at school . the advice i was given was to make a schedule for myself , i added a gym schedule , and keep going at it until it becomes your normal as well . it is kind of like fake it until you make it <end>

response: <start> if that is how she is then she is not a good therapist . i would heavily suggest seeing a different therapist . something that makes me feel better and gets my mind off things is to take a walk through nature and try and write down all the colors i see . its a little coping mechanism i made up that works pretty well , and forces you to pay more attention to all the color in the world around you , and just how beautiful it is . thus is kinda what i do whenever i feel like hurting myself or killing myself , and it just seems to wash those thoughts away . <end>

title: <start> ply read . i really need help <end>
response: <start> please do not do anything to harm yourself even more . i understand where you are coming from . when i was much younger , i was in a very similar situation as you . i felt alone . like no one cared . i had no support from my family and was too embarrassed to seek help from friends . after all they too were going through their fair share of problems . i did not want to take my life but i also did not want to live . i contemplated the idea and really thought about how everything would change . would i really be better off did i truly give life a shot perhaps it was a blessing in disguise but the idea came to mind that i could at the very least try to ask for help because a small piece of me still wanted to be here . after all i had nothing more to lose at this point . so i went to see a counselor from school . it helped to speak to someone about what is truly burdening you . trust me , you are not judged . you are not alone . call that hotline please . you can even give a fake name if you would like , but give yourself the chance to release everything you have been bottling up . you already took that step forward to make this post . please keep going . <end>

title: <start> how do deal with panic attacks <end>
response: <start> some general advice i was given that is helped me immensely how do you eat an elephant one bite at a time . plan out some small steps that will put you in the direction you want to head towards . make sure that first step is manageable . reward yourself when you achieve a step . above all , be patient with yourself . this will not be fixed overnight . more specific to panic attacks understand that your body is responding to your mind in flight fight freeze . i like to think of it as your monkey brain . deep belly breathing with one hand on your belly will calm you down . being in panic mode for extended period of time takes its toll on your body and mind . i find regular aerobic exercise reduces the intensity and duration of the panic attacks considerably . good luck on your journey <end>

title: <start> i think i am getting depressed <end>
response: <start> i think the only thing you can do is always remember that it gets better . <end>

title: <start> i have started a new job after being out of work for months . finding it tough . <end>
response: <start> i personally experience this myself whenever i take too much classes in school . i think i can take on a lot of classes after a small break and then i get stressed and sometimes end up crying at times . but with this situation its not really over nothing , form my experience the reason we feel so sad that we break down is because of being overwhelmed . and from my experience being overwhelmed is not just caused by too much work , it could be caused by a new experience that we did not or did foresee but we have to go through . i have moved from place to place for most of my life so i have been overwhelmed from getting back into the rhythm of things and new experiences multiple times , the way i cope is to look at it as a new opportunity , typically no one knows me when these experiences arise , so i see it as an opportunity to make a better version of myself , no one knows me therefore i can change a few habits that i am not fond of . so i recommend you try and look at this as a way to get rid of old habits or create new habits that you have wanted to make for yourself <end>

title: <start> i am afraid to get a therapist because i am a very shitty person . <end>
response: <start> the important thing is that you are self aware and that automatically puts you far ahead of all the truly shitty people out there . you want help even if you do not think you deserve it and to me , that says that there is hope for you becoming less shitty . x b therapists will recognize this and honestly they will respect it . people who admit they need to change are far easier to work with than people who do not think they have anything to change . you clearly fall in the former camp . x b we all do things that are selfish or unfair . shitty people either do not recognize these things or they rationalize them as positives . you are not a shitty person , and any therapist worth having would not think so either . x b get yourself a therapist and start yourself on the road to becoming the person you want to be . <end>

title: <start> in between place , is there any going back for me <end>
response: <start> do not go yet . give yourself another chance . if you need quick free help , text hope to . it has stopped many of my friends from making the same mistake you are about to <end>

title: <start> wellbutrin increase made it worse <end>
response: <start> increasing meds can make you feel lucky for a few days . it is a cruel fact of depression anxiety meds . also , wellbutrin is known to increase anxiety . that is the reason i came off it , i could not handle the anxiety it induced . so if that is what you are experiencing , you may need to talk to your prescriber about finding a different med . <end>

title: <start> how to get out of that limbo of lies and clinging <end>
response: <start> therapy , distracting yourself with positive things , exercise , people that are good for you , walks with your dog . do not date until you are fully ready . for me that was when i was not sad that the other person was not my ex anymore and i was excited to find the right person for me . did not work out and am now back in the same shitty situation as you . it sucks , but i am trying to stay as positive as possible that the right person is out there and i will find them when i am ready . take it easy on yourself . losing someone , rejection , can actually be just as painful if not more so than losing someone due to their death according to my therapist , which i think can be very true in certain circumstances . we lose the future we were hopeful for with that person by our sides , because they chose to remove themselves from our lives , that they would rather be alone than with us . shit hurts and you are aloud to grieve not sure where you live , but i have found that cod has been helpful to put me in a more calm stable mood . <end>

title: <start> i feel so lost , i do not know how much more i have left in me <end>
response: <start> the depression detaches us from realities . the you that was your successful self is still there . you have the same brain that achieved all that . what has changed is that your head has slipped into a habit of over processing and ovsessiving about the negative . we depressive have problems because of the way our heads process stimulus , not because of some crazy dumbing down brain rot . the old part of our brain has a place called the limbic system . the ls is heavily involved in our emotional response . i have never figured out why the ls has such a command of language , but it come up with automatic negative thoughts ants that we perceive in the form of our brains being completely hijacked by hearing rentless things such as i am a loser i am worthless i would do the world a favor by just being dead padda , padda , padda . . . that is the work of the ls . what happens in this horrible , soul killing barrage is that our prefrontal cortex the logic center , just behind the eyebrows tries desperately to counter the ants . the pfc detects the ants and we perceive the ants like a voice of authority in our heads . the ants are are real as the math your rd grade teacher taught to our psyche . the problem is , that the ants are complete fabrication and the pfc goes on a wild goosechase trying to are against them . but the pfc is passing in the wind . if the ant says i am a loser , the pfc gets caught up in a losing argument . there is no definition of a loser . loser is a taunt , not a real state of being . you can not make a single , universal definition of loser in the way you could define ceo or dean . defining loser is like defining the exact shape of a water drop . you can not . and neither can your pfc . but it tries . and tries . and tries . and before you know it , the pfc that you used to run your past life is mainly preoccupied with dealing with the drivel the ants throw out . ya , no , you can not get your old life back without your pfc focusing on the realities of real life your job and it is complexities , your social life , being a dad . so , what do you do about all this confrontation between the ants and the pfc stop the ants . it is like getting old , bickering married people to quit with that old roleplay and really get some life lived . i went through about therapists and re s and still had the same depression of years . i will not tell you what to do , but i will tell you what i did . i identified that i needed to control the ants . they were crippling me , hobbling me , holding me back from living and being productive . via many ways . i felt like i had zero control over anything , really not my in my ability to earn money , my finances , my kids , my household , traffic , nit even in control of what was goi g on in my own head . so , i deduced that creating some control in my life would , at the very least , serve to counter the feeling that nothing else was in my control . and i had little time to myself overbearing , controling now ex spouse and no money , of course . so i created a little world for myself i called the power trip . i had an old pair of running shoes . i would go out for a jog alone . and i created an experience of complete control . i would get out of earshot of the ex and start . i would say out loud something like i am in control of running steps on the right side of the sidewalk , and do it immediately . i am in control of taking deep breaths in a row . i am in control of pushing my left sleeve half way up my arm . i am in control of . . . you get the idea . i said it out loud because i that that much trouble otherwise escaping the ants . but during the full mind and body immersion od a power trip , my head did not have the capacity to speak , act and be creative for the next little control task to acknowledge any ants . i made time for my power trip about of days per week . about minutes at a time . if i could not jog , i walked . it worked . but in ways i never had anticipated . sure i got a little break form my ants my personal grade a anxiety . what also happens is that my pfc stopped playing it is stupid games with the ants . it is like my pfc stopped tolerating them . my pfc called their bs . and then the ants stopped . my pfc is now free from dealing with the stupid automatic negative thoughts endlessly spring from my limbic system . i have the freedom to use my pfc as i chose again . oddly enough , with the computing power of my prefrontal cortex in my control , my life is a millon times better than what it ever was as a depressive . maybe my story will help you . you have all my support . <end>

it worked . but in ways i never had anticipated . sure i got a little break form my ants my personal grade a anxiety . what also happens is that my pfc stopped playing it is stupid games with the ants . it is like my pfc stopped tolerating them . my pfc called their bs . and then the ants stopped . my pfc is now free from dealing with the stupid automatic negative thoughts endlessly spring from my limbic system . i have the freedom to use my pfc as i chose again . oddly enough , with the computing power of my prefrontal cortex in my control , my life is a millon times better than what it ever was as a depressive . maybe my story will help you . you have all my support . <end>

title: <start> thank you for your comments and support . intellectually i know and agree that stopping the ants is necessary and the mindfulness exercises you talk about are good ideas . i try . sometimes i can implement those strategies for days , even a week or two , but when i fall its so hard to get up again . <end>
response: <start> keep at it . your depression , like mine , was years and years in the making and reinforcing . the strategy i took is unique . after about decade of outside help , i asked myself , doing what i am doing , am i getting the results i want to get at this point in my life i was barely making money , catering to every whim of an ogre narcissist , and on the verge of failing to pay my bills and rent , and would lose custody of my kids with no residence . my kids were no the ogre s kids . the ogre almost dumped me of at an er to be committed for a suicidal breakdown once already , but chickened out because he would not get access to my child support money any more . the medicine made me feel jitter and jumpy and caused a racing heart at regular doses , so i was reduced to a bare minimum dose , so i do not think the drug manage my depression much . therapy was a place i went to and he or she let me talk . i felt like of the therapy was what i would say to the mirror after reading a self help article of better homes and gardens . i have a ba in psychology . i decided to add real begin science to my anti depression crusade . i experienced my depression setting up camp in my brain as a year old child , with a fairly simple life of school , a pet hermit crab , and little else . no friends a single toddler sibling , and hand off , detachment parents . i remember distinctly the automatic negative thoughts coming from the back rear of my head . the part of my head the tried in vein to counter the ants was the front part , the prefrontal cortex , as i much later learned . the back and front were at war . every night , i would sob in seething pain of hating to be alive and in shame and seeing guilt of feeling the way i felt . i hid it from my parents , although it was not hard . my mental picture of it all was like that of the last judgement with the horrors of hell at the bottom and the goodness of jesus and even up top , like the back bottom of my head and front top of my head . fast forward to my mid s and being on the bring of committed to an institution . i knew from my experience as a child , that the depression had a source in the brain . i looked at brain anatomy and best i can i identify , it is from the area of the limbic system and dorsal raphe nucleus . ls and don it was like the ls has a megaphone in my head and the pfc whispered . or , as if in the war in my head , the ls had rocket loungers and m s and the pfc had bb guns . total imbalance . so , as i explained , i sought out to balance the volume of the ls and pfc . from my classes in college , i k ew about neurons , a bit about how they fire in sequence and wire together and how muscle memory can trigger reflexive firing , luke when we tire our shoes . with repetition , executing the action of tying our shoes does not require the step by step thought process . turns out , it takes a certain number of hours of specific practice to get a certain chain of neuron to wire together . i . hours , you have a pretty good wiring , and with thousands of hours you are considered a professional or a master at something . well , guess how many hours in our lifetime we have spent mastering our depression especially in relation to hours spent on a specific depression counter measure . it is numbers . , , hours is nothing to judge success by when i know my brain has been actively supporting its own depressive habits for thousands of hours since i was years old . so , i took the approach of training like an athlete trains for an upcoming sports season . suppose would be soccer player chris gets some shin guards and soccer shoes , reads up a bit on soccer rules , and practices moves minutes per week in the weeks preceding the first game . suppose would be soccer player pat gets some shin guards , shoes and learns the rules also , but practices every single day . time spent learning to dribble the ball up and down the field , defend around opponent , heading an incoming ball , etc . if pat s total minutes of specific practice on repeating a single move of maneuvering the ball around a cone in practice is a total of minutes a day , times days a week time weeks of pre season , pat has accumulated house of specific practice on that maneuver . who is going to be more ready to perform as a soccer player at the first game the analogy is that i am the would be soccer player and the st game is an looming depressive episode . what i had to to was bring elements of purely objective reality into my anti depressive crusade . x number of minutes doing my in control exercise was one of those objective elements . nothing from my various therapists was ever that kind of specific . it was always well , how do you feel after . . . . how do you feel since . . . how are you feeling . . . . newsflash reporting a feeling is complete subjective . i needed balance in subjective and objective . not all or nothing , just some of each . it turns out , that is the key to overcome g depression , too . balance between the volume and authority of the various areas of our brains . <end>

title: <start> i need help . <end>
response: <start> one thing i would like to say is that you are incredibly self aware teen . it is really hard to understand your emotions and identity at any age . but at to understand and be aware about your emotions is very impressive . i definitely think your sexuality has caused you some anxiety , anger , and depression . i am now , but when i was i was struggling with my sexuality as well . i am a lesbian and i was so angry that i was the way i was . i wanted to be different , but obviously can not change who you are . it is okay to be scared . you are dealing with a lot right now . you need to tell yourself it is okay to feel mad . it is okay to feel sad . it is okay to be afraid do not fight the emotions . let them come to you . and welcome them . by doing this they will pass quicker . emotions come and go . they will pass but you can not ignore them , you must feel it fully . being in italy is probably causing you anxiety and stress as well . although it is a vacation , you are already mentally dealing with a lot of different issues so to be in a different part of world probably adds on to your stress . but please , understand that what you are feeling is okay and justified . x b when you do get home , maybe consider talking to a therapist . you could ask your school counselor or your parent if you feel comfortable i know that seems scary especially if you never seen a therapist before . but at your age , you are dealing with a lot of issues that most year olds do not have to deal with . so a therapist may help you . but even if you do not see a therapist , finding someone who accepts you for who you are is a great resource for you to have . talking to this someone will help you get feelings out and help you from not being so anxious all the time . x b i hope you the best x b feel free to respond to me i would love to reply back <end>

title: <start> how do you love yourself <end>
response: <start> sometimes loving yourself is a lot to ask . i sure do not love myself . tolerating yourself is a great first step . you do not have to walk around thinking your farts do not stink or make lists of the things you like about yourself . step is silencing the voice in your head that tells you all the mean things that make you hate yourself . recognize those thoughts and shut them down before they finish . i read somewhere that the best way to do it is to try your best every day . and your best is different every day , and that is ok . that way when the voice starts up you can always counter it with hey , i am trying my best that is the most you can ask of yourself . try your best and invalidate the voice . step is a bunch of baby steps . what do you want to change about yourself do not make a list . pick the very first thing that pops in your head . and little by little , work to change it . you do not have to fix it in a day . just do your best . then move on to the next thing , but only when you are ready . eventually , maybe you will not love yourself , but you will be more confident and in a better place . <end>
