title: <start> so utterly exhausted <end>
response: <start> i feel this way often , honestly . i think it is a result of feeling being stuck in the same routine day in and day out . life can start to feel pointless when you are always doing the same things , around the same people , and nothing seems to change . when i feel like this though i just let myself cry , really . even if it is only for five minutes , ten , or a half hour . it at least alleviates some of the pent up stress and emotion . then i try to do one nice thing for myself , like watch a show i love or look at flights for places i want to go . <end>

title: <start> i hate myself <end>
response: <start> depression sucks soosoo much that death seems like a better alternative . it feels like you are in the middle of a battlefield with you feet in cement , naked and being hit by fire . nowhere to escape . no shelter . no control . it is about the most terrifying thing a human can experience case in point is that death seem better that the deviating , relentless depression . the gaming is a diversion . it is an external one , so you are in control of turning it on and starting to play , but you are not in control of pushing the depression out of your head the game takes it away for a while . to forcefully shove the depression out of your own head for even a few minutes take control by saying out loud i am on control of . . . an do a small action . i am in control of setting my drink down on the edge of the piece of paper on the table , and do it . i am in control of moving my foot an inch to the left , and do it . be in control for am ton of different little things for like to minutes per day . your brain will love the balance . it is just what i did . but i merely suggest this tool because it is something that is free , accessible , and in your control . you have my support . <end>

title: <start> how to help my girlfriend with severe depression <end>
response: <start> this is such a hard place for you both . you are so close and so far . she is lucky to have you . please know that depression because of the way our brains process stimulus , not who we are . the cocktail of neurochemicals that causes the episodes rise and wane . in the immediate moment , a good way to power through it is to g ve yourself permission to focus on things you are in control of . i am in control of tawpi g my thumb and index finger together times i am in control of rolling this pencil inches to the left . do that for a good min , say out loud and execute for full immersion away from the depressive episode . full support from me , and lots of hope . <end>

title: <start> trauma if i can not bare to face my own memories how can i expect someone else to <end>
response: <start> hi friend . i am so very sorry about your trauma . as for the dating situation , it is kind of a fine line . do not immediately spill your guts , but it is totally ok to give them a heads up about your triggers and such . maybe give them a summary now and trickle out some details as you feel comfortable . the whole story does not need to all come out at once , especially if it is a hard story to tell . if they feel uncomfortable , it is their responsibility to let you know . and then you can come up with a solution together . also , congrats and from someone who has dealt with confidence issues their whole life , remember that no matter what you are going through , you are just as deserving of love and happiness as the next person . do not apologize for yourself . remind yourself of where you are and how far you have come . you are such a strong person for working through this and for not giving up on your dream . if you could go back in time and tell past you where you are , they would be so very proud of you . keep fighting friend . better days are coming , i can feel it . <end>

title: <start> struggling with a toxic ex girlfriend <end>
response: <start> this is tough . some people are manipulative like that . or maybe they do not know how they come off . maybe she legitimately just wanted to keep your friendship alive even though you did not want that at all . who knows . i do not have a great history of handling this kind of stuff . girl i liked in college dumped me right before summer , then during the summer would send me drunk flirty messages , only to be like wow that was embarrassing i must have drunk too much low hope you are doing well but my feelings have not changed the next morning she did this twice . much later , about months later , she must have been depressed so she reached out to me again this time looking to date for real . i was depressed so i agreed to . couple of months later she dumped me again . she pretty much saw me like a band aid . she still wanted to be friends . college then ended and i moved away . i blocked her on all social media and deleted all photos and texts of hers . she is tested me once or twice when she is in the area where i live but i do not respond . it is been a while and i think it would still bother me to see her or talk to her . some people are just good at getting under your skin , whether with malicious intentions or otherwise . i suggest cutting her off completely . people like that are toxic . you said you moved to the city to live with her . we are you considering other cities this sounds like a good time to make a move . my advice is probably really shitty but the main thing i want to say to you is that really sucks man , and i am so sorry she did this to you . i can relate a lot . <end>

title: <start> depression and going crazy <end>
response: <start> yes . see a dr . psychiatrist . crying all the time is definitely indicative of depression that mho needs medical intervention . untreated , i will cry myself to sleep nightly and wake up an hour or so later with a severe headache i have always assumed from dehydration , or just the clenching of the facial muscles . this is an exhausting and physically painful routine . also , see another therapist , maybe . every therapist psychologist counselor has a different approach , personality , and skill set . it is not easy to find a match . sorry , life can suck sometimes . actually , more like life can be a living hell sometimes . . . . but not always . you can msg me or someone you know online , call someone or find some way to connect with a human that is understanding . <end>

response: <start> hey . i am sorry you are going through all of this . i can not imagine the situation . i have dealt with suicidal ideation but beyond that this is all very far out of what i would be able to help you with . my main suggestion is to get professional help . if not for your entire family to help fix the dynamic then for yourself , to help you with your coping mechanisms . i do not think strangers on the internet can replace professional help . i think the first step of reaching out on this sub is important and i am not diminishing that . but i think as with most people on this subedit myself included professional help is the way to go . we can not provide much more than emotional support and maybe some sense of comradery . that is my opinion at least . i love this sub but i do not see it as a replacement for professional help . <end>

response: <start> when i had trouble not eating enough , i went to a dietician to make a plan of what i should be eating and what my target weight should be . before the appointment i was given a sheet to fill out with my eating habits from the past couple of days , so it might help if you record what you are eating and at what time of the day and then maybe plan a similar visit . i only had one visit , and then a month later one follow up visit . i hope this helps you <end>

title: <start> moderator applications <end>
response: <start> how old are you i am m will be in a couple of months , will remain m though . x b what timezone are you in gmt central european time x b how many hours will you contribute to the sub each day , but with the summer holidays nearing , it will be at least double . x b do you use reedit more from a pc or mobile device i browse on mobile , but i spend most of my time on reedit on a pc . x b do you have any previous moderation experience i have been a mod for r sellie for about a month now . what i lack in experience , i make up for in enthusiasm and an eager to learn . x b x b why should we choose you over other applicants what can you offer that is unique from other applicants i have suffered from depression when i was younger . i managed to overcome my darker periods by reaching out to people who had the same experience . in my opinion , the most important thing someone suffering from a depression needs is support . if it was not for the people who were there for me and who heard my voice , i would still be a dark little soul . x b do you have any special experience you can bring with you to the sub ie coding , automen , marketing apart from my own experience dealing with depression , i was on my high school student s council for six years , dealing with all kinds of problems at the school . i am also a big brother to twins year olds , which might not be a viable profession , but i feel that my brother and sister often reach out to me when they need someone to talk to . i am there when they need to vent or rant and i am always open to listen to what is on their mind and in their hearts . x b why do you think you have the right personality to fairly enforce the rules and policies in a mature manner apart from the above mentioned experience with depression , i am also a people person . i love helping people and being there for people who need it most . people on this sub want to get better and enjoy life , but unfortunately there are many people who leave rude comments , not knowing the impact they may have on those already struggling . since you never know what the reason behind a comment or posts is , those who break the rules have to be removed . by addressing the user and explaining clearly why their post was removed , this sub can remain a friendly and safe environment for people seeking help and those who are willing to help . x b if a post became popular but it violated a rule or two , what would you do remove it . popularity is great and all , but if a post violates the rules , it has to be removed . otherwise there might as well be no rules at all . i would remove the post , but give the user clear and detailed information why his her post was removed so they can learn from their mistakes and abide by the rules next time they post . <end>

title: <start> my self care plan , and i would appreciate some further advice . <end>
response: <start> hi it is great to see you come so far get comfortable with yourself take your alone time as your relaxation period . do not think about the bad that can happen too much , because your anxiety will end up shooting up . talk to the locals around where you are traveling to find out some awesome things foreigners do not really know about and explore take the opportunity to be exposed to the culture and use this time as a break from your daily life . it might be a bit difficult the first few days , but stay positive remember you have those at home waiting for you and supporting you through everything <end>

title: <start> procrastination . <end>
response: <start> master procrastinator here , procrastination can ruin lives so much that can lead to self loathing and depression i am not sure about the inverse , so there is none the wiser . in fact i am glad you wrote here . i will tell you some things from my experience do not rely on your panic monster too much . i . e . , do not rely on the idea that it is ok i will procrastinate but i will eventually panic near the end and get everything done . the reason is that the more one procrastinates the more one becomes resistant to panic . rely on your logic . you already have a plan of what you can salvage . sit down for more minutes and reaffirm it , and that is it . practical tricks do help . obviously do not spend the whole day clearing everything but clear your desk for sure . logout from all sorts of social media , if your phone rings too much disable it . in general set aside anything that can distract you . it is ok getting distracted from time time but no reason to not make an effort to minimize this . it does get easier after a certain time . start for an hour , make a short break and continue . it will then get a bit harder again relatively sooner than people used to working longer but if you make another conscious effort to stay on the task you will be fine . tell someone you respect that you are doing this and it is really important that you do not fail and can check up on you . maybe it is a parent , maybe some good friends , a professor . you can try me . i am an academic , and i will be really disappointed in your sorry ass . alternatively if the above does not work for you i will go out on a limb and say your ego does not let you be held accountable to others . that is perfectly fine . i would like you to consider then that any procrastination on your side was you being clever and taking a calculated risk that you could pull through even much later to your deadlines . that is fine . forget any sings of guilt you might be having because it was you just being smart . but this will get out of hand if it continues and you need to stop it here , trust me . there is fear of i am perfection . if you find yourself lingering too much over one thing snap out of it . just make it good enough . there is fear of failure . oh no no , i do not mean you are afraid you will fail your classes even though you tried , you are too smart for that . i mean you are afraid if you do unleash your full potential after you have finished your classes that it still will not be enough . if that is the case then i think that is another discussion but i would like emphasize that it should not affect you here . you have a minimum to pass those classes , do it . do not let this pull you down . let me know what you think . <end>

title: <start> scared of getting out of my depression <end>
response: <start> i have not had depression as young as you , i was . now , in my s i am finally getting , what i feel , is the right treatment and have started feeling less depressed anxious . i had an odd feeling though that i could not put my finger on and blamed it on new meds but that did not feel right . i told my provider and she hit the nail on the head . she told me that i would have an adjustment period to feeling normal . like yourself , my normal , until now , is pretty much all i have known . she knew the feeling i was having due to seeing it before with a close friend that would ask her medical questions . this was only a few days ago and i am trying to sort out when i feel uneasy with feeling ok or if it is my illness . i too am struggling with who i am without it , not that i will miss it , so i understand what you mean . i do not have any sage advice but wanted to let you know that someone else understands , as much as i can since we are all different , and is going through the same thing . i am hoping my therapist may be able to she would some light on it but i have not seen him since my doc dropped that one on me . i am glad i could put a name to the feeling . that alone was bugging me . you figured it out on your own . be at peace . koln <end>

title: <start> i fear i am gradually losing the will to live <end>
response: <start> my friend , it gets better , it takes time but it gets better . i am not going to go into my full story because that is not important now but meanless to say i was in a very similar situation . and the only thing that helped me was getting rid of any social media connections you have with her . talebook , instagram , hell even linked in . the theory that helped me was schrodinger s cat . if i did not know what was happening i could only assume that she was happy and that is all i wanted . that empty feeling will go away . that lonely feeling will stop . and you will be happy again it just takes time my friend . as always my des are always open for you if you ever need to talk . <end>

title: <start> how do i get my parents to take me to a mental health doctor <end>
response: <start> my parents where from the suck it up generation , it was not till they came home and i was in a full breakdown that they started to take it seriously , do not let it get to this point . just remember that the one thing that is true i would that they love you and want the best life possible . if you can find a few places in your area that help with mental issues , having a list already maid may just show how serious you are about this . and how serious of a problem it is . <end>

title: <start> does it get better <end>
response: <start> i was exactly in your situation about a month ago . since i have been under medication i am much better and motivated . i can hang out with my friends and concentrate easily on my studies . just go to a psychiatrist and i promise it does get better . ps some people think if they work out or diet or just do these welfare routines their depression will fade away . it will not . do not waste your time and resources . they help you much better while or after you are under the right treatment . <end>

title: <start> i was exactly in your situation about a month ago . since i have been under medication i am much better and motivated . i can hang out with my friends and concentrate easily on my studies . just go to a psychiatrist and i promise it does get better . ps some people think if they work out or diet or just do these welfare routines their depression will fade away . it will not . do not waste your time and resources . they help you much better while or after you are under the right treatment . <end>
response: <start> i think you kind of missed the point about the work outs and diets . the workouts allow you to have some bilateral stimulation which helps your brain create endorphins . do some research on it it is pretty interesting . the diets allow you have a proper amount of nutrients which provide your brain extra leftover energy to produce happy hormones . nothing gets better either . life has its ups and downs . that is just it . it just gets somewhat easier to deal with it . those of us dealing with depression for a long time just end up using those ridiculously rough patches to grow and learn to deal with it better . we learned to set our expectations low and realistic . medications work , but eventually you realize that therapy is also needed . you can not always help your depression from your first person view . having a therapist means having a third party view , which allows them to assess the situation more clearly and help you identify your problems better . life is tough , but eventually you have to get up and start fighting the monster called depression . yes , it is tough to do but you will get better at it . one day you look back , and you will see how much you have grown . <end>

title: <start> unhappy <end>
response: <start> ugh , losing weight from not eating enough sounds horrible . maybe you can wake up earlier before your parents to eat food on your own to start the day off in peace having your active mind being out of sync with your tired body also sucks . i have had that happen many times and i suspect it was because of prior sleep loss . exercise helps wear you out to get better and longer sleep . you can try exercises without weights in your bedroom push ups and squats work well . it is worth also doing some cardo to wear yourself out to get better sleep at night if running is all you have access to , maybe run for about minutes around your neighborhood . a shower at night also helps me sleep better and night and it is one less thing i have to do in the morning besides putting on some deodorant . in my experience it is hard to think clearly or positively when tired , so i always try to take a nap whatever time of the day it is . parents are not perfect if you ask them what they are most worried about in their day , it might help you understand why they are acting the way they are with you . lastly , you have moved to pa and do not have your old friends . it is always hard to make new friends , but the quality of our relationships determines the quality of our lives . you might have a community center or recreation center around where you live where you might be able to spend some time . it sounds like you need to fix your sleep habits first , then make sure you are getting enough energy from food , and then focus on forming new friendships around you . feel better and good luck <end>

title: <start> i am not sure how to open up to my friends about my struggles with mental illness <end>
response: <start> i never talk about my depression with my friends or family . one of the friends in my group was open about her depression , and now always gets shutdown in conversation when she brings it up in our text chat because it makes things unpleasant and uncomfortable . it sucks , i know , but not everyone has the emotional maturity to be supportive . the only place i have to talk about my depression is in group therapy or directly with my therapist . you might enjoy listening to the podcast terrible , thanks for asking http www . tufa . org , the title of which is a playful answer to the somewhat universal struggle we are facing . sending lots of internet hugs to you <end>

response: <start> depression is a temporary thing and there is nothings to be a ashamed of . most people experience it through their lifetime but what is important is how you face it . think of it as a simple cold . if you seek professional help in less than a month or two the symptoms will be completely gone but the treatment is more like to be continued . it can not ruin your life if you stop it . personally for me believing that i have depression and getting it diagnosed was heartbreaking but i did it . i got over with it and i am trying to fix it and it is much better now . edit you do not need a traumatic experience to be depressed . it just happens . <end>

response: <start> supporting someone with depression is hard husband has depression , been together years . the things i would try to do is remember that no matter how it seems they have no control over how sad they are feeling , so do not take it personally . and to just keep trying and keep being there for them . there is no magic solution and sometimes things will help and then the next day they will not . all you can do is keep trying and keep communicating about what works and what does not . best of luck <end>

title: <start> i am tired <end>
response: <start> hey , first off , congrats on taking the steps to get help that must have taken a lot of effort and it is a step in the right direction . i have also had major depression for seven years now , and for a while had the same issues with my family they did not understand , it seemed trivial to them , they were almost abusive towards me . i just wanted to say that i have seen some really indifferent difficult parents come around eventually to give depression the deliberation that they ought to . that was true for mine and for some of my friends . it is a frustrating process , but there is hope . <end>

title: <start> scared i am faking my depression <end>
response: <start> the fear that you are faking it comes back to your illness . it creeps into your head , saying you are not really sick . you are a fake . it is very hard to come to terms with this . those thoughts that you should be fine , that you are somehow lying about your depression and anxiety and old and that it is all just a ploy to get people to like you , or you are just making excuses , that is your illness , and it lies . your mental illness is lying to you . it is a very real and serious struggle . you are not a fake . your feelings and issues are valid . you are not just making it up . as albus dumbledore said of course it is happening in your head , harry , but why on earth should that mean it is not real think of it this way . the brain is an organ , just like your heart and lungs . if your other organs can become diseased then is the brain immune the answer is no , and we see this in mental illness . you are not a fake . you are not over reacting . you and your feelings and your issues are valid . you are worth it . you are important . you are loved . you are not alone . <end>

title: <start> how do you stop a depression if you feel yourself slipping <end>
response: <start> almost everyone with depression goes through phases , be it seasonal or otherwise . for me when i start to feel it come on i will try and distract myself by starting a small project or even cleaning something . if that does not work i will go with something i always love doing like playing with my dog , going for a spontaneous run , finding a hockey game to play in , or even taking my car through some winding back roads for fun . it is all body chemistry and maintaining a good balance of serotonin and dopamine . what you do to fix that balance when it starts to get a little wonky is all personal , and do not get discouraged if something does not work , nothing is perfect . just keep your head up and remember tomorrow is another day . if you have never looked into how depression affects your mind , i highly recommend it . it helped me greatly to find out why i was feeling the way i was and it helped me come up with ways to battle the imbalance then finally decide i needed medication to help me get things straightened out which is something you should never be ashamed of . almost years after an official diagnosis at i am light years above where i started . <end>

title: <start> my life is literally ruined , i will kill myself tomorrow <end>
response: <start> fire water ice the one substance changes with a few hours . the state you are in is not permanent . our brains are dynamic . if this moment is interoperable right now , call a hotline immediately . the neurochemicals that have cocktailed to bring you to this hell will be processed to a more tolerable state . it is the way it works . your brain can not stay here indefinitely . but with depression , it returns here frequently . i read the crappy , awful stuff you have been through . i am so sorry for it all . it really sucks . the worst part is the imbalance in our brains from our depression . crappy stuff can happen to us and our brains make it worse for us . it is not your fault that your brain processes life events this way . it is not your fault , and you have probably figured out blaming is only temporarily and partially helpful . what we need to do is turn down the raging self hate thoughts that spring up relentlessly and turn up the volume of the rational thoughts that we have balance . it is ok to be devastated by what has happened , to be sad , to have regrets those are all normal , natural thoughts and emotions . the next part is finding out that you need not stay in that state to this point where you are . you can be sad , disappointed for a little bit and it is ok to move through that emotion to the next before you sink into this kind of hell hole . a balanced brain can do this . our depressive brains are just out of balance from the back part that produces the automatic negative thoughts and the front part that produces the rational thoughts . we are not bad people . we can modify an existing brain thought habit , slowly , carefully , till we get balance . same person , just adjust the sound board a bit . hang in there i was there . it really really sucks . it is horrible and scary , but hang in there till it passes , please . <end>

response: <start> www , thanks we depressives and post depressives can have trouble with motivation . productivity is not a regular habit for us so many of our days our energy is spent just keeping on the mask of being ok when we are not at all ok . we get so focused on grinding through a day that we are not very good at doing extra work read being super productive on the days we are not in a black depressive episode . being a depressive is exhausting and draining . do not beat yourself up about not being productive please , although i know it is easy to . super productive people seem to be idolized in our society . i have a white refrigerator . i write one or two things in dry erase pen i want to get done on it . i check them off when i do . some days i leave the fridge empty , and that is ok too . decide what is important to get done in your free time . for me , i need to get out the door and run . some days it is the only activity on my list . but i k nw if that is the only thing i feel like i accomplished , it was a very very worthwhile thing . getting home , i always say , thanks me , for getting my run today . remember to thank yourself for what you accomplished . <end>

title: <start> i m was emotionally abused and manipulated by my ex f <end>
response: <start> hey man just want to say i am so sorry that you had to go through this . i went through a similar experience with my ex she would accuse me of raping her after she initiated the sex . she cheated on me twice and flirted with guys right in front of my eyes . good for you for pulling the courage to get out though , it was incredibly hard so pat yourself on the back for that . as for moving forward i am not going to sugar coat it and i will say it will take you some time . my ex and i broke up this past november but i am still incredibly damaged and it is really hurting my current attempts at a relationship . what i found helped was completely getting rid of any trace of her in my life , ie . block her everywhere , delete all your pictures . if she is bothering you this much at hs i would not sweat it , she is going to be gone in a month i am from canada so i am assuming you end school in june too . whenever you see her do not make eye contact with , if you make eye contact she will see how you are facially and snicker to make you feel weak . if you show who is the boss she is going to get bored and eventually stop . i highly suggest you see a psychologist though . this kind of mental trauma can really because traumatizing issues in future relationships . the psychologist will give you ways how to handle moving forward , ie . telling yourself you are okay and other methods . i have found it has been really helpful and i have noticed an improvement recently . talk to your friends about it , do not hold it in or else it will destroy you slowly and that is not healthy . if seeing a psychologist is not an option , talk to your friends , i always find they have great advice . good luck my dude . <end>

title: <start> i am heartbroken <end>
response: <start> frankly , from being in a similar situation myself , i think it would be best for you to move on from him . i know it is not easy . it is very very hard . but if he does not know what he wants and you do , that speaks that you are ready to settle down , but he does not want to put all of his eggs in one basket so to speak . it sounds like he is keeping you as an option , an easy solution to fall back on when the person he is chasing rejects him , because he knows you care for him in this way . to him , you are safe . he knows you like him , so he takes the ego boost . he thinks you will always be there , in that capacity , even if he puts in zero effort to keep you that way . he is taking you and your feelings for granted . my guess would be that if you were to talk about having feelings for someone else who will commit to you , he would probably get jealous or angry , if not both . i am so very sorry you are going through this , i know that you are in a very difficult place right now . you are not alone though . i see you . i see your pain and i see your struggle . i see the good , kind heart you have . you deserve to have a fulfilling relationship with someone who can and will commit to you . you deserve to find love , and to be happy in doing so . keep your head up , love . you can make it through this . you are stronger than you think you are , i promise you that . <end>

title: <start> please help me . this is long , please bear with it . <end>
response: <start> hi sorry for what you are going through . i also go through low periods very similar to how you describe . one thing that helps me get through is forcing myself to do one thing extra a day . it started to help me clean up my flat , which i had let get quite bad if i could do laundry one day , then the next day i would do two things e . g . empty bins and do the washing up . i then started doing it for my hobbies . making myself read at least one chapter in a book , and before i knew it i was reading regularly again . and if you have a bad day and can not do anything , do not feel bad and just do the one thing the next day . i would also say . definitely talk to your doctor to see what they would recommend . ink id you are on any meds , but mine have really helped me . keep going . you will get through this . you have to help yourself do it though . <end>

title: <start> i should not be depressed , but i am . <end>
response: <start> there is no should or should not about illnesses which include depression . you just have it to whatever degree or you do not . it can be due to trauma like being bullied or abused , or brain injury , or it can be a shortage of serotonin as in my case . it is not uncommon that even the best diet and exercise and relationships do not help enough for a person to cope . in my case , my coping strategies including workaholism stopped working eventually , and i needed medication and hormone therapy . it has made a huge positive difference . if your parents do not understand depression is an actual illness and many people do not perhaps a supportive relative or friend can try to explain , or you can offer them some written or video information . if your family has access to a doctor , a check up with a general practice doctor is a very , very good idea . depression can also be caused by an underlying health problem , like thyroid problems , anemia , or an infection . try to describe accurately what you are feeling physically or emotionally . he she could rule out more benign causes , help explain to your parents , and refer you for mental health evaluation and treatment . i am sorry your parents do not understand yet . i am , successful in my career , i have a good family , and good relationships , but it still stings when my year old mom does not get why i need medication . i remember that she loves me to the best of her ability , and that helps . you are right in thinking exercise helps it does but do not feel bad if you find it hard to keep up . be modest in your goals at first and pat yourself on the back for your progress . everyone s willpower is finite and you probably use most of yours up getting through the day depression saps your energy . i find it helps to hook a new habit you want to build to an already established habit or routine . for example , i know i will not forget to brush my teeth , so i do knee bends for the two minutes while my electric toothbrush is going . you are right to eat well no matter what your body shape try to resist toxic messages around you on what your body should look like , and try to focus in feeling well . to the degree you can , dress and cut your hair to emphasize your best features you do have them . look at photos of good looking people whose frame and coloring resembles yours and try similar clothes and hair , with special attention to shape and proportion . but also pay attention to how many people are not attractive by any conventional standard , and who are very fulfilled in their lives . good rule of thumb for reducing negative self talk if you would not say it to your best friend , do not say it to yourself . and there is some silver lining . my problems have taught me compassion for others , and my over sensitivity has allowed me to notice important things other people miss . this has served me really well out in the wider world beyond school . get some medical help if you can , educate yourself about managing your mental and physical health , and remember that you can still make a great success of your life . take good care of yourself . hug <end>

response: <start> i am so sorry man . it is an understatement to say heartbreak is very tough . this is going to suck for a while . this kind of thing is never easy . i went through a similar thing . my advice is to work on yourself . try to take your mind off things . work out . learn a hobby . take a trip . focus on classes . also . read this . http medium . com aaronbleyaert how to lose weight in easy steps f f e dec if you have not read it , it is amazing . i revisit it every once in a while . i am sorry i do not have much else to say . this is unfortunately something you will have to power through yourself . you will come out better on the other side . if you just want to vent feel free to . also , if you have the means to , i suggest taking this opportunity to go to cognitive behavioral therapy . the feelings that are making you fall so head over heels over this girl might be partly due to some illogical thought process of yours , and i can not recommend cut enough to try to tear those out root and stem . my biggest advice is to work out though . work on yourself . <end>

title: <start> with depression , do you feel the need to escape your own life <end>
response: <start> sometimes people change unexpectedly and you are being a good friend by caring but unfortunately you can not help someone who does not want . i am no expert so i am just speaking from my experience . i was in denial about being depressed and drank the sorrows away a lot . i had friends who did what you are doing and only until i accepted my issues is when i could see what they were doing was helpful . sorry for the rant but yea until you are friend accepts your help unfortunately you will not be able to do anything . side note what you are doing is great and people like you made dealing with depression much better . so please do not beat your self up over it . at this point it sounds like you have done everything you can . <end>

response: <start> do your cycles come naturally or do you have a process to get into high productivity i have the same problem , although not as drastic . my job is pretty flexible so i find myself doing pretty much nothing for days at a time , when i should be out working . the lack of productivity only makes me more depressed , knowing i am failing at my job . but then i will get a boost of energy , and i will be very productive . i find for myself that it is mostly after scoring a win at work and then i have to remind myself to stay positive . otherwise i sink right back into slacker mode . <end>

title: <start> what am i doing wrong <end>
response: <start> can relate , and i am not a professional but i have done a lot of research since i struggle with depression as well . detachment is a common symptom of depression , and from the sound of things my theory is that you are functional , but at the cost of being distant , like your mind sees the benefits and costs of certain things subconsciously , it sounds absurd i know but not unlikely if i am being honest . i as well actually have problems with being able to express myself clearly , which is bad because i am a business major so i am doing my best to help this problem and trying to help others as well along the way . and you are heading in the right direction by asking those around you like your significant other but something we got to keeping mind is that they want to help us , they really do , but they are not therapists . and actually that is what therapy is for , so that you can talk as unclear as you want because that might just be a clue to finding a solution for your mental illness , i go to therapy and i literally just unravel there , i tell them the full story because i want to solve my mental illness problem , and the only way for that to happen is if both the doctor and the patient know the full story so that we can get to the source and solve the problem , and from there its just a matter of keeping up with things the therapist tells you and with time things will get better , because we have not given up since we are still here in the world , we are still getting back up after a hit of life so we are not down for the count , and we are not alone , i guarantee there is many more like us out there , part of the reason why this subedit was made in the first place <end>

title: <start> depression and anxiety also just started a bi polar med <end>
response: <start> what would you like to do with your life go back to school , are you working what about hobbies you are already starting to change your life . you have seen a doctor . got on some medications . you know you do not want to live like this forever . set some short term goals . small ones . that is what i do and when i accomplish it i move on to something a little more difficult . sit down and write your interests . put it on paper . start speaking it into action every day . get out of the house . isolation is the worse thing for depression and anxiety as it makes us stay in our heads . i know i have been there . its easier to just fall back into old habits . you say you have been sober months . that is a huge accomplishment in its own . do you attend meetings make friends there with common interests and also help you in your recovery journey . my husband is an alcoholic and has been sober years now . you can do this . i have faith in you . let us get back to living again . <end>

title: <start> my fear of failing is stressing me out and no one seems to care <end>
response: <start> i understand . high school is incredibly stressful . my advice is to . learn from any mistakes you made . the mistake has been made , nothing can change that , but you can change what you do going forward . . talk to your family about how their comments are causing you stress and how you would prefer encouragement . . do not hesitate to reach out and vent about your stress , whether online , journaling , to a friend , etc . get it out of your system , because your body will get it out , healthy above or not . . stick to a consistent schedule , but be prepared to adapt have a backup plan . get a study buddy if you can . . manage your time best of luck my friend . <end>

title: <start> how to deal with depressed thoughts and feelings during work <end>
response: <start> hey friend glad you can open up to us . just a little unthorough on depression there are top symptoms like feeling bad months and several side symptoms like sleeping issues , eating issues , no motivation i can only recommend you to go to a doctor to talk up your problems for a diagnosis usually they transcribe you to a psychologist for the work issue i can recommend meditation mindfulness to you meditation is not this being connected with the world and it is people thing , rather than a skill used in therapy for ptsd depression and other mental health issues . meditation is there to make you connected with your surroundings and yourself again , it got a wide variety like calming down panic attacks and or calming down the dread bad thoughts many people with depression feel . the best way to learn it might be led meditation , either by checking couture great source material there or the headspace app on android and tunes . i am no advertiser , i am f . patient that uses this app to improve my meditation skill . headspaces basic course is fully free and shows you all you need to know to translate it into your working life . it is basically training your brain to be aware and mindful of what is currently happening around you and calm down your head . if you got any questions feel free to ask away . <end>

title: <start> advice to an y o depressed closeted bisexual dude who mostly has anti left religious family amp friends and is contemplating suicide <end>
response: <start> you have to be you . you have to take a stand . i have learned in my lifetime that people if they do not want to like you they will find a reason . i am a heterosexual , lot of gay lesbian bisexual friends . i love them all . what i love most is that they have stood up for how they want to live their life . life is too short to not be who you are and love the people you want to love and be around them . i am battling cancer and some of my gay friends have given me more support than my husband . you can not live your life for your family . they may get mad but true love has no conditions on it . regret is a lonely place . i regret not doing many many things and ended up in a life that although has been decent i resent now . you might be amazed that some of your friends family already know . there are always going to be people who will not accept you no matter who or what you are . live your best life . you are years old and have so much to explore and learn . your life is worth living . life is going to be tough , it is for all of us but build you a network of people who will support you and your feelings . sometimes that has to be your family . i wish you well and i never could have children but if my child came to me and told me i would love him , that is who he is . i hope you find support that you need . <end>

response: <start> you need to understand , that if your child wants to be with someone else , that it is entirely their choice . i am sure you raised them the best you could , but in the end , it is up to them to decide . this does not mean you failed . the emotional depression that you feel is under your control . reach out to others , such as a therapist or a family friend . the best resource is a anonymous one in my opinion . as for your physical depression , seeking medical attention would be my best advice . lastly , keep your chin up . be grateful for everything you have . surround yourself with a loving family . stay strong . <end>

response: <start> thank you for your response . i was actually single for years after deciding to get clean from heroin so i took time to get my life back to where i am finally happy again and my finances and credit score are not bad . i spent that time to fix the areas of my life i had neglected or damaged due to my past behaviors and i did a ton of soul searching . i have been on the radio four times now to speak about addiction and recovery , and have just recently participated in an interview with a hospital in orlando florida that actually won them a k grant to keep focusing on research and treatment for addicts . i feel i am finally okay with my life and with myself . i have learned self love . trying to maintain my positive mental health will be a goal of mine for the rest of my life until i die , so i would have to say that if anything , he needs time to sort his issues out . i just fear if i keep trying to save him it will knock me out of balance . i am most definitely ready for a relationship , but i fear he is not , and it does not help that his ex and only other long term relationship was extremely manipulative and abusive , and even though he realizes this , the damage has been done already . add that to him being the youngest of three children and the only boy , he was coddled and spoiled growing up and also had an alcoholic father . i just see the co dependancy coming out and i can not help but see a huge red flag . <end>

title: <start> in a dark place need help . <end>
response: <start> the mornings are always the worst for me . i have talked to a lot of docs , therapists , psych specialists , etc about this . the mornings are crushing for me when i am in relapse like now , for instance . once i can get going the day gets better . this is a very common pattern for me . my advice not a medical pro is to keep going through the motions you normally would and see it get better . i do know how hard even the basics can be when a person is depressed . nothing like having to muster all you strength just to take a shower sound familiar . do not be too hard on yourself and go get professional help , if you have not already . i put off getting help for decades and it has just made things tougher , not impossible , but tougher . it will get better . . . period peace . koln <end>

title: <start> i wish i can do ketamine therapy <end>
response: <start> medication can affect you in more than one way . as one famous song said ketamine is for horses . . . . you can get the same effect as ketamine from other medication . i have an impulsive behaviour and my psychiatrist prescribed me carbamazepine . you will not feel much of a difference , but when you are really prone to act impulsively this substance will kick out and help . also i got prescribed mirtazapine . way much stronger , and gets you feeling just as you have taken ketamine . discuss this with your therapist and psychiatrist before , they know better . those substances also help better with depression . best wishes . <end>

title: <start> going to meet the doc today for depression anhedonia . how should i prepare for my first visit <end>
response: <start> tell them all . open , honest , do not leave anything out , tell them all you can , drugs , thoughts , habits , history . the more you bring them the truth the more they can accurately help . if they send you to a closed psych ward unlikely this happened to me only when i was about to do the act do not see it as punishment , they do it because there usually are psychologists who can determine likeliness on point . bring a bag with exchange clothes and a charger for your phone , this shows you are prepared for the worst case and most importantly willing to go through and get the help you need . as stated before , be honest , open and truthful . do not leave details out , details which you think are minor to you can actually be very influential and deeper running scars than you think . i wish you the best . edit for the point when you meet therapist psychologist , if you feel something is up with them or you feel unwell with them let them know , this happens and they know it is not their fault but a thing that happens a lot in therapy . <end>

title: <start> i really dislike positivism as a way to try to help me with my depression . <end>
response: <start> oh , man i feel you however , i came to this conclusion the hard way . . . for years i was in this mm , and their all day policy was to put a smile on your face . everyday every moment it was exhausting . saying things like you need to take this as a challenge and or an opportunity to grow even when bad things would be done intentionally to someone by someone else . or situations where anything was your responsibility and you were held accountable , no matter if you were in charge or just a visitor . always smile and wave fuck this shit i stayed for almost years with a smile on my face , always taking blame and responsibility with a smile on my face . i was brainwashed into thinking that this is happiness forcing yourself to accept it all and to smile at everything , because the universe has a plan for you another bright idea perpetually perpetuated . i did not solve any of my issues , got blamed for everything including other people s desk being clean , or why is not that piece of equipment working properly . . . and i just got insane . i was insane . now i have a crippling debt coming from that , i had threats from my ex colleagues and i was stalked and harassed by a colleague s husband , because of course it was my fault and it was an opportunity to grow . now , i have become more in tune with my emotions , but i still struggle with this . however , even though i left that awful place over years ago , i still have a certain mental pattern that i need to overcome when dealing with stuff . but maybe what i took from that is that now , i am more happy whenever i am crying now than i ever was in those whole years combined . faking it until you make it might work for some people . for me , it only brought confusion in terms of who i am and how to deal with real life issues . good riddance . also , sorry for posting this long stuff . <end>

title: <start> how do i motivate myself to start reading again <end>
response: <start> this is something i struggle with . my youth i read constantly , nowadays i either struggle to read or , if i start , struggle to finish the damn book the latest two books i am not finishing is marie kondo and a history of the battle of gettysburg . i have tried various things . . . strategies , but nothing has worked consistently so far . i link it to phone use , but also blue white leds which seem to make concentration more difficult that is anecdotal . my advice is strange but simple . leave your phone in the next room when you sleep . at bed time , charge and leave your phone in the living room , on silent , and try to read mins to hour before sleeping . that is the best success i have had so far . <end>

title: <start> ink what to do <end>
response: <start> this sounds eerily familiar . by no means am i trying to discredit what you are going through , but it sounds exactly like what i am still going through . also working full time , live with my best friend from high school , slowly realizing we are very different people and not spending any time together anymore and that video games are pretty much all recycled garbage if you do not want to play the same content billion times . it suuuuuuuuucks my dude . my only enjoyment from games is playing them with other people . i used to be an artist and draw all the time . now i boot up my programs and immediately lose interest . i will get out my paints and put them away . nothing i do seems to feel worth it any more . i can not wait for the second i get off work , but i do not know what to do with myself once i get home . if anything try r gomerals to see if you can get some lads to play with . if you are anything like me , it is probably because you kind of feel lonely as fuck without realizing it . like you said , nobody texts me to say what is up , nobody calls me to see if i want to hang out , nobody cares if i do not come home at night . i do not know about you but i am lonely . my weekly and and the few nights i play axhammer with my buddy is all i have to look forward to in life now . find something and hold on to it . it gets a little easier . <end>

title: <start> my depression f sked up my eating , how do i start getting it back <end>
response: <start> hey there so basically , your stomach has shrunk so much and there is a lot of stomach acid . what i recommend is eat some petto pistol before your meals . petto pistol is a base and will neutralize you stomach acid and make some room for some real food . start off with small meals . eat a ratio of vegetables , meat , and carbs . or if it is really severe , drink some soup . here s a soup recipe i recommend pork soup ingredients ground pork , soy sauce , napa cabbage spinach , water , and rice rice . measure out a cup and wash the rice . just water . no soap . use your hand to swirl the water in the bowl and clean off any dirt on the rice . do not keep washing the rice until the water is clear . it takes the nutrients away from the rice . . measure out the water you use . i generally let the rice sit and use the end to the middle before first knuckle of my pinky finger to measure the amount of water . look on couture if you need help . . cook rice . pot or rice cooker , both work . pot you will need to cover and watch . it will burn if you are not careful . soup . make ground pork balls . smaller less cooking time . . boil water and add veggies . add the pork and some soy sauce . add the soy sauce very scarcely . you can always add more soy sauce later , but you can not subtract it . . wait until the pork floats at the top . . serve and enjoy . take small steps at a time . it will become a bit easier with each meal you eat . best of luck <end>

title: <start> feeling hopeless <end>
response: <start> my friend , these things do not just happen . you have to make them happen . start from yourself , look at what you have , accept it and work with it . find your flaws and work to improve them , find consolation in that sense . you have dreams , you have a future you want for yourself . that alone is huge . getting there , however is even more huge and i know that . live for that , because you have so much more to accomplish and tha fact that you are not getting there is even more proof you need to keep fighting . this must be so hard for you , it truly crushes me that you are losing hope . i am sorry to hear about your hope in getting a relationship . but as i heard recently , fake lovers in this situation are like shadows , there when it all is bright and gone when all is dark . please do not give up . you have so much to fight for <end>

title: <start> inability to enjoy things is probably going to end my marriage <end>
response: <start> hey man have you tried opening up to her about your fear i know this can be hard but i think you should talk it out with her . but make it from your point of view , look i have been in a relationship where i had a similar kind of fear , after confronting her with my fear of not being able to be fun kinda guy she was happy to hear that i will still can be her solid rock , not her fun rock but her solid rock that she knows when she comes back that ll be there for her . you might not be able to go with her , but you can be her feeling of home , her strong house to return back to . edit if you think this might be a good idea let me know , i can give you some pointers on how to tackle that conversation , conflict talks is a huge corner in my own therapy <end>

of rocks through a forest , it is longer than steps or climbing , but it is enjoyable and you can meet travel friends on those usually , it takes a bit longer , this one might be the point for you title: <start> very lost <end>
response: <start> hi it is ok to feel lost . great job on even taking the time to vent and look for some advice . i know it is really hard when nothing goes the way you planned and you feel incompetent about everything . let us just try by taking little steps at a time . it is ok to be a bit slow or clumsy . everyone learns at a different rate . you are a little lost in the beginning , but use this opportunity to practice tenacity . use your disadvantages in a way that they will end up being a strength . even though you are not the cream of the crop , if you show them how willing you are to work towards something you are far more attractive than a lot of cream of crop people . there is always alternatives in using your passion . if you enjoy singing , try volunteering as a choir teacher or intern . if you really enjoy it , then you can work towards that . your idol dream will be put on hold for a bit but then you can always pursue it in your free time instead . try getting a degree in a teaching major because it will be pretty useful , even if you want to pursue music . consider it this way as well . even if you are not a super star in millions of fan s eyes , imagine if your class is one of the few things that students look forward to through out the day if you are still afraid what is going to happen , try getting some part time work experience . it is going to feel uncomfortable for a bit , but after practice you will have those conversational skills you want let your parents know how you feel . you never know how they will react . be mature about it and just let them know hey , i do not want advice right now , but i just want you to listen about what i am going through . please try to be understanding before you tell me your opinions . set your expectations realistically and have a back up plan . i think you kind of already realize this , but i will leave this here just in case . high expectations large quantities of disappointment . take baby steps towards life , because it is still a giant journey ahead of you . let the people around you know you need their support . i know it feels hopeless right now , but the fact you took the time to vent this much means you still want to keep fighting for a future . keep you eyes set on a realistic future , but really focus on the present . it is really the only thing you can change . it is also not a bad thing to have your mid life crisis early in life . you might be able to open a new door you were never expecting through this experience best of luck <end>

response: <start> i am not going to make a formal assessment of what their guiding theory method is because imo it will be hard to tell based on the info you provided and there is lots of counseling theories methods out there . with that said , it does sound like they are using a strengths based model which for some people would work . however , a good therapist should know that their guiding theory will not work with every client and they should either a try something different or b refer you elsewhere . it does not surprise me that they both use the same method if they are out of the same clinic . personally , for ptsd i have heard emir is amazing you can check out some of the research and my preferred theory is cut because of how structured it can be . ultimately if you are not connecting with your therapist i think it would be best to try another clinic if you can . <end>

title: <start> besides the obvious legal rules , is there any moral or ethical reason a therapist should not smoke cannabis with a patient <end>
response: <start> everyone reacts differently to cannabis . especially people with anxiety . then again , it would depend on what type you are planning on taking . i am speaking from experience because i have anxiety and all of my psychologists i have been to have been strongly against cannabis use as someone with a mental illness . it all depends on what type of mental illness you have . maybe cod can help , i would not know because i no longer choose to partake in ever trying drugs again . i would rather deal with anxiety on my own than rely on taking a drug overtime i freak out . my sister s husband has slight anxiety when going out in public and takes cod low and he is fine . his anxiety is not enough to need to go therapy for , so he is told me last month . basically , a lot of factors go into it . to answer your actual question in your title , i am assuming most therapists choose not to do so because to be fair , they have studied the mind and behavior more than the average person has and they know more science behind it , especially psychologists who specialize in drug addiction and behavioral health from drugs can not remember the exact name , but my last therapist did this . i guarantee you that most therapists disagree with psychedelic use when they have a patient taking antidepressants antipsychotics benzodiazepines , etc . it is common sense to not take a psychedelic while on those medications . but there is no actual solid answer since everybody is different . it would not be worth the risk though . <end>

title: <start> how to make decisions <end>
response: <start> most of what you reference are tools to help understand the different aspects of the decision . these help me to contemplate and explore what i value . that is the use of pros and cons and rankings etc . unless it is a quantitative decision like finances , decision processes rarely kick out a decision i have faith in unless i commit to the process and do not question the results , which i have found rarely happens . that is because most decisions are emotional as well as rational . they depend on knowing one s self wants , strengths , weaknesses , fears , self deceptions , etc . intellectualizing with doing it right can be a way i avoid facing those . we decide on our decision process , that is how we get faith in it and discover what we are about . then make choices and see how it goes . the important thing is to be clear on what drives the decision clarity and honesty are the goals . who knows what the results will be , i do not control that usually and trying to get it right for things that have no right answer is endlessly maddening . i did not answer your question head on , i think you are asking questions you should answer yourself . decide on how to decide and trust you will handle whatever happens . <end>

title: <start> please help me . <end>
response: <start> thank you for sharing , and asking for help . you are very brave and not many people are so willing to do that . i am sorry to hear of your troubles , and have hope that it will get better for you . it can be difficult to feel the way you have described and think there is no other options . i am trying to help him as best as i can to not be mad at me . i am not a therapist , but from my own experience and therapy , there is very little you can do to help with here . you nor he , can control his emotions , and you are not responsible for the way he feels , nor for the actions he takes because of them . what you are responsible for is what you are going to do about it . x b first of all , seek out some help . go see a therapist . the amount of assistance needed to work through such intense feelings is so limited over the internet . no therapist is going to tell you what to do , nor judge you . therapy is a tool available to most to help you achieve the goals you set for yourself in life . x b second , its most important to note , that you cannot force change upon people . especially when they do not want to change . in toxic relationships , the responsibility of these duties can be severely enmeshed with each other . x b no one ever wants to hear the burden of leaving their partner especially after a tenure as long as yours . however , you are suffering from emotional abuse , and lack crucial boundaries that are necessary for a healthy relationship . people are not telling you to leave your boyfriend because they hate him , they are likely telling you this , to realize your own self worth . he will not have any incentive to change if you continue to let the cycle take place . x b best wishes to you , i truly hope your situation gets better . keep your head up x b edit revised quote <end>

response: <start> what you described , dear girl , is the cycle of abuse . every abuser does this . they are sorry , the apologize . they promise to do it again . gradually tension amps up and he snaps . abuse is not always physical , although once it becomes this you increasingly are at risk of more serious injury or even death . abuse can be coercive control like limiting who you see , where you go , what you wear , and how you feel about yourself . the goal is to break you until you are dependent only on him and under his thumb . sweet girl , you are in danger . and you do not deserve it . you must seek help . the average abuse victim tries times to leave before they are successful . you can not do this easily on your own . find a domestic violence program in your area and see if they offer therapy . if they have group therapy go to that too . you can survive this . you can not fix him . be safe and be well . <end>

title: <start> my brother consistently looks at me like he hates me . <end>
response: <start> not at all a therapist , but i am an oldest brother . my best guess would be he is upset at how you can put yourself out there no problem while he , the older one , still struggles with social interaction . it is probably a mix of frustration and envy , envy at how his younger sibling can carry themself so well and get pretty good results referring to the dj . not saying that was why you met the dj but in his mind it might be . if i had to give any advice just from an outsider perspective , if you have not already tried this , get him some help . there is something holding him back from a relationship with you or anyone else if he is this way with everyone like he claims . if it continues to affect you negatively , i feel like you should look out for you first . you seem very distressed at this and if it comes to the point where you can not be happy or you are super stressed about it , you should probably let him be . whatever happens , i hope your relationship with him improves with time and that you stay safe . <end>

title: <start> what is the difference between psychotherapy talk therapy and a conversation with a supportive layperson friend , family , etc . <end>

title: <start> how do i help a man who hates himself <end>
response: <start> you cannot help him . the closer you try to get to him to prove his worth , the more he will pull away . he may have some deep traumas that are causing these feelings , perhaps with other morbid mental illness . regardless , i almost guarantee you that you cannot independently significantly improve this situation . any reassurances you give him will be rejected , because he is seeing everything through the fog of his own self loathing . if it were me , i would say that , although you empathize with him and want to help , you know you can not . if he wants to stay in a relationship with you , therapy should be non negotiable . edit sorry , i did not catch that you two are no longer romantically attached . my advice still stands , because you seem to be the most important person in his life at the moment . <end>

title: <start> my therapist is a big believer in enneagrams . <end>
response: <start> i had a similar experience with my therapist . she had me take the test , i read the descriptions of my results , they seemed pretty inaccurate , and any line of talking she used in relation to it went nowhere . i retook the test on my own and got different results did not seem accurate either , which further cemented my skepticism . i just told her that it was not helpful to me and she dropped it . my experience since telling her has been great . i do not think there is any harm in trying an enneagram based approach if you think it might be beneficial , but if it does not seem to do much , i would say so and your therapist should take your feedback into consideration . i personally think the whole enneagram thing is bs but obviously if it helps some people then to each their own . <end>

title: <start> could a therapist please give me guidance on if therapy could even help me in any way and how kinda long <end>
response: <start> i think therapy would really help you . that big , overwhelmed feeling , being unhappy , dealing with big time life transitions and illness and recovery , etc . are all the kind of thing that therapy is great for . especially when it is causing strain in relationships . sometimes it is really helpful just to be able to tell someone something without having them judge you or have any emotional reaction about it . it is hard for our family members to do that because all of our feelings are too tied together . if you see a therapist , you will not have to say all of this to them right away . you can just say i feel really overwhelmed and unhappy and it is taking a toll on my marriage and i do not really know what to do . lots of people show up to therapy and barely speak . the therapist will ask you questions and you can talk about whatever comes up for you . as you see them and come to feel more comfortable with them , you can share more . their job is to help you make an overwhelming huge problem into manageable , understandable issues you can deal with . couples counseling might be pretty helpful too . not because your relationship needs work , but going into therapy together might feel pretty empowering for both of you . it could make you feel like you are both on the same team . instead of talking about your contributions vs hers , you could just both talk to the therapist about shared concerns , like how does your current financial situation feel how does it change how you act toward each other what could you do together to fix some of the stuff you are both going through <end>

title: <start> i am scared of losing my interests <end>
response: <start> hey my man , you are going to be ok . life is like this sometimes huge things in front of us and just starting is daunting . i will make a few suggestions but ultimately it is obviously up to you how to proceed . take what you like . . you are smart capable . remind yourself of this everyday , this should be your first thought in the morning that you have the capacity to excel . even if it feels unnatural at first , try repeating i am smart , hardworking and capable first thing when you wake up and anytime you have anxiety about starting to study . . design yourself a schedule that you like that includes sometime for study , playing , eating healthy and connecting with people every day . you get to decide what your top priorities are this summer then plan to do things accordingly . . just start . sounds stupid simple and it is , but try not to overthink the starting piece . maybe for day you set a timer for minutes and do some math then take a walk , then more math , another walk , then lunch . after lunch try to meditate using a free guided app again you can start with just mins . it matters that you just start . set really small goals at first so you know you will be successful . . do not forget to build in the play fun connecting with others part of your life . that is equally as important and will seem soon much more fun if it is a scheduled break from your routine . , remember you are in charge here , you got this , man . we are all rooting for you nice , but i asked what to do about anxiety . my thought is that having a schedule of small amounts at first , working up to longer sessions in a few weeks will really help relieve the anxiety b c you will have a workable plan . good luck keep us all here posted on your progress we believe in you <end>

title: <start> why do so many therapists seemingly not accept insurance <end>
response: <start> talk to your insurance company . they will have a list of therapists that accept your insurance . keep trying to contact therapists , even after you have an appointment scheduled with a new therapist . you may not connect with the first therapist you meet , but it is important that you feel comfortable talking to this person , especially when you are working with tough or sensitive topics . bonus tip figure out what you want to get out of therapy . i promise that will be asked when you meet a potential therapist . examples might be working through a past or current life event , working on coping skills to manage day to day stressors , having a safe space to talk about how you are feeling without judgement or pressure from a friend relative . good luck keep working at it i am proud of you for reaching out to a professional . <end>
