title: <start> regretting going for therapy in school , because now i feel exposed and scared <end>
response: <start> hi , counselor here . i work in a community mental health agency , so i do not have a ton of experience with particularly how school based mental health centers work . however , based on what i know from my own experience in college and interactions with school therapists as a professional , a lot of those centers exist solely for school related crisis type stuff . what i mean by this is that they specialize in stuff that can be resolved in those six or so sessions . if you are experiencing something more , it may be beneficial for you to link with an outpatient therapist in a clinic or a private practice . it also sounds like you may have discussed these fears without being able to really process them , which could be contributing to your concerns . it can be a little weird at first to trust someone so intimately in a session and then have no interaction outside of that , that is typically normal . however , it is normal for her to not talk to you outside of sessions . that is out of respect to your confidentiality , even moresco because she is the school therapist . basically , other people know who she is , so if she is seen talking in detail with someone , potentially others could infer the relationship . the way i explain this to my clients is that i do not know who they are with , and they do not know who i am with , so i do not want to say hi and put them in the awkward position of explaining who i am to their partner friend family , etc . also , i would not be able to explain to my husband family friend who they would be , and because my loved ones know my profession obviously , they would probably infer the relationship by me not telling them . tl dr , yes normal and usually for your benefit . i know it is strange to see therapists just existing , being people outside of their offices , but that is just it , we are people too . i am sure that she is not thinking about all of the things you disclosed every time she sees you out and about . i am sure that is difficult to really swallow and have it stick , but it is probably true . if i see a client outside of the office , more often than not my whole concern is just making the client feel comfortable . i am not outgoing by any means , but i always said hi to people i know while out and about before starting therapy work , so now it takes a little extra control not to do that when i see a client . so that is all i am thinking about . as far as recordings go , i would check the consent forms you would have signed when you started services , or talk with someone at the center about your rights to the recordings . you should have some sort of right to knowing what is going on with those at the least , depending on the laws where you are , but the forms usually lay this out . <end>

title: <start> let learn to enjoy going places by yourself <end>
response: <start> in life there are two versions of yourself you need to be happy with a version of you as a singular , and a version of you within a group . being comfortable with both versions of yourself is key to being happy with yourself as a whole . if you are not happy with yours self as a singular , then you will only really be happy being with a group . you will find your time wasted until you are with something else . as a result , you find spending time with your time as a waste , devaluing yourself as a person . if you are not happy with yourself as a group , then you will seek to disconnect from people as much as possible or find interaction uncomfortable . there is nothing wrong with someone that just has a small group of friends this is actually more common than people think , but spending all your time by yourself can result in you being incapable of communicating with others and missing out on a big part of life . you do not need to love both halfs , but you can not reject or detest them either . you can have a preference , but you must find solace or content within both of them . <end>

response: <start> that is a good question . i can give my best shot at trying to answer it . spend more time with the half of you that you do not like or not comfortable with . if you are comfortable with the singular version of you , then take more time for yourself . now , that does not mean just stay at home and do nothing unless that is what you want . go to a coffee shop by yourself , or a your favorite restraint . maybe do a hobby you yourself can enjoy . if it feels awkward , then tell yourself that this is you time and you deserve it even if you feel like you do not . if you uncomfortable as a group , then try to find friends and hang out more . i would say it is this version of myself that i had the most problems with . it really was not until i find a supportive group of friends that i really started to come to terms with this part of me . i would say try to find any group that matches your interests . you can meet them face to face or just online . the point is you have a group of friends that you can talk to and hang out with . just like the previous suggestion , you are going to have to force yourself to apart of their activities . they will , hopefully , be inviting , but you still need to show that you want to be there . whichever method you choose to use , you need to know that this fix will not happen overnight . you need to adjust your habits before becoming more comfortable with yourself . unfortunately , habit reforming is one of the hardest things to do . but , once you do , you may find yourself more comfortable with your new direction . at least . . . that is my opinion on it . <end>

response: <start> my best advice when it comes to things like exams , especially when its super close to the exam date never stress about something that is beyond your control . focus on what you can control . you know you have hours to your exam , you know how much sleep you need i personally need hours to be at my best . make sure you get the sleep you are at your best on . i would use the rest of the time to do a little exercise it will help you relax , and then sit down with a clear head and go through a recent past exam in the uk you can get these free online , so check your exam boards website . do not just cram as many past exams revision as you can in these last few hours , you will be more likely to get stressed and less focused . whatever happens on the day , just remember , it can not be changed , and focus on what you can do to make sure you are not caught of guard in future . all the best and good luck <end>

response: <start> the best way to approach an issue like this is to be straight up with the tech agent . maybe say something along the lines of hey , i am having this issue and it looks like other people had a similar one resolved by the agent doing x and x . . at the end of the day though there are certain protocol they have to follow and although it may seem like it is pointless , there is some to benefit from it . for example , at the call center i work at one of our systems constantly goes down but is usually resolved by rebooting the system . of course most people do not do that before calling help desk so we get a lot of those calls . even though we know what the issue is , we still remote link their computers , clear des cache , temp files , then reboot the computer . our reason for doing so is it prevents the issue from happening as frequently . although it might not make sense to you why they are asking you what they are or doing what they are i can promise you there is logic behind it . sorry if this is poorly written , currently at work taking calls so i am typing this between them <end>

title: <start> let how to find a lost dog <end>
response: <start> couple years ago my dogs leash broke , and he ran straight into a foresty type area . after calling him and trying to find him for hours , i went home . and tried again the next morning with a friend . we found him stuck to a tree . his collar was caught on a branch and he could not free himself . finding him like that . . . was frightening . i mean , thinking of if i could not find him , he would have starved to death , cold and alone , stuck to a tree . his neck was pretty fucked up , from trying to free himself . but . . . he was okay i suppose . definitely try as hard as you can to find them , or get some kind of gps collar you can track with your phone . i bet they make those . who knows if they got themselves into some trouble like my dog did . putting familiar objects would not have helped me find him at all . <end>

response: <start> did that . i actually phoned up my old insurance company with their renewal price , and price i was quoted for online for the exact same cover . the difference was hundreds of pounds representing a significant percentage of the overall renewal . they literally refused to do anything , even . cancelled on the spot , changed to the cheaper provider , then found that they were both controlled through the same insurance portal , both underwritten by the same insurers , etc . and the former was a bank that provided me with insurance and breakdown cover , the latter was the same breakdown cover company providing insurance even that part was cheaper with them direct . honestly do not understand the insurance market at all . there is no sense to it whatsoever . whether i am driving an old clapped out car and just had an accident only one in my life , or driving a brand new , zero miles car with years no claims , the prices seem to be pretty much random . do not even get me started on the firms quoting and up with only the same cover perks that ones quoting do . even with the fees to change , etc . it was still cheaper for them to lose me as a customer , which i cannot understand why you would ever want that . <end>

title: <start> i wake up in the middle of the night and get ready for work <end>
response: <start> yes , i would say this is stress related . i used to have similar problems with high school . i took it way too seriously , i would wake up at but school would start at . i did not do my makeup or anything like that i just felt like i needed to be awake and ready as soon as possible . it only takes me about minutes to get ready . i think you just need to start by changing your mindset . think about sleep time as recharging for work . you can not work when you are sleeping , and that is your set time to rest . you have to rest to work productively and do the best job possible . i think the best advice i can give you is to check in with yourself and consciously remind yourself to slow down every once and a while . you do not have to go go go <end>

title: <start> stressed could not sleep at night at all even when i was yawning still could not sleep has anyone else had this <end>
response: <start> yes . i did and i do . it is hard for me to give you any useful advice since i am a victim of the same problem . i would give you some tips that have or seem to have some effect identify someone close to you in who you trust , and talk openly about the sources of your stress . explain what you are worried about , what you think could go wrong , what you think you can do about it , etc . ask her him if you are being reasonable with your worries and what she he would do if she he would be you while in bed , keep a dim side table lamp on . listen to some nature sounds , or some amur , with your phone spod . close your eyes . alternatively , try to hear and watch some couture videos related to hypnosis against insomnias . avoid eating too late and going to bed to late even if you think or know that you are not going to sleep . i realised that eating late may have an extremely bad impact , both in the way you feel and in the way you fall asleep . also , drink water but not too much water so that you do not have to urinate when your body will be at last asleep before going to bed , avoid watching things that may make you more alert or scared , like horror movies or so take valeriana pills before going to bed you may find it in amazon and , most importantly , put faith in the fact that they honestly can help you sleep it is not only important to be helped but also to let yourself be helped do sports , obviously . look for a psychologist . i never did this but i certainly do not have problems with it stress is linked to depression , or burnout , and all those things are mental nervous problems that should be addressed by a professional look for some meditation or yoga classes . adopt some way of doing and thinking things be effective during the day , prioritise , and take notes of what you have to do and what you can still improve . but at the end of the day , convince yourself that what was done was done . that you did your best . and that , if you did mistakes , so does everybody else . keep me posted . good luck . rm <end>

title: <start> help coping with extreme , long term stress i am going crazy <end>
response: <start> that sucks buddy you really should go and speak to someone about this stuff . your mind is relentless you need to pull yourself back a bit from all of this . try and give back to yourself somewhere here . . . what is something you enjoy that removes you from this world of work and anxiety it can be anything that helps you move away from the things that make you feel this way . from my own experience i find that when i am alone and procrastinating my mind goes into overload so i try to get out for walks down to the beach or pick up my guitar and play for a while . . . all of which is hard because i have small kids but i try to make sure i give myself that time . you can not control everything nobody can so do your best to remember that . i used to fantasise about being able to just close my eyes and wake up in a field a million miles from everyone with no phone or anything . i just wanted time to just be myself and not revert back to negative thoughts . i find speaking to someone really gets that lump off your chest so go and just dive into it it will do you a world of good . stay strong . <end>

title: <start> anyone here deals with stress being a doctor <end>
response: <start> not a doctor , but i work in urgent care . i am constantly super stressed due to very short staffing , pressure from management , angry patients , dying patients , depressed patients , abused patients the usual . the np on my shift actually gave us thankful jars . they are big glass jars decorated with the word thankful , and whenever something awesome happens you write it on a piece of paper and put it in the jar then when you start feeling burnt out you can just pull one out of the jar and remember one of the awesome things that happened and why you worked so hard to get where you are . another thing that helps a lot is talking to peers about those patients that every detail sticks with you . i have learned a lot from just listening to people who have been working in healthcare so much longer than me . when something brings them back to that patient and they start replaying everything out loud , i listen so intently and it is really invaluable information . i am sure there is someone you work with that looks up to you and would love to hear you vent about that one patient i know it is hard to have hobbies working literally nonstop , but one of my favorites is planning it is something you can do in minutes or hours , it is productive , it is creative , and for me at least it helps get rid of the stress of , i have so much to do ink where to start i think r planneraddicts is a decent starting point <end>

title: <start> it is summer and i can not stop thinking about all my hard classes i am going to have to take for junior year . how can i relax about the thought of junior year <end>
response: <start> first off , i would like to state that i am an up and coming senior , and junior year was my best year . my biggest advice to you is you have to view the classes less as grades to get or credits to complete and more as learning opportunities . the thing that helped me most is beginning to enjoy the classes that i took . i had ap s , english and physics , and once i learned to really enjoy them i ended up getting a s . i am generally a pretty lazy person who procrastinated a lot , but if you enjoy the classes managing work load is much easier . another big tip is make sure to sleep enough , your sleep schedule can make or break how you feel throughout the day . best of luck to you <end>

title: <start> raised to suppress stress <end>
response: <start> i am so so sorry you had to go through all of this . i can relate to some of your situations , surely when it comes to stress , fatigue , anxiety and panic . at this very moment i am under the calming effect of a clonazepam there is a lot to it , really . first of all , i believe you would benefit immensely from therapy i do cut , if you are not doing it already . the trauma you suffered in your childhood may keep on lingering and causing you pain until you get it out of your system with a therapist you trust super important . i would guess you have prescribed medication already because of the panic i went on and off my meds for over a decade , in an infinite loop from full desperation to i totally got this and i do not need those meds , and back . i now know it is okay and it is important that i use them . second , your ups and downs in income might indicate an oscillation in mood as well , which happens to lots of us . this might sound boring as fuck , but creating a routine you can stick to is actually amazing for your mental health . it gives your brain a sense that you are safe and grounded . and most of the trauma , anxiety and panic come from feeling unsafe for whatever reason . have a look at your sleeping , the things you do in the morning and how can you be consistent with it , while also doing things that help you decompress . if you have menstrual cycles , it might be good to check if you notice difference in your mood and energy depending on where your cycle is . track it down , and then plan the stuff for when you are more capable of doing it . this helps you be mega productive when you can , and be nice to yourself when you can not . to deal with stress there is a zillion possibilities , from the way you perceive stress in the first place we tend to think stress is only bad for us , but it can also be good actually , if we are engaged in something we value , to practices . the biggest thing for me is to be able to celebrate things . the stress cycle goes a bit like the threat , our reaction , the situation and the closing . what fucks us up often is that we keep going from threat to reaction and we do not close the cycle . what i mean by that you get stressed over an important meeting . you can cope with that by yelling at everyone or lying down on fetal position whatever you fancy . then , comes the meeting itself . and then . . . you go to the next stressful situation that is the shit . when you live something stressful take the time to celebrate you survived it . give yourself a pat on the back for nailing the meeting , and even if you went terrible , at least you showed up the fact you are able to provide for your boyfriend now , and that you managed to grow up amidst all trauma and shit are two massive reasons to celebrate . there is also loads of stuff , like taking actual rest , exercising , singing , laughing , being around cool people and understanding that things are not always on your control so you do not have to be on constant alert mode . i could literally write until you fell asleep reading , but i hope this suffices by now . let me know what you think i am glad i wrote this to you , it is exactly the advice i needed for myself today <end>

title: <start> stress rash <end>
response: <start> just for the record , a friend used to get eczema rashes from stress . she was on lexapro believe for stress . she went to the doctor and the dude has a screaming fit with her mom over it since it reached some real bad levels , and she should have been brought in much earlier . after some tests , turned out it was from the lexapro being too high , she was already on pretty minimal doses . i have no idea how they came to this conclusion , i think it was more of let us try this and see if it decreases , in combination with some ointments . if you take any drugs , look to them as well . it simply could also be in your head . i was on vacation with my family a week ago and developed stress hives . since i have been back home i do not live with them , my mood has improved significantly and i feel amazing i have not gotten any new hives and the ones i have are tapering out . so if you are in a stressful situation like school or in a bad place , see if you can relocate yourself or remove yourself from the trigger for some time so you can get better . if it is strictly stress , i can not just tell you to be happy , that is not how it works . surround yourself with friends and do things you love , even if it is hard to do either of those things . as for the panic attacks , i may recommend an inhauler . a doc can prescribe it and they are otc . the adrenaline may because more harm than good but if your throat is closing , you need air . i usually wagger what is worse in each situation with the understanding that it will not be fun . panic attacks and stress are actually a trigger of asthma , did not realize i was asthmatic for most of my life until i talked to my doc . i also suggest a second opinion about this , some docs i have noticed are not open to possibilities . i am sorry your having trouble , i hope you feel better soon <end>

title: <start> it is exam time . i feel really stressed and i do not know what to do and how to cope with it . <end>
response: <start> hey i know exactly where you are coming from i just finished exams last week and i was so freaking stressed out , i mean it is in my username . i did not even talk to anyone for the entire week because i was so stressed and i felt like talking to anyone would make it worse . my best advice is to take a deep breath . it is cliche i know , but the moment you walk in to take those tests , it is what it is . either you know it or you do not , and that is what i told myself about mine . just know that once you are done you will feel so relieve . the weight will be lifted off your shoulders and you can rest by time i reached the end of my exams i just did not care anymore . i was more happy with the fact that i could go home and sleep without having to stay up later or wake up incredibly early to get some studying in . so just take a deep breath , be content with your knowledge , and be assured that once you are done you can relax . i know it is hard to not want to disappoint anyone , and that is why i decided to not talk to family the week of my testing . ultimately this exam is about you and your test . the only person you should be concerned about disappointing is yourself , and if that is the case , all you can do is try different study methods to do better next time . i know it is stressful , but you got this . deep breaths . <end>

title: <start> i need some serious help as to how to reduce my stress , it is impacting my health and i am only . <end>
response: <start> i have a job that is well known because of the high stress we experience . i also have had a lot going on in my personal life the past months that had left me stressed over family relationships and finances . what worked for me was sitting down and writing all the things i was stressed about and possible solutions or steps i could take to make it better . i felt like if i was able to take a step in the right direction it lifted some weight off my shoulders . example , i had a lot of medical bills i could not pay for at once . just getting the energy to call set up payment plans with those relieved a lot of stress . i also saw a doctor . she did blood work and noticed my cortisol and cholesterol were quite high from stress she asked about my sleep and i am like i get hours but i toss and turn . so she recommended ravinate . getting adequate sleep was a game changer for me . ravinate is now apparently banned by the da or so i have heard . i am considering cod oil now . where i am trying to get at is stress really can affect your body . so do everything you can to take care of it . sleep good , drink a lot of water , do your best to eat healthy , and get out and do some type of exercise . you might even find some relief in volunteering with animals . <end>

title: <start> my parents are stressing me out and my exams are too . . <end>
response: <start> if i could give you any advice , it would be to stop seeking their approval . i understand what it feels like to want to make your parents proud , but either they are or they are not . it is not worth stressing yourself out , unless you yourself are unhappy with the scores . in the grand scheme of things , those individual grade mean literally nothing . i mean literally . no one is going to look at your resume in the future and be like this dude made a c not hiring him . . see what i am saying learn to make yourself proud and you will be happier . the last thing i will say is something i think other people are just afraid to say , but not all parents are good parents . i am not saying you have bad parents , but a lot of people do . maybe they do not deserve the amount of energy and emotion you are giving them , if they are not going to appreciate you for that alone . part of being an adult is figuring out what is important to you , not them . best of luck to you , and i hope you do yourself proud , not going to tell you to just keep trying tho because it is clear you have already done that . <end>

title: <start> i am stressing about high school grades . <end>
response: <start> have you talked to your teachers one on one about why you are falling behind if you have extenuating circumstances at home or family issues , your teachers may be able to work with you to change your learning plan before the end of the semester . however , if you are goofing off , and not taking school seriously , then take responsibility for it and make it up in summer school . honestly , do not worry so much about grades , but worry about whether you are actually learning . not memorizing , but learning . you know what the difference is for you . <end>

title: <start> i need help they keep shooting the messenger <end>
response: <start> well i am no clinical anything , but my thoughts are as follows . things happen in life that put us in undesirable positions it is my belief that it is impossible at least for me to be happy in a position where i have to walk on eggshells around anyone . much of my life was spent tip toeing around people to try an keep peace and it has never worked out for me . i feel like you would not be posting this if you felt you were safe to say these things to the people doing this to you , and that is just no way to live . they again , all in my personal experience will simply continue to dog you until you lose your marbles . to avoid dragging this out , i will shorten it to just this if you are not in a position that , in the event of a catastrophe , you cannot financially and mentally support yourself , the goal everyday should be to work towards not being in that position . if your relationship with your boyfriend suddenly ended and you got kicked out or whatever . . . if you lost all of your support structure overnight , you could still get by . it is a challenge to be truly content happy in a situation like that . so much of a challenge that i was not ever able to do it . it will eat at you it will make you miserable . if you do not feel safe telling the people around you that you are not going to be the mediator anymore , no , seriously . do not bring this up to me again , you can walk over there and tell him yourself . then you need to stop worrying about how they feel , because they are not worried about how you feel . <end>

title: <start> shitty family <end>
response: <start> first of all i just want to say that i am sorry that this is happening to you , but you need to understand that things will get better in the future . this is just temporary and soon you will be independent and free . my advice to you right now is to continue focusing on school and getting straight as . this will help you immensely once your on your own . also try to focus on performing acts of service for others when you can . this will make you feel better about yourself and it also gets you out of your own head to stop over thinking things . i think doing more things independently without the worry of others involvement can also help you feel less alone and help you realize that you do not need this external validation from others even if they are your parents it still sucks i know , but you have to realize that you can not control your parents shitty personalities . things like picking up a hobby by yourself , improving yourself physically , or even reading a self help book are all good ways to feel better about yourself . lastly i just want to say that again please do not think the pain will last forever . realize that it is temporary and realized that you are loved , if not by the people in your immediate surroundings , then definitely by me and the many people you will meet in the future ps . look into stoicism . <end>

response: <start> glad to hear someone is the same as me . . . i recently have been going through a shit tone of stress with my jobs girlfriend . i have very similar thoughts . . . again , like yourself , i am very normal , love to hang out with people and would never harm anyone x b but on occasion i do have the odd thought of what it would be like to kill this person for example i have been very pissed at my girlfriend , we live on the th floor and for some weird fucked up reason when i am angry at her and she is on the balcony , i think mmmm what would happen if i just pushed her then i snap out of it and feel sick do not be alarmed i would never do that , it is just a sick thought . x b when i am driving and in a shit mood i too think i wonder what would happen if i just plowed through these people . . i do not want to , it is just a thought like , what would happen to me if i just put my foot down and tried getting away or how it would effect me life family life and the people i killed . x b i also have thoughts about touching people i hate how i would do it or how it would feel to say cut someone or shoot someone or just how id do it . x b my girlfriend had nightmares almost every week about family and friends dying or being killed and it really fucked her up . she could not talk to anyone about it , so she went to a therapist and told her everything . she left feeling a lot better and since talking to someone about her thoughts she has not had any more of these terrible nightmares . x b it was due to stress x b she works too hard , i was living on the other side of the world , etc . . when she learned how to de stress and focus on herself she began to feel so much better x b i would recommend you see someone and just let everything go . it will help . <end>

title: <start> so is uncontrollable job stress <end>
response: <start> i find your thoughts about resigning irrational so i will address that first . you can resign . if it is in your contract and there is a set notice period , you are not legally bound to stay and the worst that can happen is people will be upset with you . yes they will be pretty much fucked . who knows how much money and clients they will lose . but it is not really your problem and it is their fault for not having enough hands on deck and redundancy in place . do you own or manage the business no . then it is not your responsibility to make sure it is successful if someone resigns . even if you resigning causes the collapse of the entire business and bankruptcy it is really not your problem and there is honestly nothing they can come at you for if you followed the conditions of your contract . as far as your deadlines go do some estimates for how long it is going to take , without working too much extra hours . if you are not going to make it then you need to renegotiate the deadline . if this company is not willing to move deadlines based on the time a project will take , then they are honestly not worth working for . good project management is done in one of two ways . figuring out how long something will take and then setting the deadline . . if deadline is immovable , remove work such that a minimal working product or working but incomplete product can be delivered by the deadline . if they never move deadlines and never remove or simplify work , then you have an incompetent project manager and you deserve to work for someone with a better aptitude for good project and risk management . <end>

title: <start> how do i recover my creativity after stress <end>
response: <start> allow . do not force anything . allow the energy of creation to flow through you . you are pure creative energy , after all . reconnect with those parts of you that you have neglected to see , feel and heal . feel how appreciative you are that you are even in the position where being creative is a desire within you . that is a huge manifestation of creative energy in its own right . write this above your work space , great creator , i will take care of the quantity , you take care of the quality . every morning when you wake up write pages stream of consciousness . do not consider it real writing . just do not let the pen leave the page for consecutive pages , even if you end up writing , ah i do not know what to write . i am so blocked these days . why can not i just focus on my creative passions what is it that i am not allowing to come up to be released so that the whole universe can flow through me and create . every day , write those pages , no matter what . it just becomes a part of you . learn to trust your inner voice . allow your inner critic to have his judgements and criticisms but do not believe them . just let them be without giving your belief to them . <end>

title: <start> noise pollution over sensitivity <end>
response: <start> i get sensory overload too multiple times per day . foi this is a very long post , but i wrote i am some strategies to cope with oversensitivity . hopefully you will read all of this and find something helpful out of it . i have headphones that are pretty much noise canceling that help me a lot . i go to a quiet place , put them in i do not play any music or anything i just put them in to block out noise , ear plugs would work too . , turn off the lights and just lay there while doing deep breathing . i stay in that place as long as i need to . also , try to keep track of anything that seems to trigger you . try keeping notes i like to use the google keep app of the date , time , and what you were doing when you reach your threshold . do this for a few weeks to a month , or as long as you want . it will help you identify patterns of times and situations where you tend to reach that threshold and then you can come up with some modifications . for example , i get really overstimulated at the grocery store so now my husband goes . i get overstimulated at work when it is loud from everyone talking and the phones constantly ringing , so i always keep my headphones in my pocket and i will skip away to the bathroom to get a few minutes of quiet time . another thing i like to do is go for a walk in the park and get a dose of nature , it always makes me feel better . i also like kayaking , it gives me a nice dose of tranquility . nothing is wrong with you , we live in a world now where there is so much noise , so many distractions . oversensitivity to stimuli is a real thing , some people are just wired differently if you google it you should be able to find information on it . self care is important , so schedule a block of time every day for sensory deprivation . this means turning off your cellphone , blocking out noise , and light . also , i obviously do not know your past but people who have been through traumatic events in their life such as a traumatic brain injury , physical emotional sexual abuse , military veterans who deployed to war zones , have asperger s or autism , all of these people are much more likely to experience sensory overload . i have a nephew who has autism and when he gets overstimulated , his parents use some of the strategies i mentioned earlier in this post . it is important to find safe people to talk to about what you are going through and avoid sharing your struggles with those who are criticizing the way you feel . give yourself permission to have these feelings , because they are legitimate the more you accept and acknowledge your feelings , the better you will start to feel i really hope my advice helps you , because i know how distressing sensory hypersensitivity can feel . <end>

title: <start> i am and consumed by stress <end>
response: <start> ok , i am putting down the controller to answer you . so playing video games is how i reduce stress and have some fun time to put things into perspective . i wish i could just tell you , as someone much older than you , that this stress you are feeling is not worth your time . it is more like a time suck . if you are worried about applications and college stuff , then get a jump on it and start filling things out now so it will not seem so overwhelming in a few months . take bite size pieces as opposed to looking at the whole pie . which leads me to your binge eating issue . you might have more complicated anxiety than just your run of the mill stress related kind . consider chatting with a therapist or doctor about it all . you could use a mild anti depressant or anti anxiety med to help you cope . that you acknowledge and realize what is happening with you is huge now if only you can do that as something is happening so you can adjust your behavior . do what you can . make a list . check items off the list . make achievable goals . and stop being so damn hard on yourself take a walk . play pot mon go visit a new place in your town . all things that can get your mind off whatever you fixate on currently . you will be ok and tomorrow comes and yesterday is over . <end>

title: <start> how we learn from our parents how to respond to stress and anxiety are you good at regulating your everyday stress and anxiety levels if not , how might your parents have played a role in your self regulation skills or lack of <end>
response: <start> my family had an over arching mentality of we just do not talk about anything with any weight , ever . whenever an emotional issue boiled up , it was the end of the world in my house . all of my brothers are stone faced manly men in their own eyes . you do not talk about emotion , you do not rock the boat , if you do you get punched in the face . my parents were experts at keeping any issues they might have had between themselves . i grew up with no emotional support network what so ever , so when the big stuff started hitting the fan , i had no idea how to handle it , so of course i resorted to weed , beer and cigarettes , like everyone else did . i know i had it better than many , i was not overly physically abused , but it did happen from time to time . emotionally , i was not abused so much as just flat out ignored . i do not blame them for anything because everyone is the way they are for a reason , but an argument can be made that i was pretty heavily emotionally neglected , and yeah it definitely had a huge negative impact on my stress management since i did not have any idea how to manage stress and many other areas of my adult life . i am still figuring out how to function properly . i know one thing , my kids will always feel welcomed to talk to me about anything . <end>

response: <start> yeah that sucks , my dad was not violent at all , he was just stuck in his ways and was not trying to dad so much anymore after the three sons that came before me . i was adopted , because my mom wanted to save me in the heat of the moment so i was kinda the pet that everyone ignored . my three much older brothers were and are very violent , they are the ones i had to tip toe around . getting away from the madness in that family was the smartest decision i ever made . you are right , but i would say there should be more than just that test , hell , they should pick a grade and make it a required course one year . just about everyone goes into parenting on accident and fumble through it . too many people wind up with a kid they never wanted with no clue what to do with it or how to handle it . then everybody throws their hands up and says , not my problem then you get deadbeat dads and moms like mine who disappear into smoke or pass their kids to the nearest pair of hands and run off to fuck another baby into the world with no regard or concern my biological father and mother , respectively for the shit storm that follows . we need to get to these people early with some quality education on the subject and the deadbeat parent or the abusive , nasty asshole parent thing needs to become so disgusting to society that it is taboo . it should definitely be a required course for everyone , wether or not they say they will never have kids , they do not know anything about the future . as long as you have the plumbing , it is probably going to happen eventually . but i am off on a tangent now . i am glad you are doing right by your kids like that , that is exactly where i want to be when i have mine . that type of household is just toxic to a kid and i think that we are the exception here , because kids who grow up like us tend to emulate their abusers and the cycle continues . <end>

response: <start> i am so sorry you are so bummed and stressed . this will be hard to read but . . . none of your worries are worth you being so stressed and anxious . i know , i know . how dare i . i do not understand etc etc . au contraire , my friend . i am the biggest old , stress case and micro manager . however , i have decades more of separation from events and things now than you have . graduation pfft . a blip on the radar . i can not even remember my own now . first things first . complete a task . stop thinking how messy your room is . clean it . low on food money eat less , or put food in a bag . graduation you have to remember there is a tomorrow . this will be done and over . will it have been worth the pain and stress unlikely . it means a lot to you now to get this done a certain way but in the long run , it is a lot of anxiety for little return . invite people . they are adults and can figure out their own way to support you . tell them when and where , then it is up to them . if they can not come easily , then they should not come and maybe you should reframe your expectation of their being there . you might consider reframing your whole perspective around this and whatever else is giving you anxiety . it seems you might be creating issues as a way to justify how frazzled you feel . if you suffer from analysis paralysis , then you need to complete small tasks to feel accomplishments and lighten the weight on your shoulders . go clean your room and then let it go <end>

title: <start> overwhelmed with job <end>
response: <start> i am in a different situation , but i understand your stress . first you need to know your options . did you try all possible things to show that you can not do this all alone when we have enough , we loose our maturity and just complain for the sake of complaining . you can record each day how much stuff you are getting done and how many are remaining . you can record how long it takes you to get done with even simplest things . that way , you would not have the guilt of not trying . then using those records , you can show to management that you alone can not do it by yourself . it would also be nice if you can come up with suggestion about maybe how to automate or make things maybe simpler after doing all of these things , if you still do not see any improvements , you should start looking for an alternative job . so , in the mean time how can you manage your stress it is easier said than done , it took me months to have the mindset i am having right now . first make a plan about how you want to change things or improve your skills . plans are good , because there is progress and it gives us the feeling of achievement . second do not forget this is just a job . your health matters the most . find some after work activities that can ease your pain . third try to reduce the amount you spend complaining . it does not help , literally . all it will do just put you in a more depressive mood . hope you get find better soon . <end>

title: <start> i feel stress every day and apparently it is not normal <end>
response: <start> x b i believe that the quote worrying will not help the situation states the key concept , and sets up the solution to this kind of problem . worrying , and stressing truly will not help a thing , and is a complete waste of time . however , you are also right on point with the idea that you need to be prepared . as prepared as is humanly possible for the things that you can anticipate . x b here are three ideas to internalize believe it will work out as it should . whether you judge it as success , or failure , it is as it should be . and nothing is permanent . success is fleeting , failure is only temporary . growth should be constant , peace should be permanent . change your language . remove the words worry and stress from your vocabulary . replace them with optimistic action words like plan , forecast , mitigate , hope , pray , etc . realize that if you focus your thoughts on paying the due diligence to situations , working confidence that you will succeed at the end of the day , and keeping focus on optimism and focus on what you can do and not what is out of your reach , you will be in a state of peace . x b no worries peace . <end>

title: <start> i feel overwhelmed <end>
response: <start> not eating and not sleeping well are going to because you to become even more fatigued . if you do not have time or are too stressed to sit down and eat , buy some yogurt , protein bars , or other handheld snacks for quick bites . try taking deep breaths . on the bright side , you only have one month left before you can be free . you should write down everything you have to do and then rank them by priorities . only focus on one thing at a time to maximize your ability to handle each task well so you do not think about everything at once . it sounds like the foreign language test is very urgent , so i would rank that either at the top or near the top . when you do get the chance , try to either take naps or do something fun , so you can regain some of your energy . i know it is hard to relax when you have so much on your plate , but it seems like you need it . with so little time left , i think you should not worry about anyone else , not your friends and not your classmates how they do and what they do should not really affect your own performance , and like you realized , comparing yourself to them just makes you feel bad . just focus on yourself and how you can make it through the month . <end>

title: <start> what i have been going through lately <end>
response: <start> hard times shape strong people . and if you can get through times where it seems like everything is falling apart , you can get through anything . life gives us seasons which means that it is not always going to be like this . cutting yourself will only make this season of your life that more difficult . x b about your paper , go and talk to your psychology teacher . if he she can do anything , it will be to help you and for your benefit only . tell him her what is going on at home . any decent person would only want to help . maybe he she could talk to you about self harm as well . x b about your dog , comfort her and pet her and play with her . you will feel a lot better , too . dogs are great emotional support animals , but they need support and love just as much as we do . x b if anything , try to look at the move as a positive thing . you are getting out of a really bad house and a lucky landlord . that is awesome news it can seem like a bad thing because you are watching your parents struggle , but please understand that they might be going through a bad season , too . i watched my father fall into a depression for months when he lost his previous job . he felt like a failure for not being able to provide for his family . so my sister and i got jobs and were able to help out as much as we could . that was years ago and this past christmas my father opened up to me how our strength and resilience and determination during that time helped him see the brighter side . x b when i was in high school , i did not understand the power i could have had by asking for help . as an adult , i realized that sometimes asking for help is necessary in anything that you do . but , more importantly , asking others if they need help is big . by lightening other s load , you are sure to feel happier and may even find your load is lighter , too . i wish you the best of luck do not harm yourself , believe me , it is not worth it nor is it doing anything to change the situation that you are in . people care and there is someone me on reedit thinking of you and confident that you can get through this <end>

title: <start> needing to vent . can not sleep because i am stressed out . <end>
response: <start> sorry you are so stressed . i am not sure anyone s advice will help because you are in an immediate sort of need . maybe it is time for a big change versus a temporary fix i am wondering what you are thinking months to years from now . you and your bf are living day to day . maybe set yourself some personal goals for getting yourself set up for a better future consider moving back to your parents place for a couple years and go get your aa degree in something that offers a better paying job in a field that can be a career licensed vocational nurse vet tech you are so you know time does not sit still and before you know it , you are and stressed out and still waiting tables . which let me tell you , stress at is not like the stress you feel at or . go live with someone who is supportive of you and your goals , get a part time job so you can go to junior college or a vocational school , but do something worth doing for the next years . you guys sound way too stuck in the now and will be broke , in money and in your mind , unless you actually stop , make some real changes that will make a positive impact and not just bandaid fixes . i totally get where you are at in your life . i also know it is more easily said than done . but what you are doing now is not working . make a change , make a good change . long term . month goal . year goal . year goal . both of you take a walk around the block . think about stuff . you can make personal goals and goals as a couple too . lastly , you can do this . you will get through this . <end>

title: <start> i am a stress head amp need help <end>
response: <start> sounds like more anxiety than a stress reaction to a prolonged stressor to me . nobody can wave a magic wand and rid you of your anxious thinking but you could do something to seek help with your ways of coping with responsibility and with performance . it will take longer than a week , and you have to be active and not passive about it but you sound like a hard working , determined sort of person . therapy would be best but if you do not have access or the ability to gain access to therapy then there are books that can help at least a little . i recommend one called change for the better by elizabeth wide mccormick . it is got a good sound evidence base and it is very hard to do but can be very useful . you get out what you put in , which is a better deal than most things . <end>

title: <start> i do not know how to be a college student <end>
response: <start> i can relate in that the past few months i have been stressing to the point of anxiety due to university . what you really need to do is talk to someone . i cannot stress this enough . contact your personal tutor as soon as possible this is a tutor you go to for support i assume colleges in the us also have this . they are someone to talk to , will support you and point you in the right direction in terms of your wellbeing , student life etc . get help from your class teachers . ask them about where you are going wrong . from your post you seem intelligent and hardworking and i honestly think you will get very far with just a few little tweaks and the guidance of your teachers . you just need to ask as they are the experts . similarly befriend any older students a year above you doing your course they may give you helpful advice . when you are feeling really down in the evenings night line can help you out a lot . you need to vent , letting it all out is healthy . also consider using a counselling service if your college has one please do not be too harsh on yourself . remember the good in your life , see hardships as obstacles that you will overcome . you seem really hard working , and you have your priorities right which is great . hopefully once you have spoken to your teachers for advice you will become better at your work and this will open up free time . pursue a hobby exercise clubs for your mental well being . getting enough sleep is also very important for your mood and exam performance hang in there man especially if you find your course interesting , when times are tough there will always be light at the end . and you will have learnt more about yourself <end>

title: <start> can stress because throbbing headaches on one side of the head and pain tightness on one side of the neck <end>
response: <start> i get left brain headaches like this from stress . taking paracetamol or aleve helps . it just gives you some relief until it wears off . so i only take it once or twice a day . neck and shoulder pain from stress is very common as well . you definitely need to get a massage or do some exercises to help you . a lot of people hold their stress in the shoulders and then this creates neck muscle pain and consequently headaches . i say it feels like a hot poker in my left temple . it eventually does go away . however , you do have to do some work and figure out what helps you relax . . . meditate . yoga . herbal tea . stretching exercises . massage . removing yourself from the stress factor . bow , an aside , allergies can because sinus issues which can because headaches too . worth checking out . if you have a headache , you get stressed , and get shoulder and neck pain too . i have had both scenarios . but more likely it is just good old shitty stress . hope you feel better soon . ps . also , grinding your teeth at night if you do this , get a night guard it can because weird headaches and stress in your neck . <end>

title: <start> i am panicking from stress and i do not know why <end>
response: <start> i have felt this way from anxiety before . i feel like i am forgetting to do something , or i feel this sense of urgency for no reason . i have made a gratitude list in times like this and it is helped . it helps me to realize there is no emergency going on and that i am ok . i hope you feel better <end>

title: <start> what to do when you feel like your brain is broken from stress <end>
response: <start> what i try to do is to simplify the stress . it might sound crazy , but if you are overthinking or freaking out then trying to simplify the stress can help calm the brain . i try to do that when i have a huge stress on me and then i go to sleep . i wake up in the morning ready to tackle the problem . i hope this helps . . . <end>

title: <start> losing control of my life rant <end>
response: <start> if it makes you feel any better , i feel the same way . i am a junior in high school right now and i am unbelievably stressed . freshman year and sophomore year i was depressed and did not care about anything but going home and playing video games , and my grades showed it . over the summer i realized that i needed to change my life drastically , which i succeeded in i forced myself to be more social , join clubs , and started learning a couple new musical instruments . at the same time , this school year i chose a couple of ap classes to challenge myself , and that forced me to learn time management skills . i have had great grades so far , but at the cost of my happiness i have essentially no free time now , and , as an introvert , i find myself simply wishing to be alone for more than minutes . now i have chosen to take an ap exam , which requires me to create a large project that i worry i will not have time to do . i am insanely stressed about school , my social life , and just trying to balance everything in general . i do not know what i can say to help , but just know you are not alone . <end>

title: <start> why am i doing this <end>
response: <start> hey i know exactly how you feel because i used to be the same way in high school , especially my last two years . i am also a freshman in college and i can say that i have really come a long way i do not want to sound insensitive at all , but what i want to tell you is that better days are ahead of you . they are coming and will always be there . life is not always the same . i know you feel this way right now and so did i . but then i came to college and my life has drastically changed over a year . your feelings are valid , but never think poorly of yourself . there is nothing wrong in staying by yourself . i know that it always seems like people who are out there living their lives are the happiest ones , but trust me , deep inside everyone is fighting their own struggles . this is not to compare yours to anyone else s but i just wanted to point out that everyone has those days and moments . keep your head up and realize that you are more than enough . it was not until coming to college when i realized that i have so much to offer to people around me and that i had all this hidden potential that i never thought i had back in high school . i know your journey is different from mine , but regardless you have your own unique qualities that no one else does . i hope that you do come across opportunities in college where you will realize in small bits how special you are in your way . i know i am an internet stranger , but feel free to message me i genuinely hope the best for you . remember that you are special and have a lot to offer to the world you live in . <end>

title: <start> messed up at work and do not know how to tell my boss <end>
response: <start> i find it helps to just look at the situation objectively , and ask questions can this be easily corrected can you correct it on your own if it can not be corrected , what is the impact it does not sound like this will have any negative impact . tell your boss what happened , explain the system froze and therefore the error . if your boss cannot accept that then quite frankly they are not worth working for i work in a rather intense environment and make silly mistakes all the time , but i attempt to fix them as soon as possible and inform others who may be impacted by it and then move on . we are not robots . the key thing is how you can resolve a forced or unforced error . do not beat yourself up . this varies from place to place , but if you are worried for your job over a couple silly errors then honestly that place sounds toxic . the people i respect most in my workplace are those who fuck up and then own up to it and immediately go about fixing it , it is something i value in a colleague more than anything else . do not run to the bosses with every error , you need to judge the importance of an error on your own terms and whether it needs reporting . this is also important for your overall career growth . <end>

title: <start> can anxiety stress because these types of memory issues <end>
response: <start> being in an abusive relationship , and dealing with stress of unimaginable levels , along with stress induced insomnia . . . i have gotten so much brain fog i have to say hum ever rd word , life will also feel like a haze . i used to always be drained no matter how much sleep i got . stress reduction is so hard to master . i currently got a better job , i walk about away from situations where people are obviously over exaggerating yelling about certain things . i try to always keep my cool . i use to be a very angry teenager , but these days i am exactly the opposite . i am as level headed as can be . one thing i can not stress enough for my case least is always carry your sence of dignity . when i feel like i am less than , or am being made to feel as such , i assert my dignity . i try to always live like i am sure of myself . when i am not and still am very often i ask myself what feels right , and what feels like an obligation these things are not mutually exclusive , but when they are doing what you feel is right for you is the better choice . getting the new job i got , that is not physically mentally demanding , something i enjoy , a place to be free from the world . it fits me . find something that fits you . do not sit and wait for change . strive for it . i came from an abusive neglecting home , and until i was able to get out i was constantly stressed . i am in a pretty bad point in my relationship , but feeling in control more has helped me a lot . good luck man pm me with questions , i will be happy to answer . or just to talk . i feel like i have a long way to go in stress reduction , but i have came so much further than i ever thought i would . i can say even in my struggles . i am happy . <end>

title: <start> things i wish i knew <end>

response: <start> people do not define you . you can cry if you must , you should not keep your feelings somewhere deep inside you , it will just make you worse . crying helps releases hormones which helps you relax . i am usually called a thick skinned because i do not get offended easily nor do i care what other people say because i am very confident . whatever they say will not define me or change me whatsoever in the future or present right crying is not weak , it is a sign you need to relax more or you just have enough . you are strong , you held it in right but release it , it might really help . nobody is perfect , and everyone is different from each other . some are meant to stand out and some are meant to blend in . does not mean you are different , you should listen to what other people have to say knowing they lack their own reality . ask for help when needed , do not get embarrassed , trying is never wrong do stuff you love , take their insults as a joke knowing they can not possibly do sh t to you , love yourself and you will someday become a much more powerful self . <end>

title: <start> i need some tips on reliving stress <end>
response: <start> mental fatigue can have a huge impact on your productivity . if you are like me , thinking about everything , especially negative thoughts can exhaust your brain , leaving you feeling physically exhausted . when this happens to me , and trust me , i have done some fucked up shit causing some sort of post traumatic episodes mixed in with guilt and anxiety . the best thing for me is cognitive behavioral change . instead of the bad stuff , i try to focus on the wonderful good in my life and how i was given a second chance . try to not focus on any thoughts , meditate if you can get into the zone . go outside and feel the breeze and look at the wonderful nature outside walk around and enjoy yourself . a nice shower , a candle , relaxing music anything to give yourself and your brain to settle obsessive thoughts . focus on what you can control , not stuff that is out of your hands or situations you cannot go back and change . make a list , add small stuff first such as , showering or brushing your teeth . check off your list and get into the motion of being productive in a small way . the best thing for me is a clean house , bedroom and bathroom . i enjoy cooking and listening to music while my candle is lit i am a guy . do not be too hard on yourself . do not overthink . take one step at a time . and just remember , everything will be okay . good luck and hang in there <end>

title: <start> how do i manage to keep up with my tight schedule and not break down <end>
response: <start> take a breath . write down everything you need to do in the next however many weeks . then , write out a schedule for how you will approach these things . right now these are your priority . other things may come up but you need to decide if they are more important . take that list and schedule your studying out daily . then take things one at a time . reward yourself with a min break for completing things . also , study for min , break for , and do that rotation times then take a longer min break . this is a more effective way to study . that minute break is important so force yourself to stop after min for a break . finally , take a breath again . in a month you are going to be so much more stress free and think hell yeah i did that . i have been in those situations and they suck in the moment but i can not tell you how many of these i have gotten through and now i am at a point that i recognize it will pass . you will not fail out . in fact you seem extremely motivated and smart and you are going to do great things . it all pays off . so again , take a breath , make a list , and get to it . reward yourself and recognize the progress you have made . you got this edit also , if necessary , explain your situation to teachers and ask for an extension . even if they say no , they recognize that you care . <end>

title: <start> all of them <end>
response: <start> well it sounds like you should work with an anger management professional in person and people on reedit can not help you as much as a professional you see regularly . that will be by far , your most effective strategy . however , i do have a couple suggestions to help you get started . first off , i strongly recommend you try meditating twice per day for minute sessions . once in the morning , once in the evening . do that for a month straight , and see how you feel . then , continue it for another month . and another . it will not completely fix your anger problems of course , but it will help rewire your brain to be less susceptible to stress , and it will also reduce your risk of heart disease and provide some much needed mental relaxation . it also helps to get a meditation partner , if you can . that way , you guys can hold each other accountable and make it a daily habit . if you are new to meditation , try this . http www . mindful . org how to meditate as far as snapping at people , i would recommend to catch yourself before an outburst , internally acknowledge your anger , and then instead , dig deeper into what the person is saying , and why they are saying it . too often , people s intentions get misconstrued as offensive , when that is not how they meant it . maybe the person was simply trying to provide feedback to help you improve , or making some playful comment they did not realize was offensive to you . i would recommend next time you find yourself in that situation , notice the anger , and acknowledge it . in nap , they even recommend giving it a color , texture and name ie , red , coarse , outburst or magenta , foggy , rage . if you need to remove yourself for a few minutes , do so . but always try to see the message behind what the person is saying , instead of seeing it as an attack . make them feel acknowledged by saying something along the lines of that is a valid point . can you tell me more always seek to understand the other person s point of view without judging yourself , them or the situation . chances are , no one is actually trying to upset you , so it is good to see the situation as objectively as possible and realize they are trying to address an issue or somehow communicate to you , not personally attack you . <end>

title: <start> stressing over the future <end>
response: <start> well if it makes you feel any better , i was not the best student in school . i went to community college , had no direction in life , and eventually got my bachelors degree . i now work in a field where i am going to make six figures in a few years , and i am building myself as an entrepreneur . no one has their life figured out at even the people who think they do . but that is the beauty of life you try something , then adjust , then try something new , then adjust , etc . only about of people stay in careers which they studied for in college . and most jobs care way less about your gap and college major than you may realize . just show up and be your best self every day . that is it . i am turning this april , and that is by far the most valuable lesson i learned over the past decade . i also believe society has it backwards you can not be expected to figure your life out when you are . my advice is that you can go to community college . or volunteer abroad at the peace corps . or join the armed services , who will both give you tons of life experience , living abroad experience and pay for your college looking back , i actually wish i considered joining an armed services branch at for those reasons . then , enroll in college at , or hell , even . there is far less of a rush to attend college than you may realize i speak from firsthand experience . trust me , things may not seem this way right now . but they are better than you realize p . s . gary vaynerchuck , arnold schwartenegger and richard brandon were also not very good students . the first two went to average universities no one heard of , and richard did not go to college at all . one of them is an insanely famous actor , and the other two are multi billionaires . if you need anything else , message me <end>

title: <start> me , my mom , and my dad are extremely stressed due to our douche of a landlord <end>
response: <start> i am sorry you and your parents are going through all this . housing stress is one of the worst types of stress there is because it turns your whole life upside down . this is definitely an appropriate place to share your story , but you might also try posting to r legaladvice http www . reedit . com r legaladvice . i am not a lawyer , but i am certain what your landlord is doing is illegal . if there is a good place to have the problems you are having , it is california because it has some of the strongest tenant laws in the country . your landlord is required to make certain repairs related to the habitability of your house , such as fixing the heater and plumbing . if he does not make them in a timely manner , you can withhold rent until he does . giving you three days to leave is also definitely illegal . most states require days notice . your parents should call a lawyer who specializes in landlord tenant issues , if for no other reason than it might buy you some time to find a new place . oftentimes , a strongly worded letter from a lawyer is enough to make a jerk like your landlord think twice about what he is doing . if you can not afford a lawyer , try reaching out to an organization like the housing rights center http www . arc la . org doc . asp id or legal aid http lafa . org help services housing and eviction . i do not know anything about these organizations other than what i read in a few minutes of research . law schools can also be good resources for free legal assistance , as many of them have clinics http law . upla . ed student life student organizations el centro legal clinics landlord tenant clinic dedicated to helping people in need . the point is there are people who can help you , and the law is on your side . good luck , and hang in there . <end>

title: <start> stressed with people <end>
response: <start> i am sorry you are getting stressed with people , but i completely understand . the options for you depend on your personal mentality . i can tell you what has worked for me in the past . puzzles , word search , sodoku , drawing , hobbies in general , working out getting physical , spending time away from people in general , music in one ear so you can tune out or just feel less surrounded , reading , watching couture videos , basically anything that can help you clear your head . or , you can flip the script , start studying human psychology . start asking weird questions , like if you notice someone is acting antsy , ask them why . look for things that make people act differently . that way you can change the way you see the people you are forced to interact with and even manipulate them into behaving in a more favorable light . that last bit needs a lot of practice and is not for everyone . be very careful when you are studying and trying to flip the script on people , there is always someone better at it than you . people are puzzles . <end>

title: <start> my boyfriend is suicidal and i do not know what to do . <end>
response: <start> i am so sorry you are going through this . you may need to go to the hospital emergency for this one , if you are both afraid for his life if he is alone this needs to be addressed immediately . you can call suicide hotline first if you feel like it may make you more comfortable , but you can not realistically stay with him every moment of the day . you need to seek help , and it is best for both of you not to wait any longer . i am saying this from experience . i had to bring my dad in to the hospital ontario as well on occasions because he was going to take his life . they kept him for about a week each time , helped him adjust his medications and enrolled him in programs to attend afterwards . it was not easy , but it was what he needed . he still struggles , but he has gained the ability to reach out for help when he needs it . please help your boyfriend do the same if you can . <end>

response: <start> you will have plenty of time with him in the hospital during visiting hours , and he should be trying his best to sleep overnight . i am not trying to be harsh when i say this , but this is a journey he needs to take with himself . i am so happy to know that he has such a wonderful support system , but if he can not be alone with himself then i can not see how he can improve . also , i can understand that he would be nervous or against medications , but so was my dad and others i know suffering with depression , anxiety and suicidal thoughts , and each of them have admitted to me that after trial and error with different medications they have found the balance they needed to function . either way , if he is in crisis and worried that he will harm or kill himself , you should both be more concerned about that then possible side effects of medications . please get help , i wish the best for all of you . <end>

title: <start> i am feeling very overwhelmed by my college classes . <end>
response: <start> i have been here before and it is not a good place to be in because things can keep spiraling out of control . my advice is to cut everything out of your schedule that is not class homework related , at least for a week or two if you can . you want to get a hold on this as soon as possible . that way you can be caught up , and have time to think about how to plan your days going forward so this does not happen again . although it is annoying having to do school work instead of clubs or during downtime weekends , it will be better for you in the long run to gain control of this sooner rather than later . also if you think your lack of motivation might be caused by something deeper , i would go to the counseling center at your school . if they deem it appropriate , they can probably give you accommodations . i have accommodations that let my teachers know sometimes i might miss class or be late on assignments i have to discuss this with each teacher individually and come to an agreement with them on how many absences are allowed how long assignment extensions will be . if you think your class load is just too much , i would recommend dropping a class if you can . it would be better to take the extra class during a summer winter term then failing it and having to take it again due to an overloaded class schedule . you only have so much time in a day . message me if you need more advice <end>

response: <start> here s what works for me i had a tm mouth piece given by my dentist . helped a lot , but i stopped using it be sure it started hurting my gums . pro relived my jaw and corrected my bite maybe around months i also liked the feeling of wearing for a long time and not being able to close my jaw that way i usually do con not very long term also , it was a little pricey second is basically just being mindful . i constantly try to remind myself to put my tongue between my upper and lower front teeth . . . and open my jaw enough to fit the tip of my finger . this meant having to push my lower jaw forward a little . teeth should not touch unless you are chewing food . pro it helps long term really helps bringing bottom . jaw just a little bit forward con you have to build the habit another tip is resting and slightly pushing the tip of your tongue behind your top front teeth for seconds or more . . . your jaw will go back it is it is proper position . my dentist also recommended massaging some of my muscles from my jaw to my sternocleidomastoid basically it is a particular muscle in the neck <end>

response: <start> stay with the appeal . do not give up . this is sop . it will take a while but fill out the appeal out properly and prepare for your phone interview . take it seriously without being to wordy . nobody cares how you feel or what you think your boss was thinking . facts only . it is fairly easy to make the facts fit a narrative . it is the same thing the company did to you . hash out responses to questions you think they will ask . when they approve your claim you will get all the weeks you missed and then be qualified . <end>

title: <start> mental health day <end>
response: <start> we each have unique , individual experiences so we try not to generalize or give pat answers as to what gives us those moments , hours , days , weeks , months , or years or on off challenges . we are complex structure of biological and metaphysical organisms and soulful cognitive spirits where any one of the pieces can misfire or take us down let alone all our parts just not jiving with the other . however , sometimes the simple answer is the right answer . you may simply be tired and taking a mental health day from work is exactly the right answer . try to breathe and find the centralizing thoughts or activities that bring you peace and calm . peace to you . . . <end>
