title: <start> a little story of my stressful experiences <end>
response: <start> hey , i get it . i have been there . almost the exact situation with a few slight differences . here s my feedback . . focus your attention on yourself . you are taking ap classes , holding down a job , and planning for college . that is great . it is perfectly fair to worry about student debt . you should . take some time to apply for scholarships , grants , etc . anything to make it more affordable . also , stop looking so far ahead . you might get to college and realize you are interested in something else that only requires a or year degree . it happens all the time . your future will not be miserable unless you let it get that way . in regards to the girlfriend stuff , let it work itself out . it sounds like you are in high school still . if it is meant to work out it will . as you get older you will realize how tricky relationships are . there are a lot of variables to consider . do not let a girlfriend be your purpose in life . do not let anyone be your source of happiness because it is not sustainable . also , i am sorry you got cheated on . nothing violates a persons ability to trust like a cheater . do not let it hurt your future relationships . be mature enough to forgive her but do not make the same mistake twice . just keep swimming . stop convincing yourself that the future is miserable . if you start to believe it , it will happen . last thing . handle that stuff with the state trooper as soon as possible pay the fines , show up to court , be presentable and respectful , admit to your mistakes and hopefully they will erase the offense . depending on what the issue was , it could effect federal student aid or scholarships . you are kinda at their mercy so just do the right thing and you will be fine . you sounds like a good kid . good luck to you <end>

title: <start> stress response and reaction <end>
response: <start> it seems like there is a mental barrier for you that many people go through . although this is probably not the answer you want to hear but one of the best solutions is to push through it . commit to what you want to achieve . this can become a healthy habit . with what seems like a mental roadblock that prevents you from being productive , is actually a bad habit . you need to get the willpower to push past it and do what you plan to do . after some time , this will begin a new habit , a habit a dedication and determination . it is shit when you have to do it but it is worth the struggle to overcome this ideally that is set in your mind . if you need to , you can set up post it notes or something with whatever you plan to do written on them . place these in spots that you know you will see and then you will begin to feel obligated to perform these said actions . likewise , you can set alarms on your phone with what you need to do so you can attempt to get on track . even get your friends or someone to verbally remind you of your activity . i hope this helped <end>

title: <start> hobby stress <end>
response: <start> i have the exact same issue . my hobbies stress me out like crazy , if i do not spend my time on a hobby i deem as productive way of spending time , i also feel terrible about myself is netflix , browsing the internet i enjoy my hobbies i feel great doing them but i get stressed about trying to do them . that stress causes me to go for mind numbing options . for me it has two causes , i start becoming too perfectionistic and i have anxiety regarding it . framing them as something that needs to be done regularly , forcing it too much , trying too hard to keep a schedule all leads to stress and not doing any of it . i do not have a solution yet , and i am still working on it . but it is the stress that is the main killer , leading me to self destructive behavior . i try to make a conscious effort to change the way i think . remind myself how i feel when doing my hobbies , how it is giving me joy doing them etc . also setting the bar lower . if i plan to play the piano everyday i get stressed and then do not do it at all . so alternative is , at least minutes , make a conscious effort to think about the positive feeling i have doing it . or let us say times a week , if i still feel stressed , then even less . time a week etc . setting the bar lower and lower helps but seriously having that as the main goal , not secretly hoping for more that makes it easy to feel good since everything planned got done and helps rebuilding a positive relationship tythe hobbies . i still have not quite managed though , because i keep slipping back into the all or nothing thinking . old habits die hard , i guess it takes effort and work but at some point it will come with ease keep trying . and catch yourself beating yourself up for not doing th productive and reframe it . also reframe the should into wants etc <end>

response: <start> hey there i am no professional but here is what you can do to reduce stress . . since you have multiple tests and i assume you are not prepared for all of them , focus on the ones you know you can make a decent grade or at least pass with the time at your hand . . you can do the ones where there are no chances for you to make it this time in future when you are more experienced to deal with college . . study hard but keep an hour out of the day for yourself . it can be anything like jogging , casual reading , an episode of your favorite television series . it will make you feel better and give a semblance of not having to do something especially taxing . . start maintaining a diary henceforth so that if you are about to enter this clutter again in future your present self can look for guidance from the past . . start talking to your professors in their visiting hours they have seen numerous students that go through the same thing and have the best advice to offer . wish you all the best for your exams . <end>

title: <start> i do not eat because of school stress <end>
response: <start> hey there , when i was a senior in hs i dealt with this . i was way too busy with ap classes , abusive relationship , and i would not eat until dinner time most nights . i realized that i had a problem after seeing how much weight i lost . my advice to you is to purposefully eat . so get a food journal or use the note app on your phone and log when you have to eat . just start small and eating healthy usually helps . eating more nutritious and fiber rich food will keep you fuller longer and is just more healthy . i am a sophomore in college now , and i make it a point to eat , even if i am not that hungry since i do not eat while i am stressed . best of luck to you , and if you need anything feel free to pm me . <end>

title: <start> how do you let go <end>
response: <start> some things i feel sure of mentioning are that it is important to celebrate your accomplishments , even if they are far from your ultimate goals , and not let yourself undermine them . it is awesome that you have paid off that much debt and you should feel proud knowing that you have been a positive force in your kids life . i tend to let the bad overwhelm the good , but subtle choices to not beat yourself down might help alleviate your stress . i am not saying to start lying to yourself , but there is a happy medium between being realistic and being delusional . categorize what you can and can not control and try to release what you can not . every day that you go to work , no matter how crappy , take comfort in the fact that you are using something you can control to change your circumstance , even if it is not quickly . i do not know how realistic it is for you , but maybe consider looking for another job . you will not know if there is something better out there unless you try . if that seems too scary stressful then give yourself more credit . while the transition might be rough , bettering your circumstances would probably do wonders for other aspects of your life . even with your life being slammed , i hope you have some outlet to take care of yourself and do something you enjoy . whether that is physical exercise , some spiritual practice , reading , podcast , music , baths , movies , a clean living space , whatever works . in the interest of preventing burnout and being the best mom employee you can be , take care of yourself . ink , i hope some of this is helpful . motivational rant over . i wish you the best and i hope venting a little helped . <end>

title: <start> corporate world stress <end>
response: <start> there is a saying that goes by never give up . there is also a saying that goes know when to quit . i think the second one suits this situation right about now . life is short . real short . the average life span is what , years maybe in the s for some people . you are years old right now which means , at most , you have got years of life ahead of you . do you want to spend the next years working a soul sucking job that you feel miserable at so many people in life just power through their day to day jobs , then when they hit their mid life crisis , the rest of their years are full of regret . regret that they did not do what they really wanted to do in life . which brings me to my next point . what is it you truly want to do ignore those student loans and what your parents want you to do . what is it that you have always always wanted to do pursue that . if you pursue something you truly want to do in life , something that is not going to crush your spirit , than even if you are not successful at it , at least you tried and had fun in the process . ya catch my drift let me use me as an example , even though i hate talking about myself , i feel that it is appropriate in this context . i was studying to be a mathematician in college . hated every minute of it , but i reluctantly rolled with it because . my parents wanted me to . i already invested thousands , thousands of dollars in this program . at the time , i was determined to graduate . fast forward a bit , and i decided to take an acting class on a whim . low and behold , i loved acting class so much , that i decided to become an actor . i never loved going to math class , even though i was good at it . what you are good at and what you want to do in life are two very very different things . though i am not a successful actor , i am still auditioning , i have landed some great parts , met awesome people along the way including my current so and i am a writer on the side , which is another passion of mine that i have turned into a side job seriously fuck being a waitress , it blows . am i successful in my own way , yes , but i still have a long road ahead of me . am i rich not overly so , but i am comfortable . am i happy absolutely fucking yes . as difficult as this journey has been , i know it was the best decision . i went with my gut and i chose the path that would bring the most happiness to my spirit . my parents disapproved but i said screw it , its my life . it is not anyone else s life but yours , always remember that . and i am still paying off student loans , but hey , i just treat it like a cell phone bill i have to pay every month . it will eventually get paid off and i am not going to starve myself worrying about it . here s my point . life is too short to do what you hate doing . why are you still working at a job that is making you that miserable leave it do not stick with something ever because of the money , security or because someone else wants you to live their dream . live your dream dammit . that is like being in a toxic relationship with a guy and not leaving him because he buys you gifts all the time or because you have already invested years with him or whatever . if the guy is being toxic to you in any way , you leave , right same thing here . sorry for the long reply bow hope this helps and good luck with everything ps . just know you have the power to control everything in your life . the internet is full of resources to help you out with a new career , whatever that may be . you already seem smart enough , so use it to your advantage . <end>

response: <start> hey man . i am in first year uni uk and it is awesome whenever i see a levels mentioned on reedit takes me back to last year d . when you are smart it does feel like the school has some expectations on you , and that might be true because they want students going imperial , oxbridge etc . . . but your school will be happy for you wherever you go and whatever grades you get . it is up to you to not care about what your school wants and instead focus on yourself . in reality other students are focusing on themselves and your teachers do not have high expectations they just believe in you if that makes sense . what i am saying is that it is best if you avoid thinking that other people expect you to achieve it . only your opinion and expectations matter because in university there is a shift from your school caring being the centre of attention to no one caring about you . and imo that is much better . <end>

title: <start> college is the best , but mostly the worst , thing that is ever happened to me <end>
response: <start> sorry if there are any typos my h key only works half of the time . x b i took two semesters off of college because of stress related sickness they were not back to back either . do not be afraid to take a break and just work for a semester or two to refocus and clear your head . what helped me a lot was not taking a butt load of classes all at once . i took the minimum number of credit hours required to be a full time student during my junior and senior year and took the rest of the required classes during the summer sure , the classes are more expensive , but you can take most core classes during the summer at a community college for less cost . you get less of a break , but it helped me stay in a school mindset while not being overwhelmed by assignments . i was still able to graduate on time doing this , but even if it takes you a semester or two longer than normal , its okay . everyone finishes at their own pace . also , try to take hard classes wit easy classes if you can . i purposely left some typical freshman courses for my senior year so that i had a class or two that i would not have to put as much effort into for me , these were stuff like sociology , psych , etc . x b i also suggest talking to a therapist regularly and for your case , i would also talk to a psychiatrist . i also had suicidal thoughts at some points , and being able to talk to someone helped keep me somewhat level headed . most universities offer therapy for free low cost . x b make sure you take time to eat right , exercise , and sleep right . its very basic sounding , but it makes a huge difference , and its crazy how the majority of people do not make these a priority . both my physical and mental problems did not start to improve until i worked on these even with depression medicine . also try to make time to relax even if its just an hour a day , or a night a week to hang out with friends . it is easy to think you are so busy that you have no time to relax , but that is a sure fire way to burn out . x b bottom line do not try to force yourself to work harder than is possible for you . give yourself more time if you need to , take time off if you need to . obviously , do something if you do take time off work , pick up a hobby , etc , but do not be afraid that you are failing in life if you do not go as fast as you think you should . and do not compare yourself to other people , because everyone has different circumstances . <end>

title: <start> cigarettes <end>
response: <start> i started with just one cigarette . now i have been smoking for the past years . i am kind a obsessed with my teeth and currently going through a strange situation , where i am kind a stress free and looking for ways to create stress for myself . now i am like , if i am going to freak out about my teeth , i better quit smoking . i hopefully had my last cigarette like hour ago . why i wrote those things it never stays as cigarette . you always tell yourself like oh i can quit any time , but you can not . i tried several times , quit for a few months then started again , because of the temporary relief . x b when you are stressed , just as suggested try to find something else or think about the main reason why you are so stressed . it is not a good habit . i do not care about the economic part , but health is the main reason why you should not start . x b to relieve stress , i would suggest , do not limit yourself . meaning , if there is something that you want to do , that will not harm you or others of course , do that . try new things . the thing about nicotine is that it helps brain to stimulate dopamine and then you get addicted to it . the more you smoke , the more addicted you are to it , but dopamine levels get less and less . in the end , you smoke a pack a day to get the same satisfaction . instead , try something else that would excite you . anything is better compared to cigarettes , believe me . <end>

title: <start> i look to stress myself <end>
response: <start> stress plays a really interesting role in the body . when you experience stress your brain releases chemicals into your bloodstream . over time your body develops a homeostasis , or norm with those chemicals . if you experience a change in your stress level your body almost craves those hormones and chemicals since it is so used to it being present . i am guessing your mind is creating ways for you to experience the stress and if your teeth are producing the effect it is looking for you have created a cycle . i hope that helps you better understand what is going on . <end>

title: <start> breathing again <end>
response: <start> i used to have a similar experience . i used to run k at sub pace mile , and then i encountered myself in a period of my life where i was feeling very stressed . my breathing started to become a problem . i used to wake up , and take one breath and think to myself oh i am breathing ok , and then the second breath would come and i would feel like i was short of breath . that one breath would drag the remaining day to the point where every breath was a struggle . i am a logical guy . i have a degree in comp sci with a focus on algorithm . everyone trivialized my feelings , including doctors . i cannot tell you how many times the doctors just sent me home with nothing . . . i finally had enough . i told my family i was going to visit israel and i would pay for the best doctors to do a comprehensive battery of exams to finally rule out if something is wrong with me or not . i did not want just any doctor , no , to put an end to the ordeal it had to be the doctor , head of the division type of doctor . long story short , after an intensive day of exams the doctor explained to me clearly that what i was experiencing is called sigh breathing and that is mostly in my head but with real physical manifestations like yours . i told to myself that if after all these exams things would come out positive , that i was going to persevere and fight these symptoms and so i did . i started running a mile here and there , and then two , and then four and the pace picked up and the breathing naturally had to adjust . stress has serious , extremely real , side effects in our body . between the pain post surgery , and the ordeal the sigh breathing caused me , i would choose physical pain of surgery . rest . relax your mind . you are stronger than you think . <end>
